story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Tamara Shiloh and I'm really very excited about this series of children's books. Black History is American/U.S. History and my books will assist teachers with incorporating Black History into their social studies, American history and/or U.S. History curriculum without having to change anything.

I think it's unfair that children aren't learning a more complete version of American history. Black children need to learn more about their history to provide them with options for careers and positive role models.

Black History children's books open up students to different experiences and perspectives so they can share with one another. It gives them a better sense of how America came to be.

Remember, helping me helps kids. I'd like to get these books into as many children's hands and libraries across the nation that I can.

These books will undeniably benefit all students through the inclusion of voices that rarely make the curricular cut.

Remember, children are not born racists, it's a learned behavior. The more they know, they more they grow.

What We Need & What You Get

Your funding will help with the printing and marketing of the series. We have a lot of children and libraries to reach and  with your help, we'll have a good start.

We have developed fun stuff for children and teachers to keep them engaged with Black History. The coloring book has the inventors and inventions; the work/puzzle book is packed full of puzzles and writing exercises and quizzes about the book; and Jaxon's journal follows his day as he describes his meetings with the inventors and scientists.

The Impact

Wow! I didn't know that!  Did you know that?! I can't explain how wonderful these two statements make me feel when I hear them after I share some of the inventions of African Americans. I'm sure children will feel the same way when they read about an invention they didn't know came from an African American. We're trying to dispel as many assumptions as we can about American History.

It's a fun series and book one is coming your way soon!

Risks & Challenges

So, what if I don't make my goal? Well, that's not an option. I will make my goal with your help. And, if for some unheard of reason I don't make my goal, the project will still move on. Just at a slower pace - but it will happen. Our children need these books and so do you.

If you are unable to contribute, maybe you know someone who would be willing to. Please share our project with as many friends and family you can. I'd really appreciate it.

Thanks so much for your time!

Warm regards,

Tamara

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us spread the word! 

Email your friends and family, invite them to support. 

Mention this campaign in newsletters that reach parents, families, educators, and others who care about Black History, diversity and STE(A)M.

Let us know if you know any blogs or bloggers who might be interested in our books.

Thanks again!

story:
It all began as a simple art project.....

I began the Zodiac Mandala project as a way of combining my love for art and astrology. I decided to create one new mandala each zodiac season that would embody the nature of the that sign. 

"The longest journey is the journey inwards of him who has chosen his destiny." ~ Dag Hammarskjold

The project was truly life changing for me. I had no idea what it would turn into when I started it. Working through the pattern of the zodiac in alignment with nature and in a self reflective manner was incredibly profound. Not only did I learn about myself and my own internal cyclical patterns, I also learned so much more about the language of astrology than any book could've taught me. My teacher always told me that the best way to learn about astrology is by observing nature. So by observing both the outside world around me and my own internal world, I came to a deeper understanding of the language of astrology and my relationship to it.

After one year I had an entire mandala representation of the zodiac. But the project did not feel complete. It wasn't enough to just keep these drawings and all their lessons to myself. I realized I needed to be able to share this experience with others in order to share the wisdom and healing that working through the zodiac cycle offers.

I created this book to take you on a self reflective journey to guide you back into your heart and your unique creative power. It begins in a space of prayerful intention setting and then you begin to take movement, traveling through the growth cycle of the zodiac wheel. 

The book is divided into twelve sections, one for for each zodiac sign. Within each section, you'll find:

  • Writings on the teachings that each sign brings and why it operates in the way it does based on its placement in the cycle.
  • Examples of different ways the energy manifests in nature and our lives.
  • Ways to integrate the lessons of the sign and work with them in your life.
  • Reflection questions aimed to turn your attention inward so you can feel how you embody the energy of the sign. Questions to help you determine what your relationship is like with this astrological force and to help you work through the development and manifestation of your intention at each specific stage of the growth cycle.
  • Mantras that invoke the energy of the sign within you.
  • The blank mandala representing the energy of the sign for you to color while you are reflecting on the questions.

"We don't receive wisdom; we must discover it for ourselves after a journey that no one can take for us or spare us." ~ Proust​

This book is a reflection of how I work with the zodiac signs and their evolutionary pattern. By working through this cycle with intention in a creative and reflective way, I have come to find so much healing for myself. Learning the language of astrology has helped me heal and mend old thought patterns and karmic stories, understand my complex emotional cycles, gain new insight and perspective on my true path I am meant to walk, and develop a better understanding of the people in my life, ultimately nurturing healthier relationships. It has changed my life in such a positive and drastic way that I want to share the teachings with others who wish to embark down their own healing path.

Everything we need to get this Project moving forward:

The book is complete and is going through the final stages of editing. This is where your contributions come in! In order for me to get the book published I need to have a certain number of books printed and stored, and I also need to set up a system for global distribution and selling online. Here is a breakdown of what I need the funds for:

  • $200 for ISBN and copyrights
  • $1600 for global distribution (this allows me to get my book on Amazon and in retail stores all over the world!)
  • $600 for a "Buy direct from the author" website 
  • $5000 for 500 copies of the book to be printed and stored in a warehouse (that is the minimum amount of books I can order at a time)
  • $400 for the shipping of 500 books to warehouse
  • $200 Indiegogo fees

Any amount (even if I don't reach my goal) helps tremendously and will be put towards the publishing of this book. Any money raised that exceeds my goal will go towards printing more copies of the book and publishing more of my mandala art with the world. It will also go towards the production of the next reflective mandala book I want to create (a book with mandalas representing each of the planets in astrology and reflecting on their teachings!)

The Perks!

To thank you for your donations, I've put together some awesome perks. Included in the donations are:

  • A digital download of a zodiac mandala of your choice to print and color
  • Up to 8 copies of the book when it is printed
  • Astrological Advice: You get the opportunity to ask me anything you need clarity or insight on in your life right now and I will take a look at your chart and give you some insightful astrological advice to help guide you
  • Up to two 2 Hour long Astrology Consultations with me
  • Custom zodiac mandala mugs and shirts
  • Extra digital downloads of non zodiac mandalas that I have already created for you to print out and color
  • A brand new, original mandala art piece created and framed just for you
  • A year long Astrological Coaching session

 

What are you contributing to?

My hope is to spread the healing power of astrology to as many people as possible and your donation is contributing directly to that healing. 

I believe that at this point in time there is a lot of healing that needs to happen in our world. As a species we've become disconnected from the Earth and by doing that, we've become disconnected from ourselves. 

"But, young friend (and no matter your age, to me you are young), of all the days I have witnessed, today -- your day -- is the most unhappy. I see it in the faces I meet on sidewalks and in the voices I hear in your cities. Mother Earth has never been more crowded, yet her inhabitants have never been more lonely." ~ The Seven Paths

The only way to heal the world around us is by healing ourselves. We need to bring our awareness back down into our hearts. We need to connect into our spiritual truth and our life's purpose. We need to find harmony within ourselves and our relationship to all of inhabitants we share this life with. What that healing will ultimately look like is going to be different for everyone! 

That's why I love astrology. Because there are so many different truths out there, so many different manifestations of love and finding harmony. And all those differences are what make life so beautiful! But when you take away the layers, underneath you'll find that they all stem from the same places. They all share the same themes. Astrology gives us the underlying framework for all of life. It connects us to those deeper and universal themes that we all share. In that way, when we begin to cultivate a relationship with these common themes we can develop a better sense of connection to others and the world around us. But we also can choose from an infinite amount of possibilities for how we want those universal themes to show up in our own life! I absolutely love seeing all the different ways these teachings and themes manifest themselves through different people.

“Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life.” ~ Pablo Picasso

At my core I consider my self an artist. Ever since I began studying astrology three and a half years ago, I have come to discover what a beautiful art form astrology really is. It shifts your lens of perception and opens your eyes to all of the beauty and magic that this life has to offer. It allows you to see the connectedness in all of Nature and shows you how all of life moves,as it dances through cyclical patterns.

I believe art is such a powerful tool for healing and an essential part of our human life. And we are all artists. By tapping into our creativity we tap into our heart. And we are meant to be creative with our lives and with ourselves! We are the artists and our lives are the canvas. 

We all have a direct relationship with the forces that are at play within our lives. We all have the power to create and manifest the life we want to live and the person we want to become. By understanding our direct and unique relationship with the astrological forces within our lives, we can work with them and color them however we wish to see them!

Thank you so much for your support and your contributions!

Please share this campaign using the Indiegogo share tools with your friends and family, and anyone you think might enjoy or benefit from the healing power of astrology.

And if you're not able to contribute at this time, no worries! You can still help out by sharing this with someone else who might want to donate or pre-order the book.

Also, be sure to check out the blog: http://innermandalamedicine.com/

Started by my soul sister Lyz Krieger and myself, Inner Mandala Medicine is a blog and a healing collective meant to share the tools necessary to help each person find their own unique Mandala. You can also support by finding us on facebook and instagram and following us!

My deepest gratitude to all of you.

One Love,

Megan Ryan Walsh

"May all beings everywhere with whom we are inseparably connected, be fulfilled, awakened, liberated and free. May there be peace in this world and throughout the entire universe, and may we all together complete the spiritual journey." ~ Lama Surya Das

story:
Indiegogo Continues as InDemand

Thank you to everyone who supported the original Indiegogo campaign. For anyone who missed the original campaign, you can still order an e-book, print book, commemorative cover, or list your Excel service in the back of the book. 

Short Summary

As the host of MrExcel.com, I've written a lot of books about Excel. I like to have fun with my books, often with unusual titles and covers.
As I was growing up in the 70's and 80's, there were plenty of examples of books, films, and record albums coming out with Roman numerals: Led Zeppelin II, Chicago III, Rocky IV, Star Wars Episode V.
I am about to write my 40th Excel book. About a year ago, it struck me that the Roman numeral for 40 is XL. My books are about Excel. XL. Excel. Get it? I thought it would be funny if my 40th Excel book was titled MrExcel XL ...as in =ROMAN(40). 

In honor of my XLth book - I am collaborating with the original Indiegogo supporters to come up with the 40 (XL) greatest Excel tips. 

As this idea coalesced, I wanted a full-color glossy book. Well illustrated with custom artwork. Something fun and short. I've written plenty of 5 pound books and books with 512 (DXII?) Excel tips. This book will feature the 40 (XL!) best Excel tips. Something you can flip through in less than an hour (LX Minutes) and something that will save you XL hours a year.

The Impact

You can help me create a really useful and fun Excel book. White collar productivity could skyrocket using the tips in this book.

  • You can help fund the extra cost to do the book in color.
  • Crowd-sourcing which tips make the cut for the 40 best Excel tips will provide a book that appeals to a wider range of people.
  • I've published a lot of books before. I can get this done, but your help will make it a stellar book.

Risks & Challenges

This book will be produced on glossy color paper at Hess Print Solutions in Brimfield Ohio. They are experts at color printing in the U.S.  The complexity of printing a book in color requires extra four times as many printing plates and lots of extra "make-ready" paper as they work to get the registration marks lined up.

One looming risk is the rumored release of Office 16 during the second half of 2015. This book needs to be done and printed before the industry starts printing updated books. I want to get this book written and to layout during the month of January so we don't run into scheduling conflicts as other Office books rush to market.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please pass this project on to other people who love Excel. Use the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
Women In Voice is a Brisbane performing arts institution.   

Women in Voice started its journey with an intimate concert in an alternative café in West End in 1993.

Now, twenty-two years later, it is arguably the longest constantly running local production in Brisbane’s history and a much-loved feature of our music and theatre landscape. Along the way it has unearthed and supported some of the country’s most successful performing artists and performed in some of the country’s finest theatres.

WIV's success lies in its focus on the support of each artist’s unique work. It does not just create an opportunity for an artist to share their voice, it encourages them to find their unique voice. The power of Women In Voice lies in embracing unity through diversity.

WIV ignores preconceived structures and conventions for women performing artists and creates its own. It rejoices in saying: Yes, Christine Johnston, dressing in an icecream cone and singing a black Sabbath song is a great idea. Yes, Kate Miller Heidke, singing your original song about how everyone keeps telling you, you should go on bloody Australian Idol is fantastic. Yes, Alison St Ledger, you’d make a great Elvis impersonator. Yes, Chrissy Amphlett, singing new songs that are worlds away from your famous rock hits is a great idea. Yes, Katie Noonan, singing duets with your mum would be awesome. Yes, Carita Farrer Spencer using puppet pets to sniff your crotch as you sing cabaret would really work! Yes, Pearly Black, everyone will love Bulgarian folk songs once they’ve heard them sung by you. Yes, Liz Buchanan you’d make a great Queen Elizabeth I … this list could go on for hours.


If Only There Was a Book!

It's time to tell this story, in both pictures and words, in more detail:

  • This campaign will fund the writing, design, editing and publishing of the first run of Finding Our Voice: The Story Of Women In Voice.
  • We will produce a full-colour, coffee-table book that will give a behind-the-scenes glimpse into the long and fascinating story of the show and the personalities and performers who have made Women In Voice such an enduring part of the Brisbane cultural landscape for over two decades.
  • Relive all your favourite on-stage moments and you'll never have to wonder again which of the many women in Women In Voice appeared in which show.
  

Why we need your help now...

By pre-ordering your book through this campaign (and, especially, by adding one of the other perks on offer) you will be making a huge difference:

  • Publishing a book such as this is a very time-consuming and costly process.
  • By helping us to cover some of these expenses upfront, you will be supporting the entire process from the writing and design through to the printing costs.
  • Every dollar raised, even if we are lucky enough to exceed our initial target, will ensure that we are able to create a product of the highest quality (without using up too many favours in the process) - the more pre-orders the merrier!
  • Please note that campaign currency (and perks) are all in US dollars, to enable credit card payments as well as PayPal.

Other ways to get involved.

There are so many people, and loyal fans, who have been a part of the Women In Voice story over the years and we need your help:

  • If you haven't already please like our facebook page and share our updates about the book with your friends.
  • Please spread the word about this campaign so that when we do a call out we can gather as many great stories and photos as possible from the WIV community to ensure we end up with the most colourful and lively book possible.

Now, twenty-two years later, it is arguably the longest constantly running local production in Brisbane’s history and a much-loved feature of our music and theatre landscape. Along the way it has unearthed and supported some of the country’s most successful performing artists and performed in some of the country’s finest theatres.
WIV's success lies in its focus on the support of each artist’s unique work. It does not just create an opportunity for an artist to share their voice, it encourages them to find their unique voice. The power of Women In Voice lies in embracing unity through diversity.
WIV ignores preconceived structures and conventions for women performing artists and creates its own. It rejoices in saying: Yes, Christine Johnston, dressing in an icecream cone and singing a black Sabbath song is a great idea. Yes, Kate Miller Heidke, singing your original song about how everyone keeps telling you, you should go on bloody Australian Idol is fantastic. Yes, Alison St Ledger, you’d make a great Elvis impersonator. Yes, Chrissy Amphlett, singing new songs that are worlds away from your famous rock hits is a great idea. Yes, Katie Noonan, singing duets with your mum would be awesome. Yes, Carita Farrer Spencer using puppet pets to sniff your crotch as you sing cabaret would really work! Yes, Pearly Black, everyone will love Bulgarian folk songs once they’ve heard them sung by you. Yes, Liz Buchanan you’d make a great Queen Elizabeth I … this list could go on for hours.



If Only There Was a Book! It's time to tell this story, in both pictures and words, in more detail:  This campaign will fund the writing, design, editing and publishing of the first run of Finding Our Voice: The Story Of Women In Voice.
We will produce a full-colour, coffee-table book that will give a behind-the-scenes glimpse into the long and fascinating story of the show and the personalities and performers who have made Women In Voice such an enduring part of the Brisbane cultural landscape for over two decades.  Relive all your favourite on-stage moments and you'll never have to wonder again which of the many women in Women In Voice appeared in which show.
    Why we need your help now...  By pre-ordering your book through this campaign (and, especially, by adding one of the other perks on offer) you will be making a huge difference:  Publishing a book such as this is a very time-consuming and costly process.
By helping us to cover some of these expenses upfront, you will be supporting the entire process from the writing and design through to the printing costs. Every dollar raised, even if we are lucky enough to exceed our initial target, will ensure that we are able to create a product of the highest quality (without using up too many favours in the process) - the more pre-orders the merrier!
Please note that campaign currency (and perks) are all in US dollars, to enable credit card payments as well as PayPal.    Other ways to get involved. There are so many people, and loyal fans, who have been a part of the Women In Voice story over the years and we need your help:  If you haven't already please like our facebook page and share our updates about the book with your friends. Please spread the word about this campaign so that when we do a call out we can gather as many great stories and photos as possible from the WIV community to ensure we end up with the most colourful and lively book possible.

story:
What does the Bloggess have that Bree Needs? Readers who like a little irreverent humor. Let's hook them up.

The hard work is already done. The first three novels are finished and on the market! Yay me! But now I need the funds to get them out there in front of readers.  $130 is enough for me to design a kick-ass ad and the fees to get Bree in front of the TheBloggess.com readers - a group I think understands my sense of humor, and also Bree's less than perfect path through life.

In conjunction with the add on TheBloggess.com, some other options include the Pintester.com, Bookbub.com and BlogHer.com. I'm looking into other places as well, but I'm reining myself in until I see if I can hit the first goal!

Please support me in bringing Bree to a greater audience!

Risks and challenges

There aren't many risks - the books are written and I figure if I can write three books I can design one ad. Or pay someone to design it for me... The challenge will be getting this done and up before the Christmas buying season.

story:
I love writing. This is what I've been born to do, this is what I've always dreamed of doing. It's that one thing I feel I'm kind of good at, and that one thing that allows me to be at my best as a human being.

You know, when you're able to give something to others, to offer something to this world. To change the world, to build a new one.

But, unfortunately, book sales have been incredibly low this past months. I've been trying to offer discounts, e-book bundles, but still... it wasn't enough.

I took a part-time job as a waiter, but the job was part time only in terms of pay. I didn't have time to write, and this is, simply put, the worst kind of life for a writer.

So I quit.

I wanted to be able to write, I wanted to be able to blog as often as I used to, to be able to read other people's comments.

There are no perks to go with your donations. All you get is a big perk in case I reach my goal: a compilation of essays on art and writing that will be made available for free.

This is going to be my way of thanking you for your help, and my way to give people something back.

story:
Why Write This Book?

This book, to be published by Wipf & Stock, will target philosophy and theology students. Its purpose will be to advance the fields of philosophy and theology by demonstrating that philosophy is necessary for theological thinking, as well as investigating the philosophical permeation of biblical texts. 

This book is a collaborative piece. The contributors are:

  • Jesse K. Mileo (Schoolcraft College) - Editor and Introduction
  • Dr. Douglas Groothuis (Denver Seminary) - The Logic of Theology
  • Dr. Matthew Flannagan (Independent Scholar) - Epistemological Frameworks for Theological Thinking
  • Dr. Robert O'Connor (Wheaton College) - Arguments for the Existence of God as a Theological Foundation
  • Dr. Joseph Kotva (Indiana University) - Ethics: A Theological Intrinsic
  • Jason Stanghelle (Trinity International University) - Old Testament Metaphysics
  • Dr. Alan Stanley (Brisbane School of Theology) - Gospel Ethics
  • Dr. Joseph R. Dodson (Ouachita Baptist University) - The Logic of Paul
  • Ryan M. Clevenger (Wheaton College) - Patristic Epistemology
  • Daniel J. Fick (Schoolcraft College) - Editor and Conclusion

The disciplines of both philosophy and theology will be different upon publication because this book will provide a helpful guide to identifying the link(s) between philosophical and theological thought.

What We Need & What You Get

Look to your right! Your donation will award you one (or all) of the perks!

No account needed. You can simply donate via credit card.

We need $2,000.00 to meet the financial obligations of professional copy-editing, typesetting (these costs are not covered by the Wipf & Stock imprint), and purchasing a few books to send out as review copies. Even if we don't reach our entire goal, all funds raised will go to cover these costs. No monies donated will be kept by an editor or contributor.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that some cannot contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please consider sharing this fundraising campaign through social media (e.g., Facebook, Twitter, blogosphere, etc.) or email.
  • Don't forget - you can always use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
About me

  • I'm a teenage girl and I love to write. I like watching British TV shows, listening to music and reading Jane Austen. I have always wanted to go to Great Britain.
  • I am trying to raise money so I can go to Great Britain and Ireland with my friend and her mom. We are going so my friend's mom can do research for the book she is writing. I have always wanted to travel, and going to England is my dream. I hope to do some writing while I am there, and to learn more about a place I have always imagined and thought about.
  • By funding my trip, you will help me realize a dream I had thought to be far away. I will be able to see the place I have wanted to go, and to be inspired to write more and expand my horizons.

 

What I Need & What You Get

  • I need to raise enough money to be able to go to Great Britain. My goal is $1200. I hope to be able to pay for most of my trip with the funds I get from my campaign.
  • My perks are all things I have made or written. I am a writer, so I try to incorporate writing into what I do. Everything is unique; you won't find it everywhere.
  • Even if I don't reach my goal, the funds will still go to my trip. No matter how much I make, the funds will still help.

The Impact

  • By helping me go to Great Britain, your funds will make it possible for me to begin to spread my writing farther. I plan on bringing as many zines as I can on my trip, and I will give them to lots of people and places all throughout my travels. I hope to be inspired on my travels to expand my writing, both in subject and in style.
  • My trip is already planned, I simply need to find the means to fund it. I can hardly believe that what I have thought about wistfully for years will finally happen!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Even if you can't contribute, you can help by spreading the word about my campaign!

My trip is already planned, I simply need to find the means to fund it. I can hardly believe that what I have thought about wistfully for years will finally happen!


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, you can help by spreading the word about my campaign!

story:
Thanks to our Crew!

A million thanks to our fabulous funders for making this campaign a success. We will now be able to finish production of THE TAIL GUNNER novel and preserve and share  the WWII collection that inspired it. Get more details on our project website.

The Book

Synopsis: Seventeen-year-old Sylvie Stevens is the young tail gunner’s only hope. He will never rest, never move on, unless she helps him complete his final mission. The two meet as Bish’s spirit rises from the ashes of a burning photograph, demanding that Sylvie is his conduit. Terrified yet intrigued, Sylvie learns to use her till-then-unknown abilities to tap Bish’s memories to see, and help heal, the deeper agony of his wartime past. Yes, there are the horrors and heartbreak of war, but there is also haunting hope. 


The Inspiration

Dad never talked much about World War II and never seemed to want to. After he died in 1993, my sister and I were cleaning out the hayloft of our horse barn when we made an amazing discovery; a box jammed with Dad’s WWII treasures. Even though the photographs, ephemera, letters and diary inside had fallen prey to mice, moths, and time, they were intriguing and shrouded in mystery. They made me wonder where Dad had been during the war and how each piece of this discovery fit into his past. As I began to research his collection and more facts of Dad’s life emerged­—that he and his buddy had a photo-printing shack on base on Corsica, that between 1943 and 1945 he survived 59 B-25 bomber missions as a tail gunner—I kept feeling his spirit near me. Even my little nephew insisted that he saw “Bumpa” standing by the apple tree. From all that, an idea began to form—what if ghosts could transfer memories to the living? How would that happen? In pursuit of this idea, and the desire to make sense of my father’s unspoken past, the supernatural novel THE TAIL GUNNER was born. 

 

About S.T. Lile

S. T. Lile, author and creative force behind THE TAIL GUNNER, is an accomplished museum educator and university lecturer. In addition to this book, her debut novel, she has written for magazines such as Columbia, Calliope, Bacopa, Soundings Review, The Morgan Horse, and ColumbiaKids. Her nonfiction book History Lab To Go! Is an award-winning museum publication, and one of her short stories, “Ernest Oglby Punkweiler and the Fabulous-Miraculous Time Intrustionator” is being transformed into an interactive exhibit for the Washington State History Museum. "Mission 31" is her blog series that posts a backstory from THE TAIL GUNNER for each day of this 31-day campaign.

story:
This book is about a project and the project is all about a brand new method of generating pollution-free energy, and yet both the project and the book turned out to be much more than expected. 

 

It all began as nothing more than a challenge to a teenager who did what his dad taught him and used his head.  The challenge became a concept, and the concept evolved over decades and then became a project.  A machine was built, and then another and another.  Hundreds of configurations, thousands of tests … and it all became reality! 

 

There are many parts to the story that are astounding but the best news of all is that we now have the solution to the world’s energy problems.  That last sentence felt a little too subtle as I was writing it.  Let me say this again with a bit more umph, and whether or not you’ve heard of it already, please pay close attention:    we now have a brand new method of producing all of the pollution-free energy that we will ever need and unlike all the well-known alternatives, this method does not rely on any outside source of power:  it is fully sustainable, totally green, and very cost effective.  The list of advantages and applications can go on and on but for now . . . back to the book. 

 

The review copy of ConVerSation of Energy vs ConSerVation of Energy . . . The Beaten Path, was published in 2010, but the project wasn’t quite finished yet and neither was the book.  If you are not into sciency stuff then I recommend skimming through towards the latter part of the book, but if you even have a minimal interest in the sciences, get ready for an introduction to a brand new scientific paradigm, then follow the author as he examines the Laws of Thermodynamics and even the Laws of Conservation and meets them head on!  Of course, a new scientific paradigm has to include at least a new formula or two so checking this out is a must!  If you like talking, writing, and reading between the lines as I do, you might really get a kick out of this book and here is your first hint:

 

"Classical mechanics affords an insufficient foundation for the
physical description of all natural phenomena"
                                                             ~~ Albert Einstein

 

Next hint:  you can’t provide description or answers to defying Physics or breaking the Laws of Thermodynamics unless you know something others don’t.  Yes … it’s in the book!

 

                                                                      

 

If you help with the book, in some ways you are also helping with the project, so let’s get a move on!!  My hope of course is that you hear more, see, or even benefit from this new technology prior to reading the book but either way I’m happy.

 

I was recently asked to write an article about my views on alternative energy and my first thought was that I simply don’t have time.  I couldn’t shake the thought and kept writing the article over and over in my head so I went ahead and wrote it down.  While doing so I realized it’s time to finish the book and here we are.  Instead of submitting the article for publication, I decided to save it for the wonderful people interested in crowd funding platforms.  For a bit more info, please see the article below and thank you all in advance.

 

All the best … JC

 

 

 

Previously unpublished article:

 

The Real Future of Green Energy

 

It is no big surprise that energy is one of the hottest topics on the planet today. You don’t have to look far to find opinions, insight, and a boatload of comments about what’s good, what’s bad, and what many think we really should be doing.  What we don’t see, read, or hear about, however, is the real solution.  If I surprise only a few people here it will still put a big grin on my face, but I hope to surprise many of you by finally revealing the answer to the world’s energy problem(s).

 

First . . . we are going to get rid of a buzz word and add another, and then another.  We nix Alternative and add Primary.  Renewable is the ultimate answer so the new buzz phrase is Independently Renewable.  Our wonderful new solution to the energy challenge does not involve fossil fuels, wind power, solar panels, batteries, garbage, corn, or algae.  Since this brand new primary source of energy is independently renewable, we can build it where the wind doesn’t blow and put it where the sun doesn’t shine . . . and it’s also relatively inexpensive on a larger scale so we can retrofit existing power plants, build new ones, and eventually get rid of all the old, unsightly transmission lines. 

If this all sounds too good, it’s actually even better.  Not only is it real and coming soon to the air near you,  it will someday mean no more gas for your car and no more diesel for your truck or cargo ship.  I can’t say much about the mechanics of this process or even the new scientific paradigm, but a few of the carefully selected professors, engineers, and physicists who have already been involved are scratching their heads at how easy it turned out to be. 

 

For those who might still be a little skeptical . . .  well, we’ve heard from you before and we all know what a van Gogh is going for these days, so I suggest you use caution in your comments and hold tight.  Once the word is out, some will be quite disappointed that they missed the obvious and others will wish they had thought of it first.  What really matters, however, is that the solution is finally here and that we field this kicker technology as soon as possible!  The ball is already rolling and you can soon expect to breathe a little easier, so start getting ready for the real future of green energy.

 

JC Black

 

 

Thanks for reading and please check out the various perks on the right hand side.  If you don't read much but would like to help then the $5.00 perk would be a great way to contribute.  Another way to help is simply sharing with others so please check out the various buttons like Facebook and Twitter.  Any help at all would be greatly appreciated!  ~~Back to work ... JC

story:
Visit our Website for FAQ and more: CallMeMrWalker.weebly.com 

Follow us on Twitter: @MrWalkerBook

Like us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/CallMeMrWalker

Leave us a comment above, encouragement helps!


Our Story

My grandmother loves to tell stories and she has a lot of them. As a retired nurse, her stories can range from funny to sad. A few years ago, she started writing the story of her father who worked as a sharecropper in South Carolina, took the midnight train to NYC, worked as a janitor in Manhattan for years and finally moved his family of 9 children and his wife to their very own home in Brooklyn.


After spending days typing it out on her typewriter, she has been asking for the last three years to have it compiled the way she wrote it into book form. I have been saying forever that I would get it done. Now is the time.


The Impact

The publication of this book will greatly affect my family and the larger community as a whole.


1) My grandmother is getting up in years and I would love to surprise her with real copies of her book for her to cherish for the rest of her days. It would also be of great importance to have the story of my great grandfather passed down for generations to come.


2)Though this is a personal story of one man, it represents the wider, less told story of black Americans moving from the bottoms of the South to make a way for themselves by capturing the American Dream in the North, known as the Great Migration. This movement helped determine the make up of modern cities and suburbs. I will be donating copies of the book to libraries for the community to enjoy and gain awareness.


What We Need & What You Get

I have decided against entering the world of publishing by choosing a self-publishing service. As much as I would love to get this book printed on my own, I do not have the editing skills nor the funds to make this book a reality in the near future. 


This is where you come in. With your contributions, I can obtain professional help from start to finish, including:

  • Cover Design
  • Formatting
  • Editing
  • 100 paperback and 25 hardcover copies to start with
  • The ability to create an ebook version, obtain an ISBN, and sell the book on sites like amazon.com and barnesandnoble.com


The cost of this service is $5,000.


Help this dream become a reality in the next two months. 


If we do not receive all the funds needed to obtain these professional services, the amount received will go toward publishing on a lower level. Meaning, we will still publish this book but the time factor will push the production back considerably.


If we raise more than the $5,000 needed, we will purchase more copies of the books and mail them out to libraries and other interested parties all over the country. The extra funds will cover the cost of production and mailing services.


As a sponsor of this project, you will receive perks. Please check out the list to your right and choose your gift amount today.


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread this story to everyone you know, people of all ages, strangers even. If you can not contribute the smallest amount, letting others know about this campaign would be greatly appreciated. The more people who know, the faster we will be able to put this book together and make my grandmother's dream a reality.


Examples

  • Create a quick email blast
  • Shout it out on Facebook, Twitter and other social media sites
  • Text your contact list or give someone a call
  • Tell your own grandparents, butcher, favorite bartender.
  • Print out the flyers from the gallery and hand them out.
  • Leave words of encouragement in the comment section.

Whatever it takes to get the word out!!!


Come back often, as I will be updating daily.

story:
I am a high school student in Santa Fe, New Mexico, and an aspiring writer. Unfortunately, high school life doesn't leave much extra time, and so I am raising money to go to a program that will focus on my passions and help me grow and improve.

I have already been accepted into the program, but need money to pay the fees.


About Emerson's Creative Writers Workshop

  • A five-week program "designed for students who want an intensive training in creative writing, have respect for he writing process, and understand how to manage their time and complete assignments both in and out of the classroom"
  • Each student chooses a fundamentals class, elective course, and breakout session
  • Students live on campus and participate in field trips into Boston when not developing their writing

Complete details about the program can be found at http://www.emerson.edu/academics/professional-s...

Out of the total program fees, I need to come up with $2,845

All funds collected from this account will go directly towards program fees.

 

How You Can Help

  • Any amount helps and will greatly appreciated. I am very excited about this program and can't participate without your help!
  • If you can't donate, help this campaign by spreading it! The more people this reaches, the better. Please give it some momentum.

Thank you all!

story:
This Campaign:

The funding, Indiegogo’s minimum $500 campaign, will go toward covering some of the costs connected with my becoming a professional novelist:  membership in a professional writer’s association and submission costs (associated with  submitting  work to writers’ contests as well as prospective  agents and publishers).  Additional funds raised, if any, will go toward continuing education to develop my fiction-writing skills, the assistance of a professional editor to help me sharpen my writing even more, the creation of an author website, the purchase of a new computer (I'm on a hand-me-down computer six years old with a host of ... let’s call them ‘quirks’), and the publication of new books.


Why Help?

We Angel Ladies have done a lot of writing.  We’ve written articles for the Toronto Star, local newspapers and magazines, webzines, and our own free ezine and newsletter.  We’ve written two books for the Dundurn Group (Angels Help Us: Discovering Divine Guidance, and Psychics and Mediums in Canada).   Although I've dedicated myself to the spiritual and uplifting work of the Angel Ladies, helping people find and live their dreams, I have the heart of a storyteller.

Almost year ago,  we realized that part of my life purpose was to write the stories that came to me - funny stories, touching stories, stories that entertained and uplifted at the same time.  I have a novel I've been developing in my head for more than ten years; I began  writing it.  Now, over one hundred thousand words later, the first draft is finished.  

I've been writing all my life.  English teachers loved me - telling me I was talented, that my work showed a spark that was  impossible to teach.  My friends were eager to read the latest  works.  In university, my writing professors praised my work enthusiastically.

As an Angel Lady, I wrote to assist people to find greater joy and satisfaction in life. I counseled them, helping them to find their own life purposes, knowing that living one’s life purpose  brings joy and spiritual centeredness.  Always, my stories lived in my head and I promised them that one day, I’d give them life.

That time is now.  It’s my turn to live my own dream. My  story is written, ready to begin its journey to publication as a  book–if I can find the resources to do so.

At this point, I need the help of professionals to edit and  ready my work for commercial publishers.  If I choose to self-publish my work, it would be even more important to enlist the help of editors and graphic designers to prepare my work, publishing costs for hard  copies, and web assistance to format my work for e-readers.  

That will take more money than the I can afford, and so we  have begun this campaign to help me realize a dream of my own: to be a published novelist, the author of novels that  entertain and delight readers, novels that feature women who are not only strong but wise and kind, novels that bring more fun and happiness into the world.



Thank You!

See the sidebar for the thank you gifts I am offering -  shout-outs on the website, a sneak peak at my work,  handmade bookmarks, and consultations.  Got a  dream of your own?  Let us help you start your journey!

 

Giving Back

The Angel Ladies believe in giving back.  We focus our tithes and offerings on ending hunger/homelessness, animal rescue, conservation/ecological issues, disaster relief, and women's causes.  Part of your gift will be paid forward in this way.

story:
About this project

This translation project of 12 short stories from Cambodian to English is organized by the  Nou Hach Literary Association in Phnom Penh, which  was started in 2002 with the intent to support writers and literary publishing in Cambodia.  During 1975-79 over 90 percent of writers and intellectuals were killed by the Khmer Rouge or died from starvation and exposure.   Writers still struggle to publish  in Cambodia due to publishing costs and the pirating of creative work in the unregulated market here.  They also struggle with one of the highest rates of illiteracy in Asia and a language yet to be significantly modernized making it more challenging to read. 

As a founding member of the association, I have assisted in the development of Cambodian literature with Khmer writers since 2002.  I am part of the Nou Hach translation team and travel to Cambodia for several months every summer to help organize the annual writers conference and smaller  writers workshops with our Asialink writers-in-residence interns from Australia.

                                          Table of Contents

Just a Human Being/ Anonymous; trans. by John Marston
Buried Treasure / Sok Chanpal, trans. by Yin Luoth
An Orphan Cat /  Phy Runn; trans. by NH trans. team
The Wallet/  Sok Chanphal; trans. by Heng Kanitha
The Khmer Policeman’s Story / Yur Karavuth' trans. by John Marston and Kheang Un
The Boat / Kao Seiha, trans. by NH trans. team
Obscure Way / Pen Chhornn; trans. by NH trans. team
The Revolver / Phin Santel; trans. by NH trans. team
My Sister/ Mey Son Sotheary; trans by. Teri Yamada, Tomoko Okada and Vuth Reth
Lord of the Land / Nhem Sophath; trans. by NH trans. team
The Sun Never Rises /  Phou Chakriya; trans. by NH trans. team
The Last Part of My Life /  Sok Chanphal; trans. YIn Luoth

What We Need & What You Get

We need $650 dollars to support modest stipends for the book cover artist and some translators.  We also need to fund the production costs for editing, and formating layouts for both print and digital texts.  If we don't make our goal, the funds will go to support the annual writers conference ($2000).

  • PLEDGE $5 or more and we will include your name on the acknowledgements page with our heartfelt thanks.
  • PLEDGE $50 or more and we will include your name on the acknowledgements page with our heartfelt thanks and send you a digital copy of “Just a Human Being” and other contemporary tales from Cambodia
  • PLEDGE $125 or more and we will include your name on the acknowledgements page with our heartfelt thanks, send you a digital copy of “Just a Human Being” and other contemporary tales from Cambodia" and a signed copy of “Virtual Lotus: Modern Fiction of Southeast Asia.” 

The Impact

Cambodia lags behind the rest of Asia in translations of Khmer fiction and poetry. In fact, "Just a Human Being..." will be the first collection of short fiction in English translation from Cambodia. The stories in this collection include tales of poverty, social injustice, political corruption and the triumph of karma and compassion. The twelve stories in "Just a Human Being..." represent the best work of contemporary Cambodian writers in the genre of serious fiction.

There are no creative writing programs in Cambodia.  The language still exhibits strong influence from Pali and Sanskrit, meaning that one “idea” can be an entire paragraph without a stop indicating our period.  There are still problems with  standardized spelling.  In any case, the young writers in this collection are not only the most creative writers in Cambodia today, they are also associated with a clarity of Khmer writing and editing.  This collection of their work in translation will bring attention to the importance of new writing in Cambodia.

As the project director for the Nou Hach Literary Association, I have facilitated the publication of six Nou Hach journal volumes.  My own publications include "Virtual Lotus: Modern Fiction of Southeast Asia" (University of Michigan Press, 2002) and "Modern Short Fiction of Southeast Asia: A Literary History" (Association for Asian Studies, 2009).  I am deeply invested in the development of modern literature in Cambodia.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please tell your friends and colleagues about our campaign. It means a lot to writers in Cambodia to have their work translated in English and read by an international audience.

Please use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word!!

story:
I've written a book to share and my goal is to give in a way to that which inspired me.

I did most of my reading on a fishing boat in Alaska; Ken Kesey, Charles Bukowski, John Fante,  Kirk Vonnegut were my favorites.  


WRITING A BOOK, HIPPIE? IS COMPLETE, EDITED, ENDORSED AND READY FOR MARKET

 Below is a synopsis of the completed work which has been endorsed with a 'thumbs up' by a well known published American writer and a friend.  



Bryan Conley showcases bitter-sweet prose

in his first literary work â€œWriting a Book, Hippie?â€

The story tells a true and adventurous journey

of a young manâ€™s trek to Alaskaâ€™s Inside Passage.

 

The completed inspiration derives itself

some 20 years later after recent, less fortunate

adventures occur, for which Conley provides his

audience a sense of time travel by using dream

 states referred to as â€˜series of million year napsâ€™.

 

While the story builds, fragile social angles attach

themselves with unequalled imagination for

 the reader.  The apparent suggestions and looks

provide a personal understanding of a larger picture.

 

His contemporary insight into tragedy, kindness,

and the undeniable over analysis featured front

to back deliver this unique take on contemplating

the human condition in a traditional beat poet style.


 Funding for this project will support the much needed marketing expansion.  All sales proceeds will further encourage my goals for the consecutive publications in this 3 book series


HERE'S AN EXCERPT FROM THE BOOK:

Rushing in from the outskirts of a newly perceived nonconformist example in an uncertain display that weâ€™d trodden upon this city's walkways I took note that each of our stories in every way revealed another. A grand design where referring to long math problems and chalk dust faded to moments of clarity. The burnt out streetlamps weren't necessary tonight I realized as the moons ominous glow became something to regard in thanks once again. There were birds that flew lower in the moonlit sky from one side of the street to the other landing in small nests built on buildingâ€™s ledges from within giant letters of signs. To make your home in a capital G or a lower case r....the O's must be the first to go I thought. She didn't want espresso as much as she just wanted to walk about and notice things like birds flying above and landing someplace else.  I hope this is honest since I am tired and going to rest now, so goodnight to all things that are done in vanity but less is â€˜the million year nap.â€™

 

Whether or not it was still alright to produce much needed tires, or cars, or parts for them, or tinker toys, or legos, or fiberglass swordfish, or more bowling balls, or poofy silk shirts, or radar detectors, or medicine balls, or trampolines, or disposable razors, or Halloween costumes, or fantasy swords, or rubber ducks, or hula hoops, or racing handlebars, or detective magazines, or fake blood, or fake dog poop, or rubber chickens, or oversized foam cowboy hats, or bean bags, or talking fish, or ping pong paddles, or anything mass produced and stored on shelves to be sold at a later date for consumption of some sort still took place somewhere off in a factory where supply and demand met a mind of disastrously insane proportional inventory I was trying to chip away at.

 

As the gears resounded and shallow breathing took place upon the ergonomic plastic Greyhound bus terminal seating, somewhere Neely's mind and my own had drifted melodramatically beneath a slow haunting whisper of the progressive scheduling. The automatic doors whooshed open randomly and twenty feet away a man flipped through his morning paper in an extraverted discussion pertaining to his opinions of his findings within.  Nearby a wall clock advanced with its regularly geared click diagnosing minutes. 



ANYONE IS FREE TO PROMOTE THIS EFFORT WHICH IS GREATLY APPRECIATED

story:
WHY I NEED YOUR HELP 

I am looking to fundraise  to cover the final proof editing, printing and promotion of the book and the remaining interviews which I need to travel over a great distance to complete. 


Any contribution would be most appreciated, and for your kind donation 

I can offer a selection of paintings, drawings and books. 

 


Please share this campaign  pages of the book with Facebook or on other social media. 

Again, thank you so much for your time. 

Sony Mervin

I am looking to fundraise  to cover the final proof editing, printing and promotion of the book and the remaining interviews which I need to travel over a great distance to complete. 



Any contribution would be most appreciated, and for your kind donation

story:
When You're Strange: An Anthology of Strangers

The Central Arkansas Speculative Fiction Writers Group formed in the Little Rock, Arkansas area in 2008. At our core, we’re a critique group. We meet once a month to provide feedback on each other’s work but we also act as a resource for each other and other local writers in the Central Arkansas area. We come from all walks of life. Some of us are published professionals, some of us are just starting out.

In recent years, we’ve started putting together anthologies as a way to showcase our work, and the work of writers all across the country. Our latest anthology, When You're Strange, is set to be published in October 2017.

What We Need & What You Get

All of the proceeds raised will go directly to the publishing costs for the anthology. The writers who have been selected for publication in our anthology are paid for their work and the rest of what is raised will go into production of the physical books as well as ebooks.

Our perks include copies of our anthology, available in print and ebook formats, as well as an assortment of items donated from local businesses in support of CASFWG and our anthology.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially to our endeavor but you would like to support us, please share the campaign on social media! We appreciate any and all contributions!

story:
Story of My Book

I launched my debut YA fantasy novel, Chasing Fae, with a presale campaign on IndieGoGo, ending with its publication in August 2020. Grace Richardson’s journey to uncover the secrets of her older brother’s death in the Fae world started off with a bang. Readers have been hooked on her honest, impulsive nature and the twists and turns that I set up for her in the debut. Now I am ready to continue that journey with a whole new volume. 

From the second I finished the first draft of Chasing Fae in 2018, I was ready to write Chasing War. As a sequel, I knew I had to make the story something special. To me, sequels need to not just carry on from the first book, but bring new layers to the characters and the world. There should also be something unexpected, something that jolts the reader and makes them read furiously to see how it all plays out.

 

The Book - Chasing War

Chasing War picks up right where Chasing Fae left off with Grace taking her new place in the Upper Realm. Spoilers from here on in. When Grace arrives at the House of the Evening, she is instantly thrust into the world of the nobility. As the heir to a throne she didn’t even realize was hers, she has to navigate magical education, dangerous politics, and a stepfamily she never asked for. With her tutor, Talon, and Aiden by her side, Grace steps out into the Upper Realm only to find a war exploding under her gaze led by the House of Darkness. She and Aiden must quickly strategize against the invaders while searching in earnest for the remaining six prophecy members. As the war rages on and more pieces of the puzzle fall into place, Grace must make a decision about who to trust and how to lead.

 

What We Need & What You Get

This is my first book that I am publishing entirely by myself without the aid of a small press. I set up the preorder tiers to help cover the costs for publishing and its many facets. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • A copyeditor: To help me refine the story to its best form
  • A proofreader: To polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • A cover designer: The mockups you are seeing are a placeholder! I will need a fantastic fantasy cover for both the ebook and paperback forms of Chasing War. 
  • A formatter: To create the interior formatting for the book
  • ISBNs: I need a batch of ISBN numbers in order to get this book distributed widely. 
  • Book Printing and Shipping: To send all of your books out to you!

I need 127 copies sold in order to launch this book fully. 

I am offering some exclusive rewards for people who preorder my book NOW to help it launch:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for preordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will be sharing my experience of writing and publishing my book as it is happening
  • And more!

 

About The Author

Cady Hammer has been a writer for most of her life. From the time she was eleven years old writing her first novel between classes, she always looked to the world to bring inspiration. She was often teased for being in her own world, but never hesitated to invite others along on the adventure. She now spends her time at the College of William and Mary pursuing a Bachelor of Arts in History and minoring in Anthropology. 

Cady loves to create stories that take people away from the world for a while. She creates her universes with inspiration from her studies, trying to create a place that feels so real that readers have to explore it. These stories explore the complexities of relationships crafted around the idea that love, friendship, and grief are all interwoven. She hopes to one day become a bestselling author alongside her desired career in museum work.

​

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each preorder tier.

 

The risk of delivering the presale copies of my book is contingent on obtaining the funds necessary to launch this on my own. I will be working diligently to make sure I get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. I will keep all presale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you preordered are expected to ship.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Presale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram with your friends, family and network. Please use #ChasingWar and tag me so I can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Presale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

 

Thanks again,

Cady Hammer

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Presale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram with your friends, family and network. Please use #ChasingWar and tag me so I can help amplify your efforts.

story:
Story of My Book

The Fire to Inspire 

My name is Ethan Miller and I am the author of The Fire to Inspire. I wrote this book because I wanted to leave this world a little bit better than I found it.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover what it means to live a life of meaning and to stand for something. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for YOUR LIFE . And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you take back control of your life and see the little things, for that is what makes life meaningful.

In this book, you'll learn about Motivation and Inspiration through:

Personal accounts of people with near death experiences and their takeaway from it

What it means to truly live life to the fullest, each and every day!!

What it really takes to survive in this brave new world, how to thrive and go about each day like it’s your last

I can’t promise you’ll love this book, hell even like this book. I can promise that there will be many things you can take away from it to help you in the long run of your life. You will learn things you never knew, see things you’ve never seen, and do things you’ve never done just because you read this book and you took action in your life. So what are you waiting for? 

The Fire to Inspire is a non-fiction book that speaks to everyone and anyone who is looking at their life and may be happy or unhappy. While this book won’t solve every problem, it will help you see the world differently and realize that not everything is as it seems and show you that life really is simple. Just like Florida Georgia Line says. 

The Book - “The Fire to Inspire”

The book is written in 5 Parts....

Part 1 starts off with the introduction and explains what motivation and inspiration can do for you, my definition of it, and a little bit about me, my past, and my future. 

Part 2 contains stories about using motivation to your advantage, creating an impact on this world and really making a difference in not only your life, but the lives of those around you. 

Part 3 talks about how to lead in this crazy world we find ourselves in, using empathy and perspective to create balance in the workplace, living a life worth living, and many, many other things. 

Part 4 introduces the educational system, it’s ups and downs, and some fixes on how to help struggling kids. It also touches on subjects about drug addiction, loneliness, and how ALL lives truly matter. 

Part 5 contains interviews conducted with dozens of people, their perspective on the subjects introduced in the chapters beforehand, and differing opinions to see what the world has to say about motivation and inspiration and it’s impact on their life. 

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this December!!! HOAHHHH

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook. 

So let’s get crack-a-lackin and read read read, (Spoiler, it may be addicting)

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

A personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

Whoever pre-orders the book will be entered in a contest where three (3) will be randomly selected to be able to interview me.

Everyone that pre-orders the book will be entered to win a $50 gift card to a restaurant of their choice, and if they want I’ll take them out to eat. Date night anyone? Just like the above perk, this assumes you purchase the pre-order, one lucky random winner will receive a $50 gift card to the restaurant of their choice. 

Anyone who pre-orders can also send in their favorite quotes to be posted at the back of the book for everyone around the world to enjoy. (emill46@u.rochester.edu)

About the Author


Ethan Miller is an aspiring author and motivational speaker. He is looking to use the proceeds of the book to start his own non-profit and conduct motivational speaking across the world. 

He has seen so many acts of heroism and kindness that warm his heart only to turn on the news and see greed and darkness. He wants to show the world that it isn’t as bad as they say it is, it is beautiful. He wants people to know that they can make a difference and they do. You have the power to CHANGE THE WORLD!!

Ethan is passionate for helping others, it is what he does each and every day. He wants to make a difference in this world. He wants someone to look at him in 10-15 years, and say “Because of you I didn’t give up. Because of you I am where I am. I saw you work your ass off so I worked mine off too. Because of you I have a life.” 

If you want to reach out for any reasons, or follow Ethan, his email is emill46@u.rochester.edu. His Instagram is eeff_keef (inside joke). 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #THEFIRETOINSPIRE and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Ethan Miller

story:
“We are only as strong as we are united, as weak as we are divided.”   

 J.K. Rowling, ‘Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire’ 

 

Who Am I 

My name is Paula Jackson and my personal mission, through my work as an educator, founder in edtech, musician or writer (and passionate cook and baker), is to nourish children’s innate curiosity about the world around them. My aim is to inspire children to celebrate diversity and to respect our connection as human beings.

 

WHY BOOKS

Reading books as children shapes our identity in a profound way. Picture books can be powerful in creating a foundation for the values that we aim to install in our children. The development within the first five years of a child's life form the basis of who they will become later on.  I believe that if we raise our children to understand how connected we all are; and inspire them to focus on that which we have in common, the world could be a much better place. 

Changing the way that a child looks at the world, can change the world!  MFH

story:
A children's book based on an ancient Persian tale.

Shahnameh For Kids is a children's book series inspired by Ferdowsi's epic poem, The Shahnameh.  There are two books in the series, and the third book, The Bravery of Gordafarid, is currently finishing up production.   This one is an empowering tale about a fearless young heroine named Gordafarid, who defends Greater Iran from an invading army all by herself.








 

What is The Shahnameh?

Everyone has heard about the tales of King Arthur and Hercules?  But what about Rostam and his perilous hero's quest?  Or what about the mystical giant bird known as Simorgh?   These myths and legends from Ancient Iran are found in a book called The Shahnameh.

The Shahnameh is an Epic Poem written in Persian over 1000 years ago by a man called Ferdowsi. It features many different tales with fascinating and larger than life characters engaged in amazing drama that unfold the mythology and history of Greater Iran.  The Shahnameh is full of action, adventure, romance, and intrigue while containing fantastic metaphors and wisdom that can apply to all aspects of life even today.

Now Ancient Iran's most famous myths can be found in Shahnameh For Kids, written by Arsia Rozegar with art by Mike Amante.

These books are perfect for fans of World Mythology, Adventure, and Fantasy!    Or those who would like to learn about ancient Iranian culture and tales.  Schools and libraries have successfully used Shahnameh For Kids as a fantastic introduction for teaching about Persian culture and folklore.   

 

Awesome Perks!

By supporting Shahnameh For Kids on Indiegogo, you get some cool exclusive items!

The first two Shahnameh For Kids books in the series
The Mighty Rostam, The Story of Zal & Simorgh. 
You have the option of having your books signed by the author, Arsia Rozegar.



 Activity & Coloring Book /  Educational Guide 

  • Downloadable eBook PDF featuring Shahnameh For Kids coloring and activity pages
  • Downloadable eBook PDF that helps teach about Ferdowsi, The Shahnameh, and Greater Iran




Exclusive "I'm a Shahnameh Kid" shirt
Comes in Kids sizes, XS, S, M, & L.


Sticker Sheet
Featuring the different colorful characters from Shahnameh For Kids


Simorgh Feather Bookmark
We will not be held responsible if your little one summons Simorgh. 

 
 

Get Drawn in the book!

Have you or your loved ones drawn as a background character in the new book!

 

    Be a Shahnameh For Kids sponsor

    A wonderful way of promoting your (nonreligious/nonpolitical) organization or brand, while also supporting Shahnameh For Kids. For a three-year period,  your logo and website will be directly linked on ShahnamehForKids.com.  Your logo will also be displayed at all Shahnameh For Kids events.  Shahnameh For Kids books will be available to sponsors at wholesale, as well.  Plus, you get drawn in the book also!
     

    Host a Shahnameh For Kids event

    Have Shahnameh For Kids author, Arsia Rozegar at your event for live story time and book signing.  Perfect for cultural events in conjunction with Iranian holidays such as Nowruz, Yalda, Tirgan or Mehregan.  Your organization also gets all of the Sponsor perks with this as well.

     


    Risks & Challenges

    Being that this our third book, the production process of creating The Bravery of Gordafarid is in full stride.  97% of the art is complete!  Support from this campaign will help greatly in production and printing costs.  After final production work and finding a suitable printer that matches the great quality of the previous books, we expect to have The Bravery of Gordafaird in your hands in time for the holidays.  
     

    Other Ways You Can Help

    • Please share with others who would be interested in Shahnameh For Kids
    • Please also consider donating Shahnameh For Kids to organizations, libraries, and schools of your choice.

    Be sure to tag Shahnameh For Kids with links on social media and this campaign:
    Instagram
    Facebook
    Twitter
story_txt:
A children's book based on an ancient Persian tale.
Shahnameh For Kids is a children's book series inspired by Ferdowsi's epic poem, The Shahnameh.  There are two books in the series, and the third book, The Bravery of Gordafarid, is currently finishing up production.   This one is an empowering tale about a fearless young heroine named Gordafarid, who defends Greater Iran from an invading army all by herself. 
What is The Shahnameh?
Everyone has heard about the tales of King Arthur and Hercules?  But what about Rostam and his perilous hero's quest?  Or what about the mystical giant bird known as Simorgh?   These myths and legends from Ancient Iran are found in a book called The Shahnameh.The Shahnameh is an Epic Poem written in Persian over 1000 years ago by a man called Ferdowsi. It features many different tales with fascinating and larger than life characters engaged in amazing drama that unfold the mythology and history of Greater Iran.  The Shahnameh is full of action, adventure, romance, and intrigue while containing fantastic metaphors and wisdom that can apply to all aspects of life even today.
Now Ancient Iran's most famous myths can be found in Shahnameh For Kids, written by Arsia Rozegar with art by Mike Amante.These books are perfect for fans of World Mythology, Adventure, and Fantasy!    Or those who would like to learn about ancient Iranian culture and tales.  Schools and libraries have successfully used Shahnameh For Kids as a fantastic introduction for teaching about Persian culture and folklore.    
Awesome Perks!
By supporting Shahnameh For Kids on Indiegogo, you get some cool exclusive items!The first two Shahnameh For Kids books in the seriesThe Mighty Rostam, The Story of Zal & Simorgh. You have the option of having your books signed by the author, Arsia Rozegar. Activity & Coloring Book /  Educational Guide 

Downloadable eBook PDF featuring Shahnameh For Kids coloring and activity pages
Downloadable eBook PDF that helps teach about Ferdowsi, The Shahnameh, and Greater Iran





Exclusive "I'm a Shahnameh Kid" shirtComes in Kids sizes, XS, S, M, & L.Sticker SheetFeaturing the different colorful characters from Shahnameh For KidsSimorgh Feather BookmarkWe will not be held responsible if your little one summons Simorgh.   

Get Drawn in the book!
Have you or your loved ones drawn as a background character in the new book! 

Be a Shahnameh For Kids sponsor
A wonderful way of promoting your (nonreligious/nonpolitical) organization or brand, while also supporting Shahnameh For Kids. For a three-year period,  your logo and website will be directly linked on ShahnamehForKids.com.  Your logo will also be displayed at all Shahnameh For Kids events.  Shahnameh For Kids books will be available to sponsors at wholesale, as well.  Plus, you get drawn in the book also! 
Host a Shahnameh For Kids event
Have Shahnameh For Kids author, Arsia Rozegar at your event for live story time and book signing.  Perfect for cultural events in conjunction with Iranian holidays such as Nowruz, Yalda, Tirgan or Mehregan.  Your organization also gets all of the Sponsor perks with this as well.
 


Risks & Challenges
Being that this our third book, the production process of creating The Bravery of Gordafarid is in full stride.  97% of the art is complete!  Support from this campaign will help greatly in production and printing costs.  After final production work and finding a suitable printer that matches the great quality of the previous books, we expect to have The Bravery of Gordafaird in your hands in time for the holidays.   

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share with others who would be interested in Shahnameh For Kids
Please also consider donating Shahnameh For Kids to organizations, libraries, and schools of your choice.

Be sure to tag Shahnameh For Kids with links on social media and this campaign:InstagramFacebookTwitter

story:
Short Summary

In a world where the establishment media dominates the narrative, it's crucial to have honest and independent boots-on-the-ground coverage. Our 3-man crew (which includes 2 professional cameramen) will be filming at all times, posting updates, and sharing our experiences and footage as often as possible. 

What We Need & What You Get

For us to be able to cover the Inauguration and all surrounding events properly:

  • We need at least $2500 to cover 5 days worth of housing, gas, and food. 
  • ALL who contribute $5 or more will receive exclusive content through our website (www.ShieldsTRM.com) and Associate and Executive Producers will receive a mention at the end of each recorded video.
  • If the entire $2500 is not reached, it will have a negative impact on how frequently we're able to get boots-on-the-ground coverage.

Risks & Challenges

  • Having only 3 people to cover multiple days of events could stretch our resources thin, so we will have to budget our time wisely.
  • Inclement weather could hinder our coverage. None of our equipment is waterproof.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to contribute monetarily, just spreading the word about our campaign and The Right Media will work wonders. Since our blacklisting on YouTube, we've had to grow solely from word-of-mouth.
