story:
This is the follow up of the Kickstarter campaign. Funds collected on Kickstarter will be added to those collected on IndieGogo In-demand to reach all available stretch goals.

Greetings, traveller!

If you’ve ever played a computer role-playing game (CRPG), chances are that Ultima played a part in its inspiration. Created by visionary Richard Garriott, and produced by his company Origin Systems, Inc., Ultima is one of the most important and influential CRPG series in the world. Through the Moongate illuminates the path of the Ultima games' history and the creative people behind this landmark series. It also covers some of Origin's other games, especially Wing Commander, and touches on several contemporary titles you may have missed. Many of these exciting tales have never before been told. If that intrigues you, then won’t you step with me...

The Project

Through the Moongate is the ambitious two-volume comprehensive history of the Ultima series, Lord British, and Origin Systems at-large. Part I was successfully Kickstarted on October 16th, 2018 and covered Richard Garriott’s humble beginnings up through Ultima VI. Part II covers Ultima VII to Portalarium and includes Wing Commander and other important Origin titles.

You can find the complete index for both Part 1 and Part 2 here as well as more information on the project as a whole.

Why Kickstarter and IndieGogo?

This crowdfunding is to fund the translation and printing of Part II, which is already finished in Italian and ready to go. For more information about the campaign, read on!

Through the Moongate aims to be a more complete account of Origin's history than has ever been presented before. Parts of Origin and Richard Garriott's story have been included in other works such as The Official Book of Ultima by Shay Addams and Garriott's own memoir, Explore/Create, but this book is a comprehensive work of new research. In the process, I interviewed dozens of people who were crucial to Origin's success and given them a voice. While many of these contributors worked directly for Origin, NCSoft, and Portalarium, others influenced the world of Ultima and Origin Systems in other creative ways. These developers, artists, and others have helped to shed new light on Origin's fascinating story and I’m excited to share it with you.

As I traced the paths of the Ultima games and those who worked for Origin Systems, I began to realize the multitude of games that would not be possible without the influence of Richard Garriott, Origin Systems, and the Ultima series. To ensure their place in history, I've also included special coverage of the Wing Commander and Ultima Underworld series, plus other significant video games of the era. CRPGs, action, adventure, and strategy games such as Space Rogue, Wolfenstein 3D, Deathlord, 7th guest, Jane's Combat series, OMEGA, MUD1, Meridian 59, Lineage, and Tabula Rasa. I’ve also included a special look at cancelled titles such as Times of Lore 2 and Fire Horse.

Through the Moongate: Part 1 - From Akalabeth to Ultima VI was successfully funded through Kickstarter in October 2018 and shipped on time in July 2019.

Part 1 set several important precedents. Firstly, it demonstrated on-time delivery of a Kickstarter, which is an increasingly rare treat in this day and age. Secondly, it established a standard of quality. Hard bound editions of Part 1 of Through the Moongate, were packaged in custom fitted mailers and shrink wrapped before shipping, ensuring backers received exactly what they paid for. Several unboxing videos and posts reveal delight in how well everything fits, especially those backers who opted for the magnetically closing black box.

If you missed the Kickstarter for Part 1, don’t fret! You can opt for a tier with both books or write an email to me, the author, to get the first book as soon as possible and read it to decide if you wish to support Part 2. I sincerely hope that you will!

 

This campaign's aim is to translate, edit, and print Through the Moongate: Part 2 - From Wing Commander and Ultima VII to Portalarium. Part 2 will bring you the same quality you’ve come to expect from Part 1 with some additional improvements including native English copy editing and exciting new backer rewards.

Part 2 of Through the Moongate will be available in three different editions: Digital, Soft Cover, and Hard Cover.

 

The hardbound edition, the flagship edition of this Kickstarter, will feature photographs from Richard Garriott's personal archive and Enrico Ricciardi's collection of Ultima games. Additionally, it will showcase brand new commissioned artwork by ex-Originite, Manda on the rear cover and a stunning new moongate image by Enrico Ricciardi for the front cover to match Part I!

We decided to print it here in Italy to ensure that the overall quality of the printing process would be easy for us to control directly. We care deeply about the special editions and we want it to be of the very highest, impeccable quality.

The softcover edition will be available in two languages: English and Italian. Both versions will be printed in Italy and shipped to the backers. At the end of the Kickstarter, you'll receive a survey request and you'll be able to select the language of the book. The hardbound edition will be printed only in English.

Shipping: International shipping and tracking globally is available at different levels of detail. Some tracking services give information only until the package reaches the international drop point while others follow the package all the way until delivery. If you cannot find your country, contact us and will add the option for you.

While our primary goal is to ensure that Part II comes to fruition, there were a few extra nice-to-haves that we cut to keep the budget realistic. If we surpass our funding goal, some of these trimmed features can return!

When determining our minimum funding goal, we had to consider several elements. Here is the ultimate breakdown of our budget. We did our best to lower our costs as much as possible to produce a reasonable funding goal without sacrificing the final quality of the book.

To write this book, I had the opportunity to interview the programmers, artists, designers, managers, and musicians that took part in the epic story of Origin Systems and worked with Richard Garriott in creating his ambitious games. The following amazing characters are directly quoted in my book:

While many fantastic people played a role in getting us here today, our staff officially comprises Andrea Contato, Enrico Ricciardi, and Edward Vitralis.

No project would be possible without a long list of special people who deserve recognition and appreciation. This Kickstarter would be possible without the help from the following people:

  • Richard Garriott de Cayeux for not only creating the worlds that we play in, but for his unending support of fan projects more than three decades later.
  • Denis Loubet & Manda for their brilliant artwork in Part I and their yet-to-be-created illustrations for Part II
  • The Space Bards/Recap & The Hearth of Britannia for creating and allowing the use of the “Theme for Rabbling” in our Kickstarter video.
  • Richard Pickles for porting Akalabeth to the Vectrex and for general project consultation.
  • Kenneth Kully and Dominik Reichardt for proofreading and general project consultation.
  • Jarrod Kailef for the outstanding teaser trailer made in record time.
  • Shannon Smith for the incredible moongate artwork used in the section headings.
  • All backers from the first Kickstarter. We wouldn’t be here today without your support.
  • Lastly, anyone who shared, reviewed, or otherwise spread the word and believed in this project. Your support means the world to us.

Follow our Facebook page, explore the official home page for the full index and information on the book, cool trivia and more, or feel free to contact me on Facebook, Twitter or directly through Kickstarter.

Still on the fence about whether or not this book is for you? Download and peruse this free sample chapter from Part I of Through the Moongate. We hope you enjoy it!

 

Risks and challenges

The risk is very low. Through the Moongate, Part 2 is already completely written in Italian, and the editing and the translation into English are underway. After that, all that is left to do is printing the book and shipping it to our backers.

Through the Moongate, Part 1 has been successfully kickstarted in October 2018 and was shipped in the promised timeframe.

As a proof of the quality of Andrea's work, we decided to show a full chapter as a preview, so that you can evaluate yourself if it's worth your time and money.

story:
Che cosa è MacGuffin?

MacGuffin è il periodico quindicinale ricco di scuse per dare il via al tuo cambiamento.

Ogni due settimane, dal 25 dicembre 2020, direttamente nella tua casella di posta elettronica, troverai spunti di riflessione e di introspezione, grazie a contributi di counselor, artisti, psicologi, psicoterapeuti. Ma non solo: libri, film, spettacoli, canzoni che contengono pretesti per cambiare. O magari per restare quel che sei, solo con maggiore consapevolezza.

Nelle storie cinematografiche, si chiama MacGuffin la ragione stramaledettamene importante per cui un personaggio si tuffa in una nuova fase di vita. Nel nostro periodico, potresti trovare la tua.

 

Perché dovrei abbonarmi?

Semplice. Per te stessa. E per te stesso.
Faremo infatti di tutto perché il MacGuffin possa essere un nutrimento per la mente e per l'anima che arriva al momento giusto. Se saremo fortunati potrebbe essere una vera e propria illuminazione. 

Potrebbe anche non essere nulla, certo. Ma che vita sarebbe, senza un piccolo rischio calcolato?

Il nostro consiglio pratico: se un MacGuffin ti attraversa la strada, seguilo. E quando qualcuno ti chiederà perché hai cambiato direzione potrai rispondere “Sto seguendo un MacGuffin, qualcosa in contrario?”.

 

Perché ti servono scuse per cambiare?

Perché prima di passare alla fase successiva c’è sempre un cerchio da chiudere. 

Mettiamola così: c’è un modo di pensare o di agire, o un’abitudine o un punto di vista che da sempre è così. Oggi, quel modo lì, vuoi e puoi modificarlo o, forse, addirittura lasciarlo andare. Ed ecco che arrivano gli atroci dubbi. E se cambio, cosa mi succederà? E se non ci riesco? E se sbaglio? E gli altri, che mi hanno sempre visto in quel modo lì, come reagiranno? E se non piaccio più? E se...

Insomma per chiudere il cerchio serve una scusa - ehm... una solida motivazione - da dare a te stesso e agli altri.

E alle scuse ci pensiamo noi.

 

I nostri obiettivi

Pre-ordinando MacGuffin permetterai:

- 1.000 € al grafico di vivere un’esperienza straordinaria: essere pagato, il giusto, per il suo lavoro;

- 2.500 € al web designer di realizzare un sito che se no farebbe gratis il cugino nerd di qualcuno di noi;

- 6.500 € ai curatori delle rubriche di lavorare in un posto in cui la produzione intellettuale è retribuita (sempre che non tracollino prima per l’emozione);

- 8.500 € agli articolisti di prendersi il tempo per scrivere un fantastico contributo che renderà il tuo MacGuffin ancora più MacGuffin;

- 10.000 € ai formatori di essere ingaggiati per condividere e diffondere esperienza e conoscenze;

- 10.001 €  all’umanità di vivere in un mondo migliore (ok, ci siamo fatti prendere un po’ la mano).

 

Perché MacGuffin ora?

Per ritornare in equilibrio e per intonarci alla contemporaneità.

Dopo 15 anni di lavoro a stretto contatto con la comunità e le persone, riconosciamo l'importanza dell'accesso alle risorse per la crescita personale. 

Ad AttivaMente abbiamo sempre lavorato "in presenza", in tutti i sensi: con tutto il nostro corpo e la nostra mente. Ma, magari te ne sei accorto, da un po' le regole del gioco sono cambiate. 

Per noi pubblicare il MacGuffin è dettato dalla stessa tua motivazione ad abbonarti: avere delle ottime scuse per cambiare.

 

Tutti i modi per sostenere la campagna

Se pensi che cambiare insieme sia meglio che cambiare da soli, puoi seguire le pagine social, parlarne con gli amici o con il tuo capo, puoi condividere i nostri post sui tuoi profili.

Durante la campagna creeremo degli eventi online dedicati al cambiamento: momenti di dialogo con counselor, approfondimenti con psicologi, infodrama con attori e registi. Se vuoi organizzare un momento di cambiamento per te e per i tuoi amici, i tuoi clienti, i tuoi colleghi e dipendenti, contattaci.

info@coopattivamente.it 

www.coopattivamente.it

+39 351 962 4891 (anche whatsapp)

 

Chi siamo?

AttivaMente si forma nel 2005.

È nato tutto un po’ per caso, come nascono spesso le cose più belle.
Figure professionali provenienti da mondi apparentemente distanti, hanno iniziato a lavorare assieme. E lavorando hanno scoperto che le specifiche competenze di ognuno di loro si integravano perfettamente le une con le altre. Abbiamo così deciso di trasformare questa diversità in un tratto distintivo.

È stato un processo lungo, di cui però siamo particolarmente fieri. Da noi, infatti, oggi puoi trovare un’equipe multidisciplinare composta da figure professionali differenti, quali registi, attori, operatori culturali, counselor, psicologi, psicoterapeuti.
Offriamo dunque le nostre competenze e il nostro punto di vista critico nel processo di costruzione sociale, a livello individuale e collettivo, perché in questi anni molto complicati sentiamo la grande responsabilità di dare risposte altamente professionalizzate a chi richiede il nostro supporto.

Attraverso i nostri liberi strumenti di metamorfosi, come il MacGuffin, potrai prenderti cura di te, professionalmente e personalmente, costruendo relazioni di qualità grazie all’impasto naturale costituito dalla farina dell’emozione, della competenza, della cura e del divertimento.

Perché ti servono scuse per cambiare?
Perché prima di passare alla fase successiva c’è sempre un cerchio da chiudere. 
Mettiamola così: c’è un modo di pensare o di agire, o un’abitudine o un punto di vista che da sempre è così. Oggi, quel modo lì, vuoi e puoi modificarlo o, forse, addirittura lasciarlo andare. Ed ecco che arrivano gli atroci dubbi. E se cambio, cosa mi succederà? E se non ci riesco? E se sbaglio? E gli altri, che mi hanno sempre visto in quel modo lì, come reagiranno? E se non piaccio più? E se...
Insomma per chiudere il cerchio serve una scusa - ehm... una solida motivazione - da dare a te stesso e agli altri.
E alle scuse ci pensiamo noi.
 
I nostri obiettivi
Pre-ordinando MacGuffin permetterai:
- 1.000 € al grafico di vivere un’esperienza straordinaria: essere pagato, il giusto, per il suo lavoro;
- 2.500 € al web designer di realizzare un sito che se no farebbe gratis il cugino nerd di qualcuno di noi;
- 6.500 € ai curatori delle rubriche di lavorare in un posto in cui la produzione intellettuale è retribuita (sempre che non tracollino prima per l’emozione);
- 8.500 € agli articolisti di prendersi il tempo per scrivere un fantastico contributo che renderà il tuo MacGuffin ancora più MacGuffin;
- 10.000 € ai formatori di essere ingaggiati per condividere e diffondere esperienza e conoscenze;
- 10.001 €  all’umanità di vivere in un mondo migliore (ok, ci siamo fatti prendere un po’ la mano).
 
Perché MacGuffin ora?
Per ritornare in equilibrio e per intonarci alla contemporaneità.
Dopo 15 anni di lavoro a stretto contatto con la comunità e le persone, riconosciamo l'importanza dell'accesso alle risorse per la crescita personale. 
Ad AttivaMente abbiamo sempre lavorato "in presenza", in tutti i sensi: con tutto il nostro corpo e la nostra mente. Ma, magari te ne sei accorto, da un po' le regole del gioco sono cambiate. 
Per noi pubblicare il MacGuffin è dettato dalla stessa tua motivazione ad abbonarti: avere delle ottime scuse per cambiare.
 
Tutti i modi per sostenere la campagna
Se pensi che cambiare insieme sia meglio che cambiare da soli, puoi seguire le pagine social, parlarne con gli amici o con il tuo capo, puoi condividere i nostri post sui tuoi profili.
Durante la campagna creeremo degli eventi online dedicati al cambiamento: momenti di dialogo con counselor, approfondimenti con psicologi, infodrama con attori e registi. Se vuoi organizzare un momento di cambiamento per te e per i tuoi amici, i tuoi clienti, i tuoi colleghi e dipendenti, contattaci.
info@coopattivamente.it 
www.coopattivamente.it
+39 351 962 4891 (anche whatsapp)
 
Chi siamo?
AttivaMente si forma nel 2005.
È nato tutto un po’ per caso, come nascono spesso le cose più belle.Figure professionali provenienti da mondi apparentemente distanti, hanno iniziato a lavorare assieme. E lavorando hanno scoperto che le specifiche competenze di ognuno di loro si integravano perfettamente le une con le altre. Abbiamo così deciso di trasformare questa diversità in un tratto distintivo.
È stato un processo lungo, di cui però siamo particolarmente fieri. Da noi, infatti, oggi puoi trovare un’equipe multidisciplinare composta da figure professionali differenti, quali registi, attori, operatori culturali, counselor, psicologi, psicoterapeuti.Offriamo dunque le nostre competenze e il nostro punto di vista critico nel processo di costruzione sociale, a livello individuale e collettivo, perché in questi anni molto complicati sentiamo la grande responsabilità di dare risposte altamente professionalizzate a chi richiede il nostro supporto.
Attraverso i nostri liberi strumenti di metamorfosi, come il MacGuffin, potrai prenderti cura di te, professionalmente e personalmente, costruendo relazioni di qualità grazie all’impasto naturale costituito dalla farina dell’emozione, della competenza, della cura e del divertimento.

story:
100% Funded But We're Not Done Yet!

Thanks to all of your fantastic support, we've reached 100% of our minimum funding goal! We've prepared some stretch goals to make the book even more awful than we ever thought possible! All funds raised are going to the book entirely. We've even decided to add a couple of surprise pages to the book as a thank you for your awesome support that we will pay for ourselves. They include new artwork, poetry and more! So take a peek at our stretch goals and let's finish with a bang. Thank you to all of our awful supporters. 

STRETCH GOALS!

*Spot Varnish is a glossy coating on select areas of the hardcover. We want to up the awful by making the rain on the cover actually look like wet, cold rain! Here is a link to a good description of Spot UV Varnish as well as some examples. I've included a nice article about End Papers. 


Make it rain! Poor sad boy. 

What is The Awful Alphabet?

If you're anything like us, you're getting tired of the same old alphabet books where A is for Apple and B is for...BORING! We're trying to raise $6000 to publish The Awful Alphabet, an amazing new way for children to learn their ABCs! Using humour and imaginative graphics, the book also realistically points out that sometimes things just don't go our way (Ever swallowed a watermelon seed and worry about the plant growing in your belly? Or have you thought about the repercussions of being friends with a Yeti)?

This book is an important learning tool for kids because it not only teaches them the alphabet, but it also focuses on subject matter that can help build resilience at a young age. This can help them to better cope with a wide range of emotions as they grow up!

Hello, we're Tracy & Josh, an awful book making collaborative duo! We've teamed up to create The Awful Alphabet, a fully illustrated hard cover book dedicated to all the awful things that can come your way.  The Awful Alphabet makes learning the alphabet funny and silly while giving us all a chance to laugh at the awful days!
About the Book:
  • 8 x 10 hardcover book
  • Matte laminated cover
  • 64 fully illustrated and written pages 
  • High quality bright full colour
  • Features 26 awful situations including B is for Barfing! 

An early prototype of the book with simple typography and layouts to ensure you get the best possible colour and quality.

Nothin' makes for a worse day than an asteroid colliding with Earth, right?

From Asteroids smashing the planet to Zombies feasting on brains, The Awful Alphabet is full of the worst!

Being friends with a Yeti just might be a really awful time.  

Quicksand can be pretty sneaky! Never trust a free hat. 

The whole awful alphabet! Stay tuned for special polls and contests to see how you can be involved in the final creation stages of The Awful Alphabet!

In Support of Nkosi's Haven

Aside from supporting our dream of publishing this book, you'll also be helping children in need achieve their education. For every book sold in this limited edition run, we will donate $1 to Nkosi's Haven in Johannesburg, South Africa. Nkosi's Haven is a long term care facility for women and children affected by HIV & AIDS. They do amazing work providing holistic care and a supportive home for those in need.

The 3 months Tracy spent working there opened her eyes to the challenges an NGO must face when trying to not only fund a happy home for so many children, but also, very importantly, their educations. Children are our future and helping them gain the best education possible is an important cause that we are proud to support and we hope you are too. Find out more information and learn Nkosi's story below.  

Nkosi's Haven Website

Some of the amazing kids who live at Nkosi's Haven. 

AWFUL PERKS! 

We have some seriously awful perks lined up for you! Take a look below for the breakdown as well as to see some extra images of your goodies.

Here are a couple extra images of the perks! Awful stuff, eh?

Poster #1!  Pretty awful. Get your high res PDF and make as many of these terrible things as you'd like! 

Poster #2! Some of the worst posters imaginable!

Swag Stickers! Asteroids are waaaaaay cooler than apples. Fix up your mac with an awfully vinyl, high quality alphabet sticker! There's still an awesome secret one yet to be revealed! 



Swag Buttons! Be the coolest kid at the park with some truly terrible buttons! 

Just a quick look at some original ink drawings from the Awful Alphabet that are up for grabs

These three prints come with the Doubly Awful Book and Print Pack. They're the perfect way to ruin any decor! 

Stay tuned for more images of all the truly awful things we have in store for you!

Just $6000 can bring this Awful Dream to Life! 

All funds raised will go towards any printing, shipping and Indiegogo fees associated with this limited edition print run of our book (500 copies), along with the costs of your perks. The majority of the funding ($5300) will go to the production of the book and any extra funds over our goal will be used to promote, market and create the highest quality book we can!

We hope to reach our goal and have the books printed and sent out by November, just in time to give someone an Awful Christmas gift! 

Risks & Challenges

We’ve partnered with a fantastic Canadian printer and since the artwork is 95% done, I can set the order right after being funded. Production of the book will take between 4-8 weeks but as with any publishing project there can be unforeseen delays or setbacks. We will 100% work our hardest to get this book into your hands on time and keep everyone updated if there are any setbacks to our estimated schedule. 


What else can you do to help? 

The best thing you can do to help us out is share our campaign! Tell your friends, neighbours, the mailman, the lunch lady, make a smoke signal, send a fax, shout it from a rooftop...or just share the campaign through your social media platforms. We appreciate every single share and tweet from the bottom of our hearts! 

Special Thanks to Some Awful People! 

Big thanks go out to my amazing campaign team! Thanks to Tennille & Zoe at Flofoto for making the outdoor product shots in the video and giving me tons of advice! Brock basically made this a thing and for that, eternal gratitude. The music for the video was created by Josh Turnbull and Sara Ciantar. Without their amazing musical skills, there would have been way more awkward silences than there already are in the video. Just wanted to add a quick thanks to my friend Kira for helping with the campaign writing! Love you girl!

They're all wonderful and talented folks so please take a look at their work here:
http://www.flofoto.ca/
http://www.brockdonaldson.co/

Feel free to leave a comment and ask any questions you may have. We'll try to answer as soon as possible! Pre-order your copy today and help us make The Awful Alphabet a reality! 

Check out behind the scenes and in progress images on Instagram! 
https://instagram.com/joshturnbull1/
https://instagram.com/tracylouwho/

Thank you from the bottom of our Awful hearts! 

What is The Awful Alphabet? 

If you're anything like us, you're getting tired of the same old alphabet books where A is for Apple and B is for...BORING! We're trying to raise $6000 to publish The Awful Alphabet, an amazing new way for children to learn their ABCs! Using humour and imaginative graphics, the book also realistically points out that sometimes things just don't go our way (Ever swallowed a watermelon seed and worry about the plant growing in your belly? Or have you thought about the repercussions of being friends with a Yeti)?

This book is an important learning tool for kids because it not only teaches them the alphabet, but it also focuses on subject matter that can help build resilience at a young age. This can help them to better cope with a wide range of emotions as they grow up!

story:
Hi, I'm Jessica and I'm a smoker.

I am a twenty-six year old student, studying linguistics (in hopes of becoming a dialect coach). I am currently a smoker of about six years, but I also spend my time knitting, crocheting, writing, drawing, hanging out with friends, amongst other things that your average mid-twenty something year old would do.

Six months ago I decided to take a risk by starting Rhodes Through the Smoke, sharing my experiences as a smoker, my questions, research, and my thought process throughout while hoping to engage others in the topic as well.

My main reason for doing so was to help show the other side of smoking, from a smoker’s perspective. I feel most conversations are about how bad it is for you and are often very negative, not allowing constructive progress.

My hope is not to glorify smoking or downplay its risks, but when it comes to different types of addictions or struggles they should be talked about, the good, the bad, and the ugly.

I had no idea how this blog would be received, but I have been pleasantly surprised by the responses, comments, messages, and links shared with me.

To give you an update on how far this blog has come in the last six months, there are almost 30 posts, 23 comments, 21 followers, and close to 1500 total views. This may not sound like a lot, but I think this is only the beginning.

I have high hopes and aspirations for where this blog can go, ultimately wanting to help others. Whether that is as an outlet for them to talk about a subject they might feel uncomfortable talking about, providing insight to those who may be unfamiliar with these experiences or afraid to ask smokers that they know,  and being able to give research, statistics, options for quitting, and so much more.

Without all of you, this would just be a place for me to share my own opinions, but you all have made it so much more.

These last six months have been some what of a trial run to see if there is an audience interested in this topic. Fortunately, I believe there is, and in wanting to offer the most to this audience, I believe it is time to upgrade in order to expand.

I would like to ask you to help me make this blog even more than it is now, by taking a moment to check out our campaign to expand to our own domain name with resources to expand. You can find the link at the beginning of this post. If you have any questions, please comment below or email me directly at jessrhodes.throughthesmoke@gmail.com

    This is just the beginning for where Through the Smoke could go. I have some very ambitious goals relating to the expansion of this blog, but I know that with your help we can achieve them. I can’t wait to see what we can do with this blog together.

    What We Need & What You Get

      Although I have many ambitious goals for where Through the Smoke may go, it is best to take things one step at a time.

      Our current goal is to raise enough money to purchase a domain name and upgrade through WordPress.com to their Premium service ($99).

      With that said, if we earn over what we need to meet our current goal, I want to share with you some of the ideas on how Through the Smoke will continue to expand and giveback.

        We would love to provide custom Through the Smoke merchandise, available for purchase or through giveaways/contests including:

        • matchbooks/matchboxes
        • t-shirts
        • journals
        • aids to helps those of our readers interested in quitting smoking such as discounts for Nicorette products, behavioral therapy, counseling, cessation programs with your local hospital, sponsors, etc.
        Bottom line, any money that is raised will be used in one way or another to help expand Through the Smoke and reward our readers and supporters (because without you, none of this would be possible). Updates and links will be posted to provide information on where our money is coming from and what it is going towards. This is a group effort and your input is valued.
          If we do raise the full $500, I pledge to intentionally reduce my smoking by 5% through the end of the year. This may not sound like a lot, but anyone who might be familiar with addictions would understand the stress and anxiety that can come when parameters are set in place, potentially limiting you to what you have trained your body to "need" in order to relax, process, or whatever reason(s) that trigger them to smoke. You will be able to hold me accountable by checking my smoking log, found here. 
            If we do not raise the full $500, we will be collecting the money raised and determining how best to utilize that money. Focusing on the domain name and upgrades (if we raised enough money for both), and then check in with all of you as to what you want to see happen next with the money we all earned together.

              The Impact

                This blog is not intended to promote smoking, but to be used as a source of information, questions, and dialogue in order to create an open line of communication that allows us all to expand our knowledge when it comes to the addiction of smoking.

                Risks & Challenges

                  Our biggest challenge may be that there still isn't enough of an interested audience - some individuals may not feel comfortable donating to a blog that talks about smoking. My main reassurance is that this blog and Through the Smoke as a whole is not intended to promote smoking. It is meant to be a place for discussion on this topic of smoking that so often gets swept under the rug or ignored due to its negative stigma, to help us all come to a better understanding and a wider perspective on the subject and individuals involved.

                    Other Ways You Can Help

                    I understand that not everyone is able to help in a financial way, especially seeing as I'm sure many of you are also "broke" college students, but that is totally fine!

                    Here are some other ways you can help:

                    • Spread the word about this campaign and Through the Smoke itself. Indiegogo has lots of great share tools that make this part easy for you!
                    • Continue to check the blog and share whenever you have something on your mind or questions.
                    • If you're still looking for other ways to help out or have any questions, feel free to email me at jessrhodes.throughthesmoke@gmail.com

                    Thank you for taking the time to get to know me (a little) and this campaign I have found such a strong passion for. I appreciate all of your support, in whatever way you show it.

 Continue to check the blog and share whenever you have something on your mind or questions.
If you're still looking for other ways to help out or have any questions, feel free to email me at jessrhodes.throughthesmoke@gmail.com 
 
 Thank you for taking the time to get to know me (a little) and this campaign I have found such a strong passion for. I appreciate all of your support, in whatever way you show it.

story:
Why is the need so urgent?

The global economy is clearly out of balance and out of control.  The current decline in our national civility along with public and private morality seemed inconceivable a few short years ago.  People are abandoning their faith - no longer willing to stand and work for a brighter future.  We face tough economic times just ahead that will seriously compound an already uncertain outlook.  When Harbingers Abound will pull back the veil and interpret current events from a biblical world view.  It may feel like you have just awakened from a deep sleep.  Suddenly you will see a hundred things in a different light with no clue where to start.  This is a guidebook chock full of practical steps that will serve as a outline for you and your loved ones to get prepared. 

Your call to action is here!

The urgency of this situation calls for some innovative thinking! The traditional 18-month publishing cycle won't get it done fast enough.  We need to get this book in print NOW and we need your help to do it!  The manuscript is a mere weeks from completion.  We need our Indiegogo partners (Your name here: X_________).  If we join forces now, we can cut the printing and distribution time to less than 3 months  

Where will the $6000 be used

Phase One starts  right away and when we reach $3000,  the final edit will be completed and an initial print run will begin.  We will begin shipping the finished book to our Indiegogo partners as the first copies are available.  Our target for that phase is August 2015.  (***update - we can now begin Phase 1 when we reach $2000! We found a better publisher***)

Phase 2 will be contract publication and distribution through major outlets like Amazon, Barnes & Noble, Ingram and others. This will take an additional several weeks to set up.  That's also when the eBook version should be completed and available. You can watch for updates here and on our Facebook page:

https://www.facebook.com/pages/When-Harbingers-Abound/468600619966781

Here's a list of where the money will be allocated:

  • Complete the final manuscript and pay for initial print run so campaign partners get their copies in hand first.
  • Contract with a major publisher for volume printing, marketing, and sale through major  distributors like Amazon and other traditional retail outlets.
  • Provide some cool perks for our Contribution Partners.
  • Prepare an eBook electronic version for electronic distribution
  • Establish a website to further promote and distribute the book
  • Prepare select videos to promote the book and its message of hope.
  • Set aside some complimentary copies for distribution as needed.
  • No author salary is included.  If it sells I get paid. If not, at least I finished it!

What are the risks?

There are risks in everything we do.  That's the price of progress.  The risks here are pretty straightforward...

Getting the book finished - I am so concerned about getting this message out that I am taking a sabbatical to get it completed and edited.  I plan to have the second half finished by early August and minimize any risky behavior in the meantime {8>0

What if we don't reach our goal quickly - Publication will proceed in direct proportion to the rate we can raise funds.  We move forward in small steps as each phase gets funded.  Since time is of the essence, each day of delay will mean fewer days for new readers to get positioned.   Send this link to your friends with a personal appeal. They will appreciate your thoughtfulness as it helps them prepare. 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways you can also help in addition to being a contributing partner!

    • Get the word out! Do you have a blog? Facebook? Twitter? Use your social media to let others know of the book. A personal appeal from you to others is 3 times more likely to get a response from your friends and family.
    • Use the IndieGoGo share tools. They will direct attention back to this page, where others can invest.
    • On-line reviews drive interest! Please write a review on Amazon, Barnes & Noble, our Facebook page, your own blog and share with friends.
    • Do simple email forward and paste a link to this page with personal invitation from you to others.  It is surprisingly effective.

                  And that's all there is to it. Remember - Time is short but it's not too late!

How about a peek inside? **Updated**

We updated the table of contents on August 12 to reflect the book's focus on information you will need leading up to and immediately after the financial shaking.  It is still subject to minor additional revision. 

From the Author's Foreward

. . . Many people are having their Aha! moment about world events right now.  They realize something is about to happen but have no clue where to start.  Still others are trying how to figure out how to explain to their friends and family that there really is cause for concern about the near future.  Their challenge is how to do it in a logical and convincing manner.  It isn't easy trying to piece together a coherent explanation from conversations with friends, YouTube videos, and the jumble of articles they have read.  All of the key aspects of the story are laid out here to help you understand and share the message with others.

A third group now sees what is coming and is overwhelmed. They need a message of hope that they can get through what is coming and that there is life on the other side.  Many will read and understand for the first time that a key part of the solution is involves answering for themselves the same question that Jesus once asked a woman near a well – ‘Who do you say that I am?”

For many Christians, the challenge is how to read the bible in one hand, the newspaper in the other and keep it all in perspective. God’s word is always a balance between trusting God and caring for your family while being a good steward.  The message of this book shows you how to balance those important realities. 

So whether you are person of faith or not, there are dozens of specific, practical suggestions for things you can be doing now to prepare yourself, your family, and your finances that will be of great benefit to you when the storm arrives.  

     God bless you now and in the days ahead.  No exceptions! - RF

story:
When you donate to neohasid.org, you support the work of collecting and sharing songs and Torah, engaging in spiritual activism for the Earth, expanding meaning of Judaism with ecological wisdom, composing earth-centered and egalitarian liturgy, developing the Torah of dance, updating and adding features to the Omer Counter app, and creating curriculum, liturgy, translations and resources that you can use. 

All these elements are united by a vision of Judaism as the ground for an embodied, centered, and healing relationship to the Earth. Neohasid is one of the important sources fostering an all-streams Judaism that is more whole, and that actively embraces all humanity and all life. 

Your support, financial, spiritual and social, empowers us to do more. You can also support neohasid by joining our googlegroup list, by liking neohasid.org's page on facebook, and by sharing or tweeting pages that you like. Please also check out neohasid's other resources for Pesach and the Omer.

story:
¿Qué?

La paja, en la estela de las novelas de John Berger, plantea una reflexión sobre el amor y el sufrimiento, sobre como la solidaridad y el cuidado entre seres humanos puede llegar a convertirse en una luz que nos señala, al menos, una salida.

Tres personajes sobreviven en la periferia de una pequeña ciudad de provincias, una ciudad sin presente donde la playa es gris, triste y se respira polvo en lugar de aire.

Alfonso el pescador, solo en su barco, solo en el mar. Le dejó su tripulación, le abandonó su mujer. No fue capaz de quererla, ni de comprenderla, ni de cuidarla. Él resiste, mientras su mundo se desmorona, la pesca desaparece y el puerto se reconstruye sobre el vacío. Alfonso resiste contra la furia de la naturaleza, contra el viento, contra las olas. Solo le queda rencor, y un odio amargo que corroe por dentro. 

Florencia, la enfermera uruguaya. Huyó de su patria dejando un hijo y una madre dominante. Florencia quiere conseguir los papeles gracias a un contrato en una fábrica de electrodomésticos, ahorrar dinero, comprar un pasaje para su hijo, enfrentarse, por fin, a su madre. Una huelga en la fábrica romperá deseos y esperanzas. Para recuperar ese pasado perdido tendrá que caminar descalza sobre arena ardiente.

Nicolae, el trabajador rumano. Albañil de manos rápidas y precisas, silencioso, afable, atrapado en una infancia lejana a pesar de su juventud. Solo quiere dormir caliente bajo las estrellas. Se verá arrastrado por la crisis del sector, hundido, no solo económicamente, convertido en ladrón contra su propia convicción y finalmente, lanzado a la madurez con la furia de una realidad tan simple como descarnada.

Tres personajes condenados a encontrarse en ese extraño lugar en el que la vida se confunde con el destino.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Manel Barriere Figueroa.

Nacido en Barcelona en 1971, estudió cine en el ESCAC de Barcelona y ha desarrollado su carrera profesional como montador.

A principios de los años '90 tocó la batería en algunos grupos de la escena alternativa barcelonesa. Comenzó a escribir por esa época, publicando en fanzines musicales y en la sección de cine de la revista Mondo Sonoro. Tuvo un papel activo en el movimiento antiglobalización y el movimiento antiguerra a principios del siglo XXI, y fue militante del sindicato de Técnicos del Audiovisual y del Cine en Madrid. Durante su época de activista escribió para el periódico En lucha y formó parte de su comité de redacción. También ha sido editor de la revista La Hiedra, donde publicó numerosos artículos, reseñas y columnas de opinión. Actualmente colabora en la revista Viento Sur y en la sección cultural de la web Poder Popular.

Entre sus trabajos cinematográficos destacan largometrajes de ficción y documental como La mano azul de Floreal Peleato, Canción perdida de Nacho Sirera, Las olas y Los chicos del puerto de Alberto Moráis, Nadar y Volar de Carla Subirana. Ha colaborado como docente en el Curso de Animación Experimental de la UCM, en la Universidad de Málaga y en el Master de Documental de Creación de la UPF de Barcelona.

Escribe poemas para la obra de la artista visual Mónica Oliva Lozano, y en 2014 publicó su primer libro con la editorial Amargord, un poemario titulado El rostro oculto. La Paja es su primera novela.

Más información y algunos textos:
http://elfondodelaire.blogspot.com.es/

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«Más allá de la A-31, la autovía que sitia la ciudad, los jóvenes, y no tan jóvenes, desfilan hacia las fábricas en los polígonos, restos de una prosperidad industrial que se estancó años atrás. Rutinas de hormiga. Arrastran sus pequeños cuerpos y los devuelven al final del día, aún más pequeños, encogidos, eufóricos de cansancio los viernes por la tarde. Intentan olvidar el lunes con alcohol y drogas y risas agrias. Para la mayoría, siempre es lunes y siempre lo será. El primero y el único día, al acecho como un ave carroñera volando en círculos sobre la cabeza del animal moribundo.
     Vueltas y vueltas. Todo vuelve a empezar»

«Hoy es lunes. Un grupo de mujeres con pañuelo ceñido alrededor del rostro. La cabeza sobre los hombros y el pelo bien protegido. El mar y la brisa no traen más que polvo y suciedad. Cruzan el descampado ante el enorme edificio en construcción, casi un rascacielos, por ahora un esqueleto de hierro y hormigón. Entran en la fábrica de lavadoras AEG. Se quitan el pañuelo y lo sacuden. Una vez, otra vez, y al bolsillo. Se cambian en el vestuario de mujeres. Dejan el abrigo y se enfundan sus batas, azules o blancas. Adelante. La cadena circula a su ritmo. A su ritmo. Una pieza, otra pieza, otra pieza. Luego descanso. Una pieza, otra pieza más. Encajan piezas y siguen encajando todo el santo día. Florencia encaja en la cadena, una trabajadora más venida del más allá. En Uruguay era otra cosa. Auxiliar de enfermería en el hospital Pereira Rossell de Montevideo, con perspectivas, un marido, un hijo. Se fue todo al garete. Ella, Florencia, se fue. Nunca había llegado tan lejos. Cruzó el océano, la inmensidad. Ahora cruza el descampado todos los días, protegiéndose el pelo con un pañuelo ceñido. La tela sobre las orejas amortigua los gritos y las risas, amortigua murmullos incómodos, recurrentes. Están ahí y ella no puede más que callar para contenerlos, sin demasiado éxito»

«Era rumano cuando vivía en Rumania. En España no es español. Ni siquiera es europeo. Es un extranjero, un simple extranjero rumano en España. Algo a lo que se acostumbró muy rápido. Como si una vez rotos los vínculos con todo lo que dejó atrás, su condición no representara más que un espejismo, un encuentro fugaz, intrascendente, e impuesto por fuerzas que escapan a su control.
     Ahora Nicolae ni siquiera recuerda el olor de su tierra. Era verde y olía, eso sí lo recuerda. Olía a tierra verde, a hogar. Campos, prados y bosques, pueblos y ciudades. Caballos trotando sobre el suelo embarrado. Un gallo que canta. El ruido del hacha sobre el tronco, que cruje al partirse, que crepitará después presa del fuego en la chimenea. Todo eso era suyo aunque no le perteneciera. En realidad, empezó a ser suyo al alejarse, y cuanto más se alejaba más suyo era.
     El mar le recuerda su tierra.
     Le recuerda el despertar por la mañana, mirar por la ventana al saltar de la cama en su habitación, ver la hierba impregnada por las gotas de rocío, abrir, coger aire y exhalar con fuerza, el ritual necesario para afrontar un nuevo día. Es un recuerdo al revés. Es un olor tan diferente, el del mar, que le hace sentir la ausencia con mayor intensidad. No olía así, piensa, no olía así. ¿Cómo era? ¿Cómo olía mi tierra desde mi ventana? Es el recuerdo del olvido, recordar que se ha perdido aquello que se abandona. Por eso no le gusta la playa, cuya arena se extiende a sus pies como un manto arrugado y sucio. Mira de reojo mientras coloca ladrillos, uno tras otro, levantando un muro con el que poder protegerse»

«En el mar, el pescador lanza sus redes. En su barca, la barca de Alfonso, que es suya como lo fue siempre. Su tripulación, cada vez más mermada hasta convertirse en la nada, él mismo, solo, ante todo y contra todo. Mozos, marineros e incluso pescadores curtidos desertan a la búsqueda de lo que el mar no puede darles. Se convierten en albañiles, encofradores, electricistas, plomeros o simples peones a la espera de una prosperidad que es anhelo más que promesa. Una nueva vida en tierra firme. Para él, el trabajo se multiplica. La pesca, no.
     Antes sí.
     Antes tenía familia, tenía mar. No hace mucho tiempo. Había pesca, y barcos, y capitanes que regresaban con las bodegas repletas. Alfonso se acuerda del brillo sobre la cubierta, de la fascinación en los ojos de niños y curiosos, de los peces deslizándose por el suelo entre las botas negras porque no cabían en las cajas. Hombres rudos con gorro de lana, como él, alegres y trabajadores, como él, siempre ajetreados. Entonces lo eran. Pescadores orgullosos de su esfuerzo, de su sudor, del hedor que arrastraban después de una dura jornada bregando sin descanso.
     El mar se fue secando, como las personas a su alrededor»

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de La paja que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Manel Barriere Figueroa vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

La Paja es su primera novela.Más información y algunos textos:http://elfondodelaire.blogspot.com.es/¿Por qué?Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:«Más allá de la A-31, la autovía que sitia la ciudad, los jóvenes, y no tan jóvenes, desfilan hacia las fábricas en los polígonos, restos de una prosperidad industrial que se estancó años atrás. Rutinas de hormiga. Arrastran sus pequeños cuerpos y los devuelven al final del día, aún más pequeños, encogidos, eufóricos de cansancio los viernes por la tarde. Intentan olvidar el lunes con alcohol y drogas y risas agrias. Para la mayoría, siempre es lunes y siempre lo será. El primero y el único día, al acecho como un ave carroñera volando en círculos sobre la cabeza del animal moribundo.     Vueltas y vueltas. Todo vuelve a empezar»«Hoy es lunes. Un grupo de mujeres con pañuelo ceñido alrededor del rostro. La cabeza sobre los hombros y el pelo bien protegido. El mar y la brisa no traen más que polvo y suciedad. Cruzan el descampado ante el enorme edificio en construcción, casi un rascacielos, por ahora un esqueleto de hierro y hormigón. Entran en la fábrica de lavadoras AEG. Se quitan el pañuelo y lo sacuden. Una vez, otra vez, y al bolsillo. Se cambian en el vestuario de mujeres. Dejan el abrigo y se enfundan sus batas, azules o blancas. Adelante. La cadena circula a su ritmo. A su ritmo. Una pieza, otra pieza, otra pieza. Luego descanso. Una pieza, otra pieza más. Encajan piezas y siguen encajando todo el santo día. Florencia encaja en la cadena, una trabajadora más venida del más allá. En Uruguay era otra cosa. Auxiliar de enfermería en el hospital Pereira Rossell de Montevideo, con perspectivas, un marido, un hijo. Se fue todo al garete. Ella, Florencia, se fue. Nunca había llegado tan lejos. Cruzó el océano, la inmensidad. Ahora cruza el descampado todos los días, protegiéndose el pelo con un pañuelo ceñido. La tela sobre las orejas amortigua los gritos y las risas, amortigua murmullos incómodos, recurrentes. Están ahí y ella no puede más que callar para contenerlos, sin demasiado éxito»«Era rumano cuando vivía en Rumania. En España no es español. Ni siquiera es europeo. Es un extranjero, un simple extranjero rumano en España. Algo a lo que se acostumbró muy rápido. Como si una vez rotos los vínculos con todo lo que dejó atrás, su condición no representara más que un espejismo, un encuentro fugaz, intrascendente, e impuesto por fuerzas que escapan a su control.     Ahora Nicolae ni siquiera recuerda el olor de su tierra. Era verde y olía, eso sí lo recuerda. Olía a tierra verde, a hogar. Campos, prados y bosques, pueblos y ciudades. Caballos trotando sobre el suelo embarrado. Un gallo que canta. El ruido del hacha sobre el tronco, que cruje al partirse, que crepitará después presa del fuego en la chimenea. Todo eso era suyo aunque no le perteneciera. En realidad, empezó a ser suyo al alejarse, y cuanto más se alejaba más suyo era.     El mar le recuerda su tierra.     Le recuerda el despertar por la mañana, mirar por la ventana al saltar de la cama en su habitación, ver la hierba impregnada por las gotas de rocío, abrir, coger aire y exhalar con fuerza, el ritual necesario para afrontar un nuevo día. Es un recuerdo al revés. Es un olor tan diferente, el del mar, que le hace sentir la ausencia con mayor intensidad. No olía así, piensa, no olía así. ¿Cómo era? ¿Cómo olía mi tierra desde mi ventana? Es el recuerdo del olvido, recordar que se ha perdido aquello que se abandona. Por eso no le gusta la playa, cuya arena se extiende a sus pies como un manto arrugado y sucio. Mira de reojo mientras coloca ladrillos, uno tras otro, levantando un muro con el que poder protegerse»«En el mar, el pescador lanza sus redes. En su barca, la barca de Alfonso, que es suya como lo fue siempre. Su tripulación, cada vez más mermada hasta convertirse en la nada, él mismo, solo, ante todo y contra todo. Mozos, marineros e incluso pescadores curtidos desertan a la búsqueda de lo que el mar no puede darles. Se convierten en albañiles, encofradores, electricistas, plomeros o simples peones a la espera de una prosperidad que es anhelo más que promesa. Una nueva vida en tierra firme. Para él, el trabajo se multiplica. La pesca, no.     Antes sí.     Antes tenía familia, tenía mar. No hace mucho tiempo. Había pesca, y barcos, y capitanes que regresaban con las bodegas repletas. Alfonso se acuerda del brillo sobre la cubierta, de la fascinación en los ojos de niños y curiosos, de los peces deslizándose por el suelo entre las botas negras porque no cabían en las cajas. Hombres rudos con gorro de lana, como él, alegres y trabajadores, como él, siempre ajetreados. Entonces lo eran. Pescadores orgullosos de su esfuerzo, de su sudor, del hedor que arrastraban después de una dura jornada bregando sin descanso.     El mar se fue secando, como las personas a su alrededor»¿Cómo?Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.
Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.
Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de La paja que saldría después a la venta.Además...Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Manel Barriere Figueroa vea publicada su obra.Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
Hello!

We are Carleigh and Carol: friends, professional writers and graduates of the Writer's Studio program (2012) at Simon Fraser University. 

We love our city, and we love writing, so we think it's time for Vancouver to have its own dedicated writers and readers' centre. Blumin Warehouse will be a place where writers can gather and share ideas, rent desk space at a competitive price and hold readings and workshops. 

A brief overview:

We need at least $5000 to put a month's rent down on a space. Anything we raise beyond that will go towards facility renovations.

***UPDATE!*** Blumin has secured enough private investment funding to rent a space! We'll be shopping around next week, and will keep you updated on the process.

So what does this mean for the Naked Poets campaign? Full steam ahead! Even after we've secured the space, there's office furniture to buy, walls to paint, and wiring to run! We could use your support more than ever! Thank you!  

Blumin Warehouse's rates are competitive with current co-sharing office providers, but we cater specifically to writers' needs with quiet, semi-private, customizable space.

We offer meeting and performance space to special-interest groups for low cost, or for work trade agreements that contribute to ongoing facility improvement.

We will open our doors to the public in October. 

In the spirit of creativity, and considering Vancouver's proclivity for stripping down in the name of fundraising, we've launched the Naked Poets campaign. 

How does this campaign work?

1. Donate. You can donate any amount, and you don't have to submit a poem. All donations are greatly appreciated! 

2. If you'd like to submit a poem, choose the perk that appeals to you, donate, then post your poem in the comments section (scroll down a little after you donate, there will be a field on the thank you page that allows you to send us a direct message.)

If you forget to send us your poem immediately after donating, you can also post your poem in the comments section (look for the comments tab right above the fundraising video on this page)

***If your poem is more than 500 characters, it won't fit in the message field. Email it to us: membership@bluminwarehouse.com***

3. Follow us on Vimeo or Tumblr. Within a week, one of our Naked Poets will read your poem on their video blog. 

(If you'd like to request a specific reader, you certainly can! But not every Naked Poet is available each week, so it may take a little longer for you to see your poem.) 

4. If you've chosen a perk that includes desk rental time, Blumin will send you a confirmation email that you can use any time you want to claim your perk. If you are from out of town, you can gift the desk time to a friend or family member. 

Who are you guys?

An award-winning short fiction writer, Carleigh also works as a social media consultant, so she's handling communications and marketing. Carol's poetry has appeared in the Malahat Review, Ricepaper and CV2, and her work has been translated into three languages. She has been polishing up the business plan at BCIT for the last several months. Candie Tanaka is a writer, artist and social media enthusiast; she's been working on the Blumin Warehouse website. 

Our Naked Poets are Zander, Jasmin, Monica, Leena, Stephanie, Laura, Angela, Danielle, Ben, Meaghan and Kagan. They've come to us for a variety of reasons, and we're thankful for their help!

Why Naked Poets?

Well, there's the obvious comparison-for a lot of writers, sharing our work is no different from baring our skin. It's that old public speaking dream, come to life. 

Trying to get a bunch of writers to congregate in one space is no easy feat; the vulnerability involved in sharing your work (and even your work space) with people you don't know leads many writers to stick to social circles they're familiar with. It's not snobbery, it's self-protection. We acknowledge that coming together under one roof will be strange for some writers. Maybe a little intimidating. We want you to try it anyway! This isn't just office space, this is writers' space. And writing involves risk. So, for our first campaign, we decided to kick things off by pushing past our own comfort zones a little. 

As one of our loyal Naked Poets said: "As far as nudity goes, I can't speak for anyone else, but for me there's more exposure and risk involved in reading my thoughts and experiences to a room full of people than in showing them my Mr. Potato Head skivvies."

East Vancouver, where else?

Did you know that East Vancouver has one of the highest concentrations of artists in the country? From Mount Pleasant to Sunrise, our neighbourhood is packed with sculptors, painters, filmmakers, graphic artists and writers. But sharing a multi-disciplinary work space has its drawbacks. Nobody wants to write next to the gal with the table saw. And the last thing the gal with the table saw needs is your attitude, mister! And so, we writers find ourselves in coffee shops, buying lattes and churros to access the WiFi or not get booted out during the busy hours. 

Or maybe you are already renting space at a place like The Hive, paying a premium to be in trendy Gastown, and looking across the desk at the person working across from you. Not ideal. We may not need absolute silence while we work, but we do need a quiet, semi-private space of our own, that we can access whenever the muse calls, be it noon or 3 am. Blumin membership will guarantee you access to your own space 24 hours a day, seven days a week. 

Read, write, teach, learn.

Blumin will have ample writing space, and room for book clubs and workshops. As a writer, you will be able to organize and offer workshops or book clubs. Host writing group meetings. And that's not all we've got planned for Blumin. In the next few years, we hope to expand our services to include self-publishing facilities, an online writing database and eventually, an urban writer's retreat. We are currently looking in Mount Pleasant, since these areas are accessible by transit and are already heavily populated by artists. We have received overwhelming support from everyone we`ve talked to about the project. Organizations like the Writers Studio have offered their support, and we are thankful! 

Wow, that sounds great! 

Then please donate, and please share this campaign with others! We need at least $5000 to put a month's rent down on a space.  

Other ways you can get involved:

If you can't contribute financially at this time, you can still join the movement! Please share this campaign with writers and lovers of literature, follow the weekly video blogs, and help us get the word out. 

We'll be working hard to make the Bumin space comfortable and cozy, and we'll need clean, lightly used furniture, rugs, and kitchenware. Since we're allowed to paint the space any way we want, we'll also need visual artists! Love design and decorating? Email us! Have some ideas for community programs you'd like Blumin to get involved in? Let us know. 

membership@bluminwarehouse.com 

Thank you for your support!

Also, special thanks to Tara Flynn, who made our fundraising video, Sam Levin, who did the music, and Ross at the PropHouse.

story:
Honestly, we tried another platform because it was first suggested, but was unsuccessful with their fixed funding only format. Please forgive the inconsistencies in the video related to the funding requests for the first program and perks discussed. We really have put the original target goal of 10k out of pocket after hiring a competent author to get the story written for a reasonable 6,500 dollars, plus other related expenses like producing a video to tell a portion of the story, among other things.  I just couldn't see all the effort get hit with a TKO. Getting to know Brian Warren has reinforced my already tenacious work ethic, and like him, I can't go down without a fight. We turned to Indiegogo's more friendly format and are about to springboard from a potential loss and turn it into a win-win without missing a beat of enthusiasm created by all the supporters of the other program. In MMA matches, I've seen an opponent who appears to be on his way out come back with a knockout. Why not here?

Our goal is to get Brian's inspirational biography on the open market and have it go out to the world and do what it was supposed to do...change lives. All on the combined effort of Brian, author David M. Anthony, and me (Dan Arrow - coordinater of the project). Some have already said, "Just do an ebook!" It's not as easy as is sounds and ebooks are only 30% of the market at this time in their history no matter what figures anyone is bolstering. So, it will come out as an ebook too, but the other 70% must be in the traditional book arena. 

Backstory: I was required to form a publishing company and created an imprint for the spine of the book in order to facilitate project needs. Yes, I could have simply handed the project to a traditional publisher, but took on the challenges of creating a team of awesome people working together to accomplish the goal of getting a true life story out to the public. Brian graciously opened up his life with the intent that if even one person out there strives to be a better person because of it, then it was well worth every struggle he's gone through.

In order to complete the goal, we are requesting funds to assist with the second run of books to be printed for book signings, speaking engagements, and direct sales. The first run will be limited and again out of pocket in order to come as close as we could to the original Valentine's Day release date, but will probably not have the ability to release a single tangible copy until near completion of this promo. About 30 days off our original schedule. Not too bad for first timers!

Some of the delay was in part over the collection of photos to enhance the story. The author warned this would occur. It took weeks of appealing to a number of photographers only to have one MMA photographer, Monstro, respond to our request. Everyone else must have been too busy. But what a blessing - he is the best.

Anyway, we're still going to get over the hump with your help...no matter what it takes. I also learned from Brian that sheer determination, or "Heart" as he calls it, can often be a winning factor. 

Apologies to all the fans having to pledge a second time, but I commend you for not giving up on us too easily. Thank you and bless you for your tenacity - "Heart." You'll have the book in hand very soon.

Thanks to Indiegogo for providing yet another opportunity in our persuit to make this project a complete reality.

Preview “Unbreakable Love” by David M. Anthony:

“Ask most young guys what they want to be and they’ll say, ‘a doctor,’ or ‘a fireman,’ or ‘a police officer,’ but I could never answer that question...not until I saw my first cage fight on television. I had seen photographs in magazines, wrestled around with the boys, but seeing cage fighters in action on screen...I don’t know...it did something to me. It was bloody...and crazy...and the dudes were big, but I said to myself, ‘Yeah, that’s want I want to be. I’m doing that!’ Less than a week later I was fighting down in Mexico...no training...just heart. Over forty fights later, the first thing to enter the cage is still my heart.” ~ Brian Warren
