You can find out more about the prestigious Bread Loaf Writers' Conference here: Bread Loaf in SicilyI need to get this money to Bread Loaf by July 7th, which is very short notice. I was recently informed a spot opened up for me, and I was pulled from the wait list. In order to get there, I'm going to need your help. It is essential that working class/poor writers of color have access to these kinds of spaces, but it's not always immediately feasible. What you are contributing is not simply about fulfilling dreams but also equity in artistic spaces.  What I Need

story:
Undercurrents is a Scotland-based magazine that publishes art, experimental writing and critical discourse from around the UK and the rest of the world. We are looking for our readers' help to fund our next issue, and to secure the future of this exciting and necessary project!

For our upcoming issue we need a minimum of £250. This will be spent on paper and printing costs in order to print a limited edition run of 50 copies in black and white. 

If we raise £350 we will be able to print in full colour.

More than £350 will enable us to buy much-needed equipment - to sustainably create more issues to come!

Issue 4 will feature creative and critical writing, interviews and visual art, cut together with the aid of editorial and thoughtful design. We are producing this special issue in collaboration with Glasgow Open House festival, featuring writing that engages with and contextualizes the work on show within the festival. 

The Impact

Undercurrents is more than a magazine. We provide emerging artists with a platform to voice their ideas and communicate them to an extended audience. It is about building dynamic approaches to the idea of what art writing can be and how it can act as a testing ground for radical and unusual theories.

Undercurrents is bigger than just print too. Since our launch we have been running writing and book-making workshops with artists and writers alike, helping to build a community for critical and creative engagement with art and ideas. In 2013 we ran workshops at the Glasgow School of Art and GENERATORprojects, Dundee. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't give money, don't worry! You can still help! Just post a link to this page or our website and spread the word!

Contact:

undercurrentsmagazine.tumblr.com

undercurrentsinfo@gmail.com

story:
About Us

Stories and Queer reading series steps in to embrace queer and queer friendly poets and writers who express themselves, the issues/ideas most important to them. This series makes a positive contribution to the literary and LGBTQ community by encouraging all people to tell their stories without shame or fear. 

We are a traveling reading series that aims to provide a space for local & national readers/listeners to connect with queer & queer-friendly writers in underrepresented areas of the country. The virtual components of this series are unique and allow us to reach beyond the local borders of the event. 

In order to feature local writers, we don't want to remain locked to one location. We want to take the series on the road. Locations include: New York, Los Angeles, Chicago, Miami, San Francisco, Washington D.C., Philadelphia, Denver/Boulder, New Orleans, Indianapolis, Providence, Seattle, San Antonio, Salt Lake City, Albuquerque/Santa Fe, Lincoln St. Louis, Minneapolis/St. Paul, Iowa City, and Burlington. 

About You

Your monetary contribution will not only help us reach our goals for the series, but will have a lasting and positive impact on both literary and LGBTQ communities. We've also included a list of perks to give you a little nudge to contribute. If you prefer a little more privacy, you can donate anonymously to our campaign.

Why Us

Queer poets and writers need to be given a space to share their work just as much as their straight counterparts. This is an issue of visibility. Queer voices should not be marginalized nor hidden away. Even though the LGBTQ community is on the brink of historic advancements in equal rights, bullying and anti-LGBTQ speech is still pervasive. 

Why You

Given the cost of the technology needed as well as other costs involved in starting a series from scratch, we are reaching out to ask you to donate what you can to make the series the best it can be.

What We Need

To get the reading series up and running, we need to purchase the following:

  • Video Projector, Screen, & Microphone: $825.92
  • Adobe InDesign/Photoshop (w/educators discount): $500
  • RT Travel Costs for Two (including economy room for one-night in Chicago, Iowa City, Lincoln, Denver, Santa Fe, Los Angeles: $4,074.08 

Founders 

Ruben Quesada teaches at Eastern Illinois University. He is the Founding Editor of Codex Journal, and the Poetry Editor at The Cossack Review.

Brian Kornell completed his M.F.A. in fiction from the University of Illinois, Urbana-Champaign. He is currently the Fiction Editor for The Cossack Review.

story:
*We raised enough to start our book project! Here is the finished cover! How amazing it is when we can get together and make things happen! Well we didn't make the goal to complete the book interior and publish but that's okay! We're not quitting!Lets keep pushing , donating and sharing! 


Here's a little bit about me and why this project is so important! 

I am Akua Agusi, children's book author and most importantly a mother! I have lots of experience in teaching and mentoring children and during that time I have noticed one thing consistently ... Self esteem either low or based on the wrong things! 

One of these issues being hair. HAIR TEXTURE has always been a topic in the Black community. It actually starts becoming an issue earlier then we'd like to admit.

 I along with my illustrator Sheeba Maya have a precautionary tool as well as a remedy!

 "It's All Good...Hair" children's book.

 As the author of four other children's books I was sure to include the same sense of pride and inspiration that my books are notorious for ,by teaching the ladies that no matter what texture of hair they may have that there is no reason for a sense of Hair Supremacy because they are all beautiful! No need to say things like "real Afrikan hair looks like" or "Fine hair is good hair" All of our variety is indeed ours to claim and appreciate! It is about having great charcter and doing good deeds! 

 Join this journey by donating today, You can also assist by SHARING our cause within your networks so that we may successfully finish this project and get the reading materials into the hands of beautiful little girls all over the world .Lets start to build a solid foundation of *SELF-CONCEPT and SELF-ESTEEM!

I have paired with the AMAZING artist SHEEBA MAYA to complete this necessary book. Kindly, take a visit to her website enjoy and explore her work. It is truly amazing work:

 http://www.sheebamaya.com/. 

 *Shaffer (1985) defines self-perception or self-concept, and self-evaluation or self-esteem as follows: Self-Concept: One’s sense of oneself as a separate individual who possesses a unique set of characteristics.” Self-esteem: A person’s feelings about the qualities and characteristics that make up his or her self-concept.

story:
What is This Magazine?

For 47 years, This Magazine has been publishing the voices, issues and topics mainstream corporate media ignores. From its early days as This Magazine is About Schools, the magazine has grown to be Canada's leading progressive magazine of politics, arts and culture. The magazine is home to award-winning investigative journalism, in-depth coverage of Canadian arts and culture and new work by the best emerging and established talent.

This Magazine regularly publishes stories about politics, the environment, social justice, labour, aboriginal peoples, human rights, feminism and queer issues. Stories like these turn heads, but they seldom turn profits. We publish these stories because we believe they're important. But they're not the kind of topics (Kardashians Do Stuff No One Cares About! Please Your Man Tips! Justin Bieber Insults Historical Landmarks!) that commerical media and magazines churn out and build their big business on.

Nobody owns This Magagzine. We don't rely on advertising or corporate sponsorship. We run a tight ship with low overhead and an operating budget that's smaller than what most mainstream magazines spend on a single issue.

We may not have a big bottom line, but what we do have is freedom. Our writers can tell the stories they want, in the way they want to. Since 1966, This Magazine has brought Canadians thousands of important stories that counter the status quo, expose wrongdoing and expand the debate on issues that matter to you. This important work hasn't gone unnoticed. In 2008, This Magazine was named one of the 20 most influential Canadian magazines of all time. This Magazine has been named Small Magazine of the Year by the Canadian Society of Magazine Editors three years running, received more than 80 National Magazine Award nominations, been a five-time winner at the Canadian Newsstand Awards and been nominated for Utne Independent Press Awards.

This Magazine gives you an uncompromising, uncensored, unapologetic magazine with real people and real politics that have a daily impact on you, your family, your world.

What do we need?

This Magazine turns 47 this month (I know! It really is hard to believe!) and to celebrate this milestone we're looking for 100 people to donate $47 each. That's one dollar for every year the magazine has been publishing.*

But, there's more ... If we reach our fundraising goal of $4,700 in the next 30 days This Magazine Board member, Coach House Books publicist and author of The Dead Kid Detective Agency Evan Munday will eat 47 veggie dogs in two hours! That's a lot of veggie in not a lot of time!**

So if you've always dreamed of seeing Evan eat 47 hot dogs in one sitting here is your chance.

It's also your chance to support independent progressive media and help This Magazine publish uninterrupted for another 47 years. Every little bit helps a small magazine like This and as a thank you for your support we've got great commemorative hot dog eating gifts available. All donations are also tax-deductible!

Help us reach our goal of $4,700 and help This Magazine continue to provide a national forum for people, opinions and ideas not found anywhere eles. We couldn't do this important work without your support.

We can't thank you enough for donating.

This Magazine

P.S. Please help us spread the word about our campaign. Tell your friends! Get on Facebook and Twitter now and help us promote the heck out of our campaign. Cute cat videos can wait! We're talking about Evan Munday eating 47 hot dogs! Let's make it happen!

*Please note we will accept donations in amounts other than $47. This is just a suggested amount that ties in very nicely with our 47th birthday.

**Please note Evan Munday volunteered to do this and we don't regularly make the magazine's Board members eat huge quantities of food in a limited time period in an effort to raise much-needed cash.

story:
For 9 years, you’ve counted on the Voter Guide…

Every November since 2004, the League has published a comprehensive guide for Portland voters.  The guide provides information on local races and referendums, as well as thoughtful endorsements of the candidates and positions that best represent our progressive values.  Voters throughout Portland rely on the League’s guide to provide straightforward, comprehensive information they can trust on Election Day!  

 

…Now the Voter Guide is counting on YOU!

This year, due to cut-backs, the League must- for the first time ever- raise funds to cover the costs of printing the Voter Guide.  We’re asking for your help because, without it, there will not be a 2013 Voter Guide.  If you can help us meet our goal of $500.00, we’ll have what we need to print the guide and get it in your hands before November 5, 2013.

 

 

Where your money will go:

Every cent you donate will go towards printing and distributing the Portland Voter Guide.  If we exceed our goal for the 2013 guide, donations will go towards guides for the 2014 election season.

 

What you get back: 

Most importantly, you’ll get a top quality voter guide to help inform your decisions in November!

But, besides this, you can also get some nifty perks if you donate $25.00 or more!

story:
Howdy!

My name is Heather.  I am 37 & I am still looking for love. 

In the meantime, I am writing a book entitled A Collection of Dating Tales for the Modern Day Princess.  It is a mix of jaw-dropping, heart-clutching stories & deeper, heart-felt reflections on dating & life.

This book is being written for all my ladies out there who feel like they have moments of craziness in their dating search, as it can most def be a bit of a jungle at times.  It is also for my gals who are in happy relationships, who will get a kick out of these single-girl adventures & be deeply appreciative of the love they have found.  And, if there are any guys that want some insight into a lady's perspective on the world of dating, come & get it! 

Humor is at the center of this book, so expect to giggle & guffaw.  Heartfeltness is the space that the book is being written from, so know that we will also be delving deeper into some important lady topics.   I'm beyond thrilled to share this endeavour with you!

Join My Journey!

Self-publishing is no joke, y'all!  Please check out the tiers below for info on how you can support me & do what works for you.  Do you want a book with a personal thank-you note, a shout-out or even a phone convo to hear your favorite date story live & direct?  You decide!

Here are the projected expenses that you will be helping with:

- Indiegogo takes 4 or 9% of money raised.  If I meet my goal or surpass it, it's only 4%; if I don't make it to my goal, then well, the latter.  Let's go for the gold medal on this one, like we are Olympians placing 1st!!

- 3% for credit card processing.

- Compensating folks for graphic design of cover & editing.

- A complimentary book to the graphic designer, photographers for the book cover & each lady that contributed story/stories.

- Self-publishing costs (for book & shipping) for each book through Create Space.

- Kindle conversion cost

&

- My time for writing the book.

Your Impact

Y'all are truly making my literary dreams come true!

I am so appreciative & thankful for your support of pre-ordering your book!  Beyond words. 

Other Ways You Can Support

If you are not able to pre-order my book, you can still help this modern-day princess out!  That's right!

Please feel free to share this info with any friends that you think would like it.  You could facebook share.  Shoot, you could also tweet it up!  Any help that you can offer to spread the word & share the excitement beyond my already-fabulous circle of folks would be awesome! 

MUAH!

XXOO Heather

- A complimentary book to the graphic designer, photographers for the book cover & each lady that contributed story/stories.
- Self-publishing costs (for book & shipping) for each book through Create Space.
- Kindle conversion cost
&
- My time for writing the book.


Your Impact
Y'all are truly making my literary dreams come true!
I am so appreciative & thankful for your support of pre-ordering your book!  Beyond words. 


Other Ways You Can Support
If you are not able to pre-order my book, you can still help this modern-day princess out!  That's right!
Please feel free to share this info with any friends that you think would like it.  You could facebook share.  Shoot, you could also tweet it up!  Any help that you can offer to spread the word & share the excitement beyond my already-fabulous circle of folks would be awesome! 
MUAH!
XXOO Heather

story:
Nuestro proyecto


 La Alianza Laura Aponte por la Paz Social (ALAPï¿½S) es una organizaciï¿½n sin fines de lucro. Se fundï¿½ en memoria de la poeta Laura Aponte Rivera, joven universitaria que falleciï¿½ vï¿½ctima de una bala perdida en 1997. Tenï¿½a 19 aï¿½os. Sus amigos y familiares establecieron la ALIANZA buscando aportar al grave problema de la criminalidad en Puerto Rico, que nos arrebata a tantos jï¿½venes y deja dolorosas consecuencias en las familias afectadas.

 

ALAPï¿½S promueve la justicia social mediante proyectos que fomenten el anï¿½lisis, la reflexiï¿½n, la educaciï¿½n transformadora y la defensa de los derechos de las vï¿½ctimas. 

 

Nuestro lema es convertir el dolor en solidaridad y paz. Trabajamos proyectos que integran la educaciï¿½n, la prevenciï¿½n y la sanaciï¿½n. En nuestro Centro de Ayuda brindamos servicios integrados a las familias de los que han fallecido vï¿½ctima de un delito grave. Ofrecemos de forma gratuita, apoyo, orientaciï¿½n y psicoterapia a los familiares de las vï¿½ctimas fatales de asesinato, homicidio, carjacking, negligencia al conducir o conductores ebrios o intoxicados.

 

Su Colaboraciï¿½n


Nuestro Centro de Ayuda necesita de su colaboraciï¿½n para continuar ofreciendo servicios gratuitos al cada vez mayor nï¿½mero de participantes que nos llega. Necesitamos reunir $7,000 dï¿½lares para garantizar la operaciï¿½n anual del Centro de Ayuda. Con tu contribuciï¿½n aportas al paï¿½s, garantizas nuestra presencia en la lucha contra el crimen y nos ayudas a continuar brindando servicios gratuitos a las vï¿½ctimas, como:


1. Terapia psicolï¿½gica individual para adultos y niï¿½os, grupos de apoyo e intervenciones en crisis.

2. Espacio especializado para la terapia a niï¿½os.

3. Orientaciï¿½n legal y acompaï¿½amiento al tribunal para las vï¿½ctimas.

4. Movimiento social hacia la prevenciï¿½n de la violencia mediante publicaciones y charlas. 

5. Educaciï¿½n y empoderamiento para hacer valer los derechos de las vï¿½ctimas.


ï¿½...nada vuelve a una persona mï¿½s feliz que el empeï¿½arse a favor de la felicidad ajena; y esto vale tanto en la relaciï¿½n ï¿½ntima como en el compromiso social de luchar por "otro mundo posible". Frei Betto - teï¿½logo brasileï¿½o.


En el Centro de Ayuda promovemos la solidaridad a travï¿½s de los servicios que brindamos a nuestros participantes en momentos de mucho dolor ante la pï¿½rdida irreparable de un ser amado. Ayï¿½danos a ayudar, apoya la PAZ. 

 

Otras formas de ayudar


Si no puede cooperar econï¿½micamente hay muchas formas de ayudar. ï¿½Da la mano por la Paz! Ayï¿½danos a correr la voz enviando esta campaï¿½a a su familia, amigos y contactos. 


Y puedes unirte a la familia de voluntarios de ALAPï¿½S. Son muchas las tareas en que puedes aportar.


 Para mï¿½s informaciï¿½n visita nuestra pï¿½gina web: www.alapas.org o bï¿½scanos en Facebook: Centro de Ayuda ALAPAS

story:
This is the REAL SOUTH

We passionately love life in the Southern U.S. in all its quirky, creative, soulful glory. We're especially proud of the South's continuing contributions to the arts, especially music and literature. We want to turn you on to the best authentic art, music, and writing the South has to offer, especially the REAL stuff, the lesser known, under-the-radar stuff. Stuff from indie record labels, small presses, mom-and-pop cafes, industry outsiders, artisans, odd little festivals, rising stars as well as some obscure gems from the past. We also love Southern food, and want to show you the best places to find the real down-home stuff. And even how to make it yourself. Then there are the unforgettable people, the places, the culture, and so much more that makes life in the South so deeply rich and fulfilling. We want to serve you a big ol' bimonthly helping of digital soul food.

There are some great Southern magazines and websites out there, and they do a hell of a job covering the big names, high-end boutiques, and trendy spots in the South. There's also a dismaying trend of reality TV shows bent on exploiting tacky Southern stereotypes. The REAL SOUTH is so much larger, more sophisticated, more complex, more artistic, and yes, more culturally and racially diverse. And that's what we want to show the world.
 
Each issue of REAL SOUTH MAGAZINE comes packed with book and CD reviews; profiles of Southern artists, writers, musicians, and personalities; fiction and poetry from emerging new talents; a chosen Southern food, with recommendations where to find it and how to cook it...and so much more!
 
Every year we will issue special edition e-books: the best of the year's fiction, and the best of the food features, with extra recipes and tips. In 2013 we hope to issue a special guide to Southern festivals and county fairs.
 

Who We Are
 
Editor and Publisher Lisa J. Gouveia
Austin, Texas
I was Managing Editor and Art Director for a small quarterly print magazine showcasing offbeat Southern culture, and I dearly loved it. It is sadly no more, a casualty of the increasingly difficult print magazine industry. I am now Art Director for a bi-monthly regional home & living magazine. But I kept getting emails, press releases, and submissions for great Southern stories and artists. A couple of small presses even sent me new books to review. Bands kept sending me their CDs. Writers and photographers throughout the South kept asking to help find a new home for their work. I soon realized I had an entire issue's worth of stuff just sitting in my inbox, not to mention a long list of story ideas that we didn't get to for the last magazine. I even have the software to lay it all out. So let's do this.
 
Contributing Editor and Fiction Editor John Dufresne
Dania Beach, Florida
John Dufresne has won the Yankee Magazine award for fiction, the Transatlantic Review/Henfield Foundation Award, a PEN Syndicated Fiction award. His novel Louisiana Power & Lightwas a Barnes & Noble Discover Great New Writers selection and a New York Times Notable Book of the Year, 1994. He is also the author of two short story collections, The Way That Water Enters Stone and Johnny Too Bad,three chapbooks, Lethe, Cupid, Time and Love; Well Enough Alone; and I Will Eat a Piece of the Roof and You Can Eat the Window and the novels, Love Warps the Mind a Little, also a New York Times Notable Book of the Year, 1997, Deep in the Shade of Paradise, and most recently, Requiem, Mass. He is one of the thirteen authors of the mystery novel, Naked Came the Manatee. His monologue, The Freezer Jesus was produced as part of Native Tongues at Le Chat Noir Theater in New Orleans. He wrote the screenplay for the short film, “The Freezer Jesus” and, with Donald Papy, the feature film To Live and Die in Dixie, both directed by Harper Philbin.His story “Johnny Too Bad,” which originally appeared in Triquarterly, was included in New Stories from the South: The Year’s Best, 2003. His story “The Timing of Unfelt Smiles” which originally appeared in Miami Noir, was included in Best American Mystery Stories of 2007. His story “The Cross-Eyed Bear, which originally appeared in Boston Noir,” was selected to appear in as a Best American Mystery Stories of 2010. He edited the short story anthology Blue Christmas. His books on writing, The Lie That Tells a Truth and Is Life Like This? are used in many university writing programs. He’s a professor at Florida International University in Miami.

Lisa Gouveia and John Dufresne are the main staff of REAL SOUTH MAGAZINE, with the rest of it coming from an established network of freelancers all over the South, particularly Texas, Florida, Louisiana, Tennessee, and North Carolina.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Printing is just too expensive, and advertisers are spending less every day. So it makes the most sense to publish REAL SOUTH MAGAZINE in the exciting new digital realm.
 
The first order of business is getting the magazine set up on the Blue Toad digital newsstand (based in Orlando, Florida--we're Southern through and through!). This requires just over a thousand dollars in one-time setup fees, digital page conversion fees, and mandatory licenses for iPhone, Android, Amazon, and Nook content.
 
We already have about half of this money and just need the rest. Each issue after that will only cost a few hundred to produce, which is much more affordable. We mainly just need some help to get the ball rolling.
 
After that is covered, any remaining funds go to the contributors. Some have graciously donated their work for the premiere issue, but we hope to be able to pay them anyway. We strongly feel that ALL contributors should be PAID for their work. So many magazines and websites can't (or won't) pay for content, and that just cheapens us all. Lisa Gouveia says, "A quarterly I once worked for was run by a millionaire who refused to pay contributors because he could always get them for free. That's just so wrong. I'm not even a thousandaire on some days, but I can scrape up at least enough for them to go have a nice dinner or something." Hopefully more than that. Oh, and REAL SOUTH MAGAZINE will also pay upon acceptance--we never understood making contributors wait months for publication to get paid.
 

The Impact

Your contributions help showcase the rich and diverse authentic Southern culture that isn't currently being covered in the depth and variety it deserves. You are helping ensure that worthy talents find their audience and that past treasures aren't forgotten.
 
You are also helping make a stand for paying for artistic work. You are helping establish a culture where creative work is valued and rewarded. You are helping prove that digital publishing can be affordable, professional, and profitable.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Hey, we know the economy's still pretty tight. Here are some other ways you can help:

  • Get the word out on Facebook, Twitter, blogs, and websites. Tell your friends.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread our campaign.
  • Send us stories, suggestions, reviews, and ideas at submissions@realsouthmagazine.com. Tip us off to great Southern artists, writers, musicians, places, people, etc. Tell us about a cool mom-&-pop cafe or your meemaw's fried chicken recipe.
  • Send us leads for people who might want to advertise in REAL SOUTH MAGAZINE. We'll even pay you a chunk of the commission if they buy an ad.

We are excited and proud to bring the REAL SOUTH to a worldwide digital audience. The first issue will be July/August 2012.

Thank you kindly!

story:
Our Story

My name is Jim Maher, and I am a father of two (nearly three!) boys.  I am a stay-at-home dad, because my wife's terrible back problems prevent her from being able to lift the boys.  I would love more than anything to have a career that allows me to stay at home for my children while providing a decent life for me and my family.  The one way I know how to do it is write my stories. 

I write for kids because they are the most important audience.  We lose them, we lose everything.  Most publishing houses won't accept anything unless it's been professionally edited, so that's what I'm driving for. 

My book, Mike Logan vs. The Crosstown Horde, is a crossover horror/hockey adventure that will appeal to Canadians and hockey fans everywhere.  I would like to get it professionally edited before sending it out so it will have the best chance of being published. 

The long and the short is that I want to be the last of the great family men.  It's my dream come true.


The Impact

My campaign is really more of a personal one.  If I don't raise the 1000 dollars, I'll have to get a full-time job (I know, I know, what a sob story, but my kids are my life) and my wife will get steadily worse in the back department.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I need about 1000 dollars to get Mike Logan professionally edited.  It will be combed over with a brilliant eye, and if you donate $20, I'll make sure you get a free signed copy some day in the future!

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends, tell the world!  Use the share tools here on indiegogo, tweet, facebook, anything you got, let everyone know!

story:
¿Qué?

La casa del estanque nos va desentrañando, con una prosa fluida y fresca, los misterios que rodean a una familia burguesa de mediados del siglo XX  de la mano de Eugenia, una niña curiosa y rebelde.

Avanzamos página a página de la mano de Eugenia, una niña curiosa y rebelde con la que vamos desentrañando los misterios que rodean a una familia burguesa de mediados del siglo XX, con una protagonista femenina de carácter muy dominante que nunca ha sentido afecto alguno por su nieta. Todos la temen. Sin embargo, la pequeña va creciendo con una energía poco común, dispuesta a correr riesgos con tal de ser ella misma, como si fuera una fuerza de la naturaleza.

A partir del momento en que toma conciencia de que siempre se ha sentido fuera de lugar, se resiste a permanecer al margen, como si algo en su vida no acabara de encajar. Cuenta con una amiga de clase inferior, con la que siente una fuerte complicidad. Con su abuelo, un personaje que se mueve entre luces y sombras, con el que Eugenia tiene una relación muy especial, y que será clave para desentrañar un enigma que marca el paso del tiempo. Y con la Casa del Estanque, que parece dispuesta a susurrarle algunos secretos para que, por fin, encuentre su camino.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de publicar obras poco convencionales pero de indudable calidad, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para promocionar cada título cuando esta todavía se encuentra en proceso de edición.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy se nos presenta Ana Riera.

Estudié filología en Barcelona y vivo en Madrid desde 2002. Compagino mi trabajo de traductora con el de escritora. Entre otros libros ha publicado Mujeres que nacieron diferentes (2016), Dime cómo te sientes y te diré que peli ver (2017) y 52 Experiencias para disfrutar en familia (2018). Por lo que se refiere a mi faceta de traductora, trabajo para el mundo editorial (Milagros prácticos para Marte y Venus, de John Gray; Zenón y la tortuga, de Nicholas Fearn; Cartas a nuestras hijas, de Kristine van Roden y Molly Davis; La gestión de la ópera, de Philippe Agid y Jean-Claude Tarondeau, entre otros muchos), y también para el teatral. Se han estrenado varias obras en las que firmo como traductora para el Centro Dramático Nacional, entre ellas Celebración, de Harold Pinter (2010), Agosto, de Tracy Letts (2011), La Loba, de Lillian Hellman (2012), y Top Girls, de Caryl Churchill (2019). También publico relatos breves en el blog El placer de escribir y críticas teatrales en la revista digital Culturamas.

La casa del estanque es mi primera novela, en la que he trabajado sobre ámbitos conocidos, en los que las intrigas familiares marcaron a fuego el carácter de una niña diferente en un mundo de adultos en general bastante perversos.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«A mi abuela no le gustaban las niñas, así que el día que nací no encontró ningún motivo para celebrarlo. No sintió deseos de cogerme en brazos, ni de hacerme ninguna carantoña. De hecho, ni siquiera se acercó a verme. En lugar de eso decidió hacer una visita al podólogo, para que le arreglara una uña que venía fastidiándole desde hacía una semana. Me la imagino sonriendo, aliviada, de vuelta a casa. Seguro que después se sentó un ratito en su rincón favorito, una galería estrecha y acristalada que se abría al jardín. Allí podía disfrutar sin interferencias de los últimos rayos de sol del atardecer. Según ella eran los mejores del día, porque llevaban concentrada toda la energía de la jornada y porque se esforzaban en ser amables con quien sabía apreciarlos antes de ser engullidos definitivamente por la tiranía implacable de la noche.
          En realidad, no me conoció hasta que cumplí un mes y medio, terminada la obligada cuarentena. Fue un desapacible domingo de invierno. Se aproximó al carro, por aquel entonces el centro de mi mundo finito, y me observó durante un breve instante:
          —Espero que al menos duerma bien —exclamó con desgana.
          —Bueno, todavía se despierta de madrugada. Pero se toma el biberón y vuelve a quedarse dormida —respondió solícita mi madre.
          —Pues vaya lata, no poder descansar bien.
          La voz grave y profunda de mi abuela me gustó desde el primer momento. Me acariciaba los sentidos y me hacía entrar en un agradable estado de sopor entre la vigilia y el sueño, un estado que me resultaba a la vez relajante y estimulante.
          Tras echarme un último vistazo, hizo chasquear la lengua y se marchó a la cocina. Regresó con un vaso lleno de café humeante bien cargado y se sentó a la cabecera de la mesa, su sitio desde hacía mucho. Apenas llevaban unos días casados cuando le dijo a mi abuelo:
          —Juan, he pensado que debería sentarme yo en la cabecera. Es la silla que queda más cerca de la cocina y como me gusta servir la comida personalmente me resultará más cómodo.
          —Como quieras. Si te parece bien, yo me sentaré a tu izquierda —se limitó a contestar él.
          —No, mejor a la derecha».

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción BACK IT es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Ana Riera vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Política de Privacidad
story_txt:
¿Qué?
La casa del estanque nos va desentrañando, con una prosa fluida y fresca, los misterios que rodean a una familia burguesa de mediados del siglo XX  de la mano de Eugenia, una niña curiosa y rebelde.
Avanzamos página a página de la mano de Eugenia, una niña curiosa y rebelde con la que vamos desentrañando los misterios que rodean a una familia burguesa de mediados del siglo XX, con una protagonista femenina de carácter muy dominante que nunca ha sentido afecto alguno por su nieta. Todos la temen. Sin embargo, la pequeña va creciendo con una energía poco común, dispuesta a correr riesgos con tal de ser ella misma, como si fuera una fuerza de la naturaleza.
A partir del momento en que toma conciencia de que siempre se ha sentido fuera de lugar, se resiste a permanecer al margen, como si algo en su vida no acabara de encajar. Cuenta con una amiga de clase inferior, con la que siente una fuerte complicidad. Con su abuelo, un personaje que se mueve entre luces y sombras, con el que Eugenia tiene una relación muy especial, y que será clave para desentrañar un enigma que marca el paso del tiempo. Y con la Casa del Estanque, que parece dispuesta a susurrarle algunos secretos para que, por fin, encuentre su camino.
¿Quiénes?
Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de publicar obras poco convencionales pero de indudable calidad, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para promocionar cada título cuando esta todavía se encuentra en proceso de edición.
De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.
Hoy se nos presenta Ana Riera.
Estudié filología en Barcelona y vivo en Madrid desde 2002. Compagino mi trabajo de traductora con el de escritora. Entre otros libros ha publicado Mujeres que nacieron diferentes (2016), Dime cómo te sientes y te diré que peli ver (2017) y 52 Experiencias para disfrutar en familia (2018). Por lo que se refiere a mi faceta de traductora, trabajo para el mundo editorial (Milagros prácticos para Marte y Venus, de John Gray; Zenón y la tortuga, de Nicholas Fearn; Cartas a nuestras hijas, de Kristine van Roden y Molly Davis; La gestión de la ópera, de Philippe Agid y Jean-Claude Tarondeau, entre otros muchos), y también para el teatral. Se han estrenado varias obras en las que firmo como traductora para el Centro Dramático Nacional, entre ellas Celebración, de Harold Pinter (2010), Agosto, de Tracy Letts (2011), La Loba, de Lillian Hellman (2012), y Top Girls, de Caryl Churchill (2019). También publico relatos breves en el blog El placer de escribir y críticas teatrales en la revista digital Culturamas.
La casa del estanque es mi primera novela, en la que he trabajado sobre ámbitos conocidos, en los que las intrigas familiares marcaron a fuego el carácter de una niña diferente en un mundo de adultos en general bastante perversos.
¿Por qué?
Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:
«A mi abuela no le gustaban las niñas, así que el día que nací no encontró ningún motivo para celebrarlo. No sintió deseos de cogerme en brazos, ni de hacerme ninguna carantoña. De hecho, ni siquiera se acercó a verme. En lugar de eso decidió hacer una visita al podólogo, para que le arreglara una uña que venía fastidiándole desde hacía una semana. Me la imagino sonriendo, aliviada, de vuelta a casa. Seguro que después se sentó un ratito en su rincón favorito, una galería estrecha y acristalada que se abría al jardín. Allí podía disfrutar sin interferencias de los últimos rayos de sol del atardecer. Según ella eran los mejores del día, porque llevaban concentrada toda la energía de la jornada y porque se esforzaban en ser amables con quien sabía apreciarlos antes de ser engullidos definitivamente por la tiranía implacable de la noche.          En realidad, no me conoció hasta que cumplí un mes y medio, terminada la obligada cuarentena. Fue un desapacible domingo de invierno. Se aproximó al carro, por aquel entonces el centro de mi mundo finito, y me observó durante un breve instante:          —Espero que al menos duerma bien —exclamó con desgana.          —Bueno, todavía se despierta de madrugada. Pero se toma el biberón y vuelve a quedarse dormida —respondió solícita mi madre.          —Pues vaya lata, no poder descansar bien.          La voz grave y profunda de mi abuela me gustó desde el primer momento. Me acariciaba los sentidos y me hacía entrar en un agradable estado de sopor entre la vigilia y el sueño, un estado que me resultaba a la vez relajante y estimulante.          Tras echarme un último vistazo, hizo chasquear la lengua y se marchó a la cocina. Regresó con un vaso lleno de café humeante bien cargado y se sentó a la cabecera de la mesa, su sitio desde hacía mucho. Apenas llevaban unos días casados cuando le dijo a mi abuelo:          —Juan, he pensado que debería sentarme yo en la cabecera. Es la silla que queda más cerca de la cocina y como me gusta servir la comida personalmente me resultará más cómodo.          —Como quieras. Si te parece bien, yo me sentaré a tu izquierda —se limitó a contestar él.          —No, mejor a la derecha».
¿Cómo?
Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción BACK IT es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.
Además...
Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Ana Riera vea publicada su obra.

story:
Overview

Spandana is a collective effort by Founding Editor, Lincoln T Beauchamp, along with advisory, and contributing editors, to present ideas, responses and motivations by writers, musicians, artists, scientists and others to all types of situations throughout world, and beyond. The range could be from piracy on the high seas, to unending discoveries by space scientists.

Spandana - Response and Motivation

Spandana is a museum quality, culturally diverse publication, with some content appearing in its original language with translation into English and other languages.

Within the pages: music, photography, architecture, fashion, fiction, poetry, interviews, travel, dance, space science, and various other means of response through creativity by visionaries, activists, contemporary artists, younger artists, and the works of ancestors. Spandana is a confluence of cultures. 

The Book: Coffee Table Hardback, 9.5 x 11.75 inches. Approximately 160 pages / 45 color / 89 black & white / inner cover ad spreads.  Spandana is printed on the finest paper available.    Spandana will not be offered as an ebook.

Funding Designations

Administrative costs.

Printing costs.

Payments to contributors, copyright owners, literary estate executors, and others.

Payments to service providers such as copy editors, translators, graphic designers, and others. 

 

Partial List of Contributing and Advisory Editors

Elder Eugene B. Redmond, Author, Educator, Archivist; Poet Laureate, East St. Louis, Illinois

Tamara Madison, Poetry, Literature; Orlando, Florida

Mark Worden, Multilingual Journalist: Italian, English, French, Spanish; Milan, Italy

Alyssa Ryvers, Composer, Human Rights and Victims of Abuse Activist; Toronto, Ontario

Michael Warr, Poetry, Fiction; San Francisco, California

Scott Cashman, Writer, Jazz Archivist, Educator; Chicago, Illinois

Joelle Parent, French Translation and Editor; Montreal, Quebec

Amanda Dunsmore, Multidisciplinary Arts, Curator; County Clare, Ireland

Michael Limnios, Multilingual Music Journalist: Greek, English, Spanish, Portuguese, Tibetan, Hindi, and Turkish; Athens, Greece

David Witter, Musician, Author, Educator; Chicago, Illinois

Jean Francois Fabiano, Multi-instrumentalist, Composer, Bandleader; Montreal, Quebec; Paris, France

Jessica K. Carter, Fashion, Caribbean Arts, Activist; Toronto, Ontario;  Panama City, Panama

Deitra Farr, Blues Artist, Writer, Archivist; Chicago, Illinois

Jimmy Payne Jr., Dance, Theater, Black Entertainment History; Chicago, Illinois

Minka Maasdam, Travel; Dubai, UAE

Joan Hackett, Photography; Chicago, Illinois

Oscar Romero, Painter, Muralist; Chicago, Illinois; Mexico City, Mexico

Kevin Beauchamp, Jazz Photography Archivist, Music Producer, Chicago, Illinois

Briefly, About Me, Lincoln T. Beauchamp,  a/k/a Chicago Beau, Founding Editor

       In 1988 I founded Literati International Publishing. We published literary magazines: Literati Chicago and Literati Internazionale, publications dedicated to multiculturalism. In 1989, I founded The Original Chicago Blues Annual, the first Black owned, Blues-Afrocentric, yet culturally inclusive Blues publication dedicated to preserving an original art form created by Blacks in the Americas; and the foundation of modern music from Jazz, to Rock, to Hip-Hop.  

OCBA was published for seven years with broad support from sponsors and advertisers that included: The State of Illinois, City of Chicago, Icelandair, Alitalia Airlines, Rizzoli Books, Sony Music, DIW Records, Art Ensemble of Chicago, Delmark Records, Jazz in Sardegna, and many more.

To date I've published fifteen journals, books, and magazines that include the works of over 100 writers and artists, among them: Pulitzer Prize Poet, Gwendolyn Brooks; American Book Award, and Pushcart Prize recipient, Eugene B. Redmond; Alejo Carpentier; Kalamu Ya Salaam; Jayne Cortez; Deitra Farr; Hart Leroy Bibbs; Amiri Baraka; Beauford Delaney; Henry Miller; Margaret Walker; J. P. Donleavey; Quincy Troupe; Joan Hackett; Joseph Jarman; Henry Dumas; Julio Finn; David Witter; Julie Parsons; and many more.

As a writer, I've published numerous articles, conducted interviews with luminaries across the arts, and authored five books including the rare and highly collectible coffee table book, Great Black Music-The Art Ensemble of Chicago, 1998.  In 2010, University of Illinois Press published The Best of The Original Chicago Blues Annual, that I edited, and contributed writing. In 2017, I published book 1 of my memoir, Too Much UnConvenience - Recollections of a Blues Gypsy.   

I am co-founder of Chicago Blues Experience, a Blues Museum for the City of Chicago opening in 2020; and founding board member of the Chicago Blues Education Foundation. 

Endorsements

      Lincoln Beauchamp, aka Chicago Beau, is one of the true jewels of African American culture. A writer and composer, singer and harmonica player, his view of the arts is comprehensive, and his view of the world is insightful. Beau is an educator who teaches at Harper College in Illinois. His writing students have brought their classroom work into the published world as he helps them realize their goals. In fact, it can be said that his body of work has left a lasting impression on the world.

Scott Cashman, Ph. D., Manager of Personal and Cultural Enrichment, Harper College

      Lincoln Beauchamp is part gypsy, explorer, musician, poet, philosopher, activist, teacher, warrior and more, all wrapped up in a blues groove with a fervent love and respect for humanity in all its expressions.  He invites us to explore the world and love the journey in whatever it may bring.  He encourages us to “trust the cosmos” even when we hesitate to trust one another.  He inspires us to create and cultivate our very best.  His message is just a ageless and timeless as he is...

Tamara J. Madison,  writer, poet, performer, and editor

      Spandana is a project from the heart of Lincoln Beauchamp. It grew from the synthesis of his life's experiences and expresses how he knows the world could be. It celebrates great achievements in many areas of humanity. I am proud to be associated with Lincoln and with this exciting project.

Cheryl Atkins, Ph. D.

 

Disclaimer:  Not all of the organizations or persons listed herein, their representatives, copyright holders, or other interested parties, have guaranteed or asserted their willingness to have a presence in Spandana.  It is the intent of the publisher and editors to solicit works, time, and energy from the above artists and others mentioned for the debut, and following issues from time to time.  All commitments will be finalized in a manner agreed upon by the concerned parties. Until that happens, what is contained here is not to be construed as anything more than a proposal and suggestions.

story:
The Beginnings of B-Side 

B-Side started as a passion and a dream of in the wild, a creative studio based in Singapore. As creatives ourselves, we believe that the workings and processes are as—if not more—important than the end product itself. 

What makes good design or art possible? Do artists or designers helming from different cultural backgrounds have anything in common? How do you kickstart a creation process while staying open to possibilities along the way? 

The Southeast Asian online publication aims to seek out conversations that dig deep into the creative process. With curiosity, B-Side guides readers into the creative realm, spanning across art, architecture, design, performance and lifestyle. 

Get to know art from a more in-depth perspective. Dive into the B-Side. 

 

Print Edition: Best of B-Side

The Print Edition: Best of B-Side is as the name suggests: a collection of articles that best represents all that the online publication chooses to stand for, and also a selection of never-been-published content. The publication will feature mainly English content and other languages such as Thai.

In this one-off physical edition, readers will discover in-depth articles, commentary, interviews, quotes, photo essays as well as other engaging content that stimulate, challenge and provide food for thought with regards to the creative process.

Glimpse into the spaces that women occupy in the Southeast Asian art scene. Learn more about the language surrounding the differently-abled community. Discover how cross-cultural conversations between artists can share similarities as well as distinction in the same field of practice.  

We hope that this publication will elevate the profiles of lesser-known practitioners, celebrate the work of creative writers and serve as an inspiration to readers. 

Join the team in this multifaceted journey of rediscovering the region on creative and artistic terms.

 

About The Team 

To write and uncover Southeast Asia from a place of authenticity and passion, the B-Side team is based in different countries that make up this region.

Curious about their own cultures and aware of the ins-and-outs of their chosen countries, the team writes from a lens of being an insider—capturing the nuances and significance behind each article they choose to engage with. 

Currently, the writers are based in Bangkok, Manila, Jakarta and Singapore. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Being an independent publication, B-Side is all about rallying a community and coming together for similar passions in the region. Your support to make this print edition a reality means a lot to us. 

 

Our part:

  • Time spent writing and editing existing and new content
  • Designing the publication
  • Payment to all our contributors for their work
  • Managing production, press check and distribution

 

With the help of your funding, we will be able to: 

  • Print 500 units of the publication 
  • Mail a free copy of the publication to each of the interviewees, and contributors who have contributed their time and work for the publication 

 

We are not planning to make a profit from the sale of this publication. Our aim is to cover the costs associated with the printing and distribution of the publication. Any and all profits will be invested into the operations (i.e., paying all our contributors) of B-Side. 

 

Timeline 

  • 29 June: Design & layout to be ready for printing 
  • 3 weeks from 29 June: Colour-proofing and print production
  • 20 July: Publications ready 
  • 2 weeks from 20 July: Preparation for shipping worldwide 
  • 13 August: Hardcopy publications to be shipped 
  • 13 August: Digital publication to be sent via email 

 

Other Ways You Can Help 

If you are not able to donate or have already donated, please help us spread the word!

story:
Charlie Liebert, at 35, left Atheism to become a Christian.  In high school and college, he was taught he evolved from pond scum, and he wholeheartedly believed it.  In his early 20s, he earned a BS in Chemistry and an MBA in marketing. At his conversion, in 1977, he immediately saw the contradiction with the Genesis' story of Creation and the Evolution he knew.  After three years of study, he evolved from an Evolutionist into a Young Earth Creationist. He's conducted over 400 workshops and seminars for children and adults teaching Christian Apologetics in many different contexts.  In the late 90's he worked for Ken Ham's ministry "Answers in Genesis" for several years.  Starting in 1995, for ten years, he produced a TV show from his seminars called "Creation Foundation Explanation” in Greensboro NC.  During his 43 years in NC Charlie became known as an excellent teacher of Christian Apologetics.  He and his wife Terry live in Carlisle, Pennsylvania, 

Converted from hard-core atheism, he understands the atheistic worldview.  He's often heard the world ask “hard” questions that stump believers and thwart their desire to share the Gospel.  He searched the Scripture to see how Jesus got past those questions.   He asked probing questions to reveal their presuppositions. Jesus encounter with the Pharisees about John's baptism is the best example of this strategy.   In 2012 Charlie taught this questioning strategy to a group of Christian Businessmen.  It was so well received he put it into book form in  "Always Be Ready to Give an Answer!"  which presents a personal Christian evangelism strategy you can use to get to the Gospel before answering those “hard” questions.  His second book, ANSWERS for “The Hope That Is In You”, gives direct, simple answers to the world’s “hard” questions, answering more than 100 of the questions Christians are often asked by unbelievers.  The combination of these two books helps every Christian become a fearless evangelist.  Jesus told us to declare the Gospel to the world around us.  Now Christians can do it with confidence!

Charlie's newest book challenges Evolution at its core, SCIENCE. It’s already been published and ready for market, however I'll need $6,000 to do proper marketing.  Because I’m retired and on a fixed income I have decided to crowdfund to raise this money. 

This book “Without 3 Miracles Darwin’s Dead!” has the potential to change minds about the viability of Evolution because “Science Proves Atheistic Evolution is IMPOSSIBLE!”  I am exposing Evolution’s scientific impossibility because it has to violate three scientific laws to succeed; The First and Second laws of Thermodynamics and the Law of Biogenesis.   To violate a scientific law, you need a miracle and Atheistic Evolution cannot allow any, much less THREE!  I call these three necessary miracles: Magic, Frankenstein, and Uphill Molasses.  Magic is the appearance of something from nothing, a violation of the First Law.  Frankenstein is the generation of life from dead chemicals.  This violates Biogenesis which says: “life ONLY comes from life and ONLY from life of the same kind.”  The 2nd Law simply says the Universe is irreversibly running down.  Evolution is constantly gaining complexity in conflict with this law.  It’s like molasses running uphill against gravity, the third impossibility.  I’m ready to present these arguments that destroy Evolution but I need help to start the marketing.  Will you help me?  I’m offering incentives for contributions over $25.  At $25 you receive a downloadable copy of the e-book.  At $50 you get a copy of the softcover edition and at $150 a hardback copy.  A $500 contribution will get you soft cover copies of all three of my published books and at $1000 you receive hardback copies of all three books.  Please make a contribution to help defeat the lie of Evolution.  

This following section describes in more detail the content of the book.  In bearing testimony for Christ, through my web page, and in my role as a seminar, workshop leader and as a teacher I’m often asked: “Do you believe in Evolution?” I’ll answer: “No I don’t!” Then I get responses like: “Why not, it’s proven by science?” OR “The evidence for it is overwhelming!” OR “Only ignorant or closed-minded fundamentalists don’t believe it!”  I even get that kind of reaction from some who call themselves Christians. In this book, I am taking a hard-nosed position saying to the world; “Atheistic Evolution is scientifically impossible because it breaks three scientific LAWS” If you understand science you know scientific laws CAN’T remain laws if they are broken.  Evolution breaks THREE of them!  Besides the three laws, we’ll explore other issues that contribute to Evolution’s impossibility. There are seven chapters in this book. The first four show the impossibility of Evolution from a scientific viewpoint. The fifth is an article: The Irrationality of Unbelief by Mitch Cervinka. Chapter six looks at the Atheist’s dilemma explaining these problems.  Chapter seven examines the three most important evolutionary impacts on US culture, Atheism’s meaninglessness, the US beliefs about Creation or Evolution.  Millions of dollars are wasted on Evolutionary promotion & research with no benefit.

Chapter 1, Science and Knowing develops an understanding of the strengths and weaknesses of science and the scientific method. Science can answer some questions, but not ALL questions. Since both Creation and Evolution are descriptions of past events we must ask: “Can science help us know which model of the past is true?” One must be true and the other false because they cannot both be true.

Chapter 2, Evolution explains how it works and explains the issues it raises. According to its proponents, Evolution creates the Universe, without God, beginning with nothing and ending with everything that exists today. All the raw material suddenly appears and explodes with the Big Bang. During billions of years elements are formed in stars, and eventually, our Solar System assembles itself. On planet Earth, with large amounts of water, living cells arise from dead chemicals. These first cells change through mutation and Natural Selection into all the diverse forms of life on Earth today.

Chapter 3, describes Darwin’s THREE Impossible Miracles. I’ll explain the three scientific LAWS Evolution must break to succeed. Later I’ll deal with many other barriers to Evolution’s success. Remember Evolution starts with nothing and ends with everything that exists both today and through all time in the Universe. The three miracles are:

Miracle 1 – MAGIC, something from nothing. Like the magician that pulls the rabbit out of the hat, Evolution brings everything out of nothing.

Miracle 2 – FRANKENSTEIN, living systems arise from dead stuff. Like Dr. Frankenstein, Evolution takes dead parts and assembles them into fully functioning living organisms.

Miracle 3 – UPHILL MOLASSES, the downhill slide (Entropy) of the Universe is reversed again and again by the upward process of Evolution. Like molasses flowing uphill, it counters what we know about all kinds of processes: physical, chemical, atomic, etc. We observe they are ALL running down.

Chapter 4, Falling Off the Improbable Cliff describes four areas that demonstrate both the unscientific and fraudulent nature of Evolution: 1) Missing “Missing Links”, 2) Biological Enigmas, 3) Two Evolution Frauds and 4) Biological Complexity.

Chapter 5 Mitch Cervinka wrote The Irrationality of Unbelief, A Catalog of Contradictions. Our generation has seen an explosion of new non-Christian philosophies that claim to provide a more enlightened view of reality than other beliefs—and especially more so than the Bible. Yet, each of these philosophies self-destructs almost instantly in self-refuting contradictions and inconsistencies. No non-Biblical belief can stand up to scrutiny. The philosophies of our time are eager to criticize the Bible and especially prone to commit the very evils of which they are so critical. Mitch analyzed 15 different philosophies by three different types of inconsistencies: 1) Internal Consistency 2) Basic Human Concepts and 3) Self-Interpretation.  After seeing how these philosophies fail, he’ll offer a Biblical analysis to demonstrate the strength of Christianity.

Chapter 6 “What’s an Atheist to Do?” addresses Atheistic Evolutionists need for three miraculous events that break scientific laws to make Evolution work.  Atheism by its very nature prohibits supernatural intervention. There are four possible explanations Atheists can make to complete these three miracles without an appeal to the supernatural. 1) Admitting Failure. 2) Existence = Origin. 3) We Need More Information to Get an Answer and 4) Singularities.  Another approach to explaining away the miracles is Panspermia (life seeded here from outer space).  Three ways Evolution is promoted in US culture: 1) Evolution = Science. Evolutionists claim that to be a good scientist you must believe in Evolution. That’s presumptuous, illogical and false. 2) Common Origin or Common Design. Evolutionists claim that the structural similarity between different creature’s organs, systems, limbs, etc. show common descent, Creationists claim common design by an omnipotent Creator.  3) Politically Correct Evolution. Political correctness is applied to Evolution: “Evolution is true. Shut up and believe it.” 

Chapter 7 Cultural Impacts of Evolution will deal with three of its cultural impacts. First, Atheism's descent into meaninglessness. As atheists grow in unbelief, they become more and more depraved. The Bible in Romans Chapter 1:18-32 describes this process.  Second, is the US public’s beliefs about origins as determined by polling about Creation vs. Evolution. Humanists teaching their evolutionary worldview of origins have had a monopoly on public education to teach Evolution ONLY for more than 55 years. Today, still about half the people in the US believe in Creation and that hasn’t changed in all those years. These educators can’t seem to grasp that many people won’t believe in Evolution no matter how much you try to convince them because their Evolutionary arguments are just not convincing! Third, is the millions of dollars, large amounts of time, valuable laboratory space, and intellectual talent wasted on research in Evolution.  If these resources were deployed in finding a cure for cancer, diabetes, etc. we’d be much closer to cures. Because Evolution isn’t true, these resources are COMPLETELY wasted!

Please contribute TODAY to this great opportunity to expose the myth of Evolution because: “Science Proves Atheistic Evolution is IMPOSSIBLE!” and "Without 3 Miracles Darwin's Dead!"

story:
"A book for anyone who has ever wanted to stand with those on the margins, yet didn't know how to do it right."

 

Unenforceable Obligations

Designed to equip people for active and responsible allyship with oppressed and marginalized groups, "Unenforceable Obligations" seeks to shift the emphasis from empty ideology and easy intentions, moving instead to real (and costly) practices and lived solidarity.

As more people of privilege begin to understand the nature of oppression and systemic injustice, they are also realizing their need to step up and step out in active solidarity. Through well-intentioned yet misguided zeal, far too many have not only failed to appropriately support these movements but have unwittingly hindered and even harmed them. Still others will embrace performative declaration of ideological support, yet fail to work for systemic change of the very systems they espouse to resist.

This book seeks to shift the focus from intentions and ideology to responsible expressions of embodied allyship. The title, “Unenforceable Obligations”, is drawn from the wisdom of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. who called for people who would be "willingly obedient to unenforceable obligations” of change. It is for the purpose of active obedience to these obligations that this book has been written.

From Both Sides Of Oppression

As a Christian who identifies as bisexual, I have found myself on the receiving end of discrimination, marginalization, and even threats of violence and death. From those experiences, I have come to develop deep convictions about what true allyship is (and is not), lessons sadly learned by the failure of some of my closest friends to stand alongside me in resistance.

However, I am also a white, cisgender man who occupies a great deal of privilege, making the need for me to embrace active allyship even more critical for me. This was made especially clear to me when I became the father of a black son. For over a decade I have dedicated myself to understanding and seeking to practice true allyship for my son and others. Bringing these two perspectives together provides a unique and vulnerable approach to this topic.

Moving from Promises to Practices

The book will primarily challenge the tendency towards ideological advocacy against injustice, especially ways that do not require personal and systemic changes. It will also shift away from the emphasis on "being an ally" (which can be static and positional) to "practicing allyship".

Whether it is in impassioned declarations of “I’m not racist!” to the assertion that “I am LGBTQ+ affirming!”, there is all too often a failure for this to translate into action. This book will provide clear practices (and the underlying values) that put real walk to the walk of doing justice.

Why This Campaign?

Over the last several years, as I have worked hard at public advocacy and allyship on several fronts, I have faced some serious resistance. After 25 years of faithful service, I was ultimately pushed out of a Christian non-profit organization because of my public stance on LGBTQ+ inclusion. Further, my credibility in the Christian publishing world seemed to dry up, with my titles being banned from some of the largest distributors that carried my other titles.

In order to give the time and energy to this project- all while continuing to be active in my work of advocacy- I need to provide financial stability for my family. Having to rebuild our work after 25 years, right at the pandemic hit, has left us struggling. This campaign will provide the much needed resources to write the book and get it into the right hands.

Thank you for standing with me in this way. By doing so, you are helping empower countless others to practice true allyship on behalf of those who need it most.

story:
Are you ready to shape your own future?

 

My name is Michael Perman. I am an innovation futurist and head of C'EST WHAT? - the Mindful Innovation firm.  After decades of deep research around the world, I have distilled my accumulated wisdom into a new book, podcast series, action learning tools and innovation experiences called CRAVING THE FUTURE.  

 

 

My mission in life is to inspire creativity in people, to help everyone create a brighter future for themselves and the organizations where they work - instead of being controlled by outside forces.  Today, I am inviting you to join the the movement of people who wish to take the future into their hands and own it!

You've never seen a business book quite like this one, mindfully crafted as a collaborative and interactive tool that enables people and organizations to see over the horizon...and shape their destiny. 

CRAVING THE FUTURE gives you powerful ideas, practical skills and expert advice from innovation luminaries who are paving the way forward, making the world a better place. 

But it's more than a book - it's a new way of thinking about creating what's next!

Early Reviews:

The future has a strange power over us. It causes deep anxiety and, at the same time, a magical attraction. I've been impressed with how Michael has always been able to balance these two emotions not only for himself but also for the organizations he has worked with, bringing lightness, hope and curiosity. In CRAVING THE FUTURE, Michael shares his learning and insights in a deeply powerful and useful way. Let him be your guide to a beautiful future.

---John Winsor, Harvard Laboratory for Innovation Science 

CRAVING THE FUTURE provides insights, inspiration and specific steps to harness the power of craving to create a more meaningful level of connectivity and insight for individuals and brands”

--- Kent Lewis, President & Founder, Anvil Media

 

 

Funding Goals
The traditional publishing model is simply not reasonable for new authors. I am taking a more future-forward approach to self-publishing and hoping you will join me.  

My funding goal is $25,300. This goal supports graphic design, editing, production, initial business set up, marketing, and the cost of traveling for author events. Funds raised above the goal will be devoted to scoping a potential documentary film called CRAVING THE FUTURE, featuring live interviews with innovation luminaries. 


Popular Perks and Fulfillment Timeline 
Of course you can get CRAVING THE FUTURE book at a discount here - and it's the only place to get the popular C'EST WHAT? hat. Our feature perk is the CRAVING COFFEE TALK, which includes four hard cover books, TWO POUNDS of world class Portland coffee, and a set of conversation starters for you and your friends or co-workers to discuss over coffee while cruising the book together - just $200.  We will fulfill those orders beginning in August so the coffee is fresh!

 


I think you will also love the VIRTUAL CRAVING WORKSHOP, whereby we could devote 90 minutes to discuss the ways CRAVING THE FUTURE can impact your organization or personal lives.... great for teams or even book groups. Even better, a full-blown, multi-sensory innovation workshop for your team to explore future possibilities, priced at a significant discount for Indiegogo patrons - normally $25,000 - available for $9,500. 

 

________________________________________________________________________________________

 

Also available is a special live concert and keynote with PETER HIMMELMAN and BIG MUSE, where your audience learns to write songs relevant to your conference goals, and then we improvise music with our full rock band. The audience comes alive! For details, contact Mike Frick at mike@speaking.com.

 

    

 

______________________________________________________________________________________

 

About Author Michael Perman 
My career has been devoted to helping large brands create what is coming next.  As Senior Director of Insights and Global Marketing for Levi's, I helped guide new brands, products and experiences. As Dean of Innovation at Gap, I helped identify multiple growth ideas. I have also provided innovation strategy guidance to adidas, Nike, Del Monte, Williams Sonoma, Starbucks, Google, Hyatt and other brands

 

                           

 

I  have devoted tremendous personal energy to this project because I have learned that many people feel the future happens TO them, rather than for or with them. CRAVING THE FUTURE can help I believe that  curiosity and empathy together can lead you down a pathway to soulfulness, helping you create a future that has meaning, purpose and prosperity. 

But, humbly speaking, this is my first book so I am grateful for your engagement. I hope this book is a catalyst for  you to create what is next. 

    If you know of other people who would appreciate CRAVING THE FUTURE, please share this link on your social media.  https://igg.me/at/craving-future
