Funds raised above the goal will be devoted to scoping a potential documentary film called CRAVING THE FUTURE, featuring live interviews with innovation luminaries. 
Popular Perks and Fulfillment Timeline Of course you can get CRAVING THE FUTURE book at a discount here - and it's the only place to get the popular C'EST WHAT? hat. Our feature perk is the CRAVING COFFEE TALK, which includes four hard cover books, TWO POUNDS of world class Portland coffee, and a set of conversation starters for you and your friends or co-workers to discuss over coffee while cruising the book together - just $200.  We will fulfill those orders beginning in August so the coffee is fresh!
 

I think you will also love the VIRTUAL CRAVING WORKSHOP, whereby we could devote 90 minutes to discuss the ways CRAVING THE FUTURE can impact your organization or personal lives.... great for teams or even book groups. Even better, a full-blown, multi-sensory innovation workshop for your team to explore future possibilities, priced at a significant discount for Indiegogo patrons - normally $25,000 - available for $9,500. 
 
________________________________________________________________________________________
 
Also available is a special live concert and keynote with PETER HIMMELMAN and BIG MUSE, where your audience learns to write songs relevant to your conference goals, and then we improvise music with our full rock band. The audience comes alive! For details, contact Mike Frick at mike@speaking.com.
 
    

 

______________________________________________________________________________________
 
About Author Michael Perman My career has been devoted to helping large brands create what is coming next.  As Senior Director of Insights and Global Marketing for Levi's, I helped guide new brands, products and experiences. As Dean of Innovation at Gap, I helped identify multiple growth ideas. I have also provided innovation strategy guidance to adidas, Nike, Del Monte, Williams Sonoma, Starbucks, Google, Hyatt and other brands
 
                           
 
I  have devoted tremendous personal energy to this project because I have learned that many people feel the future happens TO them, rather than for or with them. CRAVING THE FUTURE can help I believe that  curiosity and empathy together can lead you down a pathway to soulfulness, helping you create a future that has meaning, purpose and prosperity. 
But, humbly speaking, this is my first book so I am grateful for your engagement. I hope this book is a catalyst for  you to create what is next. 

If you know of other people who would appreciate CRAVING THE FUTURE, please share this link on your social media.  https://igg.me/at/craving-future

story:
¿Qué?

«El mundo está lleno de monstruos. Primero pensamos que son bestias que se esconden bajo la almohada, en nuestros armarios o en los pasillos oscuros. Luego aprendemos que, en efecto, existen, pero son humanos.
Los más afortunados viven creyendo que sólo son humanos».

Santa Cruz de Tenerife, 03:15 am.

Cuatro jóvenes roban una reliquia de origen desconocido. Su siguiente paso es interceptar al doctor Sócrates del Pino Aguilar en el trayecto en barco a Agaete, Gran Canaria. Sólo ellos saben porqué sus vidas dependen de un objeto tan pequeño. Sólo ellos saben quiénes son, quiénes los persiguen y por qué tanto los unos como los otros son dueños de habilidades inhumanas.

Lo que ni siquiera ellos saben es porqué su salvación nos condenará a todos.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Sandro Doreste Bermúdez.

Nacido y residente en Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, es un viajero empedernido y fue marinero en un patrullero de 2013 a 2016. Se ha titulado como corrector profesional por la asociación Cálamo&Cran, curso aprobado por la Universidad Europea de Madrid, y en la actualidad está realizando el curso de corrector de estilo.

Educado con una mano en los libros y la otra en el teclado, sus primeras obras tuvieron lugar a edad temprana con referencias como Michael Crichton, Alberto Vázquez Figueroa, Ken Follet o el dúo Preston y Child. Desde esos inicios obtuvo varios premios escolares por sus relatos.

Su primera obra publicada, La sombra de Eirok, primera parte de una tetralogía, vio la luz en abril de 2014. Sus continuaciones han seguido sus pasos en abril de 2015 y noviembre de 2016, todas englobadas dentro de la fantasía oscura. En julio de 2017 quedó finalista del premio CEPA de novela juvenil por la obra presente, Solo los monstruos crean monstruos.

¿Por qué?

Nadie mejor que el propio autor para indicarnos «por qué leer su libro»:

A finales de 2015 estuve en Dar Es Salaam, Tanzania. Por motivos médicos, tenía que llevar mis enseres fuera de los bolsillos; en este caso, en una bandolera. En cuanto me bajé de un taxi, un coche pasó por mi lado, el copiloto asomó por la ventana, agarró la bandolera y me arrastró por casi doscientos metros de carretera de tierra hasta que el asa, al fin, se rompió.

No me impactó el hecho de que me robaran; peores fechorías puede nombrar cualquiera en cualquier parte del mundo. Lo que quebró mi, por entonces, férrea fe en la bondad humana fue que, mientras yo intentaba zafarme la correa del cuello, me dejaba la piel en la vía y corría el riesgo de caer bajo una rueda, el ladrón fue capaz de sostenerme la mirada y no mostrar ninguna emoción. Ni rabia ni arrepentimiento, ni siquiera odio. No le importaba lo que otra persona sufriera incluso por culpa suya. Esto me llevó a la pregunta: ¿qué calamidades son capaces de provocar que la vida humana deje de ser lo más importante?

Esta cuestión se juntó enseguida con una vecina suya que siempre me ha preocupado: los terribles efectos del fanatismo, sus causas y el aparente aplauso que se les da a muchos. No hace falta que ahonde aquí en un tema del que todos sabemos. Ojalá me refiriera sólo al terrorismo, el que más me enerva la sangre; lo vemos en los extremistas de izquierda y derecha, en los radicales sexistas, en los que hablan de quemar iglesias y en los que desean que sus enemigos ardan por toda la eternidad, entre otros muchos. Esta es una de mis preocupaciones más arraigadas y el principal motivo por el que rechazo todo intento de adoctrinamiento.

De estos conceptos surge este libro. No encontrarás aquí ni robos por el método del tirón ni suicidas con chalecos bombas, al igual que no hallarás ninguna inclinación hacia un modelo político o social. Esta es la gran ventaja única de la fantasía: poder dar un ejemplo sin la necesidad de mojarse las manos. Las ideas que han sido mencionadas no han sido mostradas por un interés particular; son ejemplos, como ya dije, y como ejemplos quedan. Sólo me ha interesado la idea principal, el concepto clave sobre el que circula esta obra: los terribles daños directos y indirectos que provocan el fanatismo y, como consecuencia de este, la deshumanización del más inocente.

Y por aquí un fragmento del texto a modo de muestra:

«Todas las guerras nacen cuando una idea, no importa cuál ni cuáles sean sus intenciones, es más importante que la vida humana. En ese momento, cuando la empatía decae para el provecho de un concepto abstracto, es cuando nos convertimos en monstruos, en ese lobo que el hombre necesita controlar.
     Marta conocía las consecuencias. Sus amigos y ella, sus familias, todos habían sido víctimas de una idea. Por eso estaban allí, para recuperar lo poco que quedaba de ellos.
No había luz esa noche. La ausencia de luna protegía a Marta entre la oscuridad. Habían escogido la fecha adecuada para perpetrar su crimen, para entrar en una casa ajena y llevarse el objeto que les salvaría la vida.
     Contempló la vivienda desde la azotea en la que se escondía. Su objetivo era un piso grande de generosos ventanales. No había lámparas encendidas. La calle respiraba en silencio, sin una sola alma que osara alterar la calma de los durmientes. Era el momento, ¿por qué dudaba? ¿Por qué no quería dar el primer paso de lo que sería su liberación, la promesa de una vida en paz? ¿Qué clase de miedo hacía temblar su mano, instándola a no enviar la señal?
     Sabía bien la respuesta, así que lo ignoró. Sacó su móvil y comenzó a teclear cuando se dio cuenta de que alguien la observaba. No muy lejos de ella, en esa misma azotea, un gato aguardaba en silencio, expectante y relajado. Dos detalles le delataban: el característico destello verde bajo las pupilas y que la observaba con el interés de la conciencia, recordándole que no pasaría nada mientras fueran buenos niños y regresaran a su hogar.
     Marta tensó sus músculos y se preparó para saltar. El gato no se inmutó. El reducido grupo de jóvenes sabía bien a quién se enfrentaba; ver a una de sus criaturas sólo les recordaba por qué debían robar ese objeto, destruirlo y recuperar sus vidas arrebatadas.
     “Adelante”, escribió. Luego, en el mismo mensaje, añadió: “Están aquí”».

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Solo los monstruos crean monstruos que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Sandro Doreste Bermúdez vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
Help Support A New Audiobook

Hi, I'm John Biggs. I wrote a book called Marie Antoinette's Watch, a book about one of the most incredible watches ever made. It took 50 years to build and everyone involved in its manufactured died before they saw it finished. It's sailed the seas of time for over two centuries and it was recently recovered after years hidden away in a thief's private stash. It's an incredible story. 

I've been selling the paperback for a few years now but people have asked me for an audiobook version. With the help of my friend Rick Barr we've decided to release one.  

What are we trying to do? We are going to record and master a professional quality reading of the book and release it in MP3, CD, and, possibly, podcast format.  We will also put the audiobook on Amazon.

You can read the book for free on Kindle Unlimited here and on Wattpad here.

About The Book

 

“Marie Antoinette’s Watch is a wonderful book.” – William Gibson, author of Neuromancer.

 

Across continents and into and out of the hands of royalty, revolutionaries, smugglers, thieves, and the world’s greatest tech engineers, was Marie Antoinette’s watch, the “160,” worth an estimated $40 million in today’s dollars. Perhaps the most sought after personal technology device of the last 200 years, the timepiece, designed by the legendary Abraham-Louis Breguet, is the launching point for a thrilling and fluidly woven set of narratives that are, in part, forbidden love story, historical document, and police procedural. Marie Antoinette’s Watch also deftly lays out the history of horology and the 18th Century engineering feats attained in Paris’s answer to Silicon Valley, the Île de la Cité, that made the watch the most intricate and prized personal device of its time – something that’s come full circle today. In the hands of Techcrunch’s East Coast Editor, John Biggs, Marie Antoinette’s Watch is by turns edifying and lurid, historical and utterly modern. Culminating in a heist in a Tel Aviv antiquities museum in the 1980s, Biggs tells the story of how one object can transform countries, cultures, high technology, and time itself.

What We Need & What You Get

 

We need funding for the recording. Rick needs to be paid and we need a bit of tweaking once we're finished. You'll help with those costs and get the finished product. We'll also press CDs for those who like physical media. 

Risks & Challenges

 

The book is written. Rick is ready to record. We need your help. Your pre-orders will help fund the project and we'll get the finished recording to you by September 2017.

Stretch Goal!

If we hit over $3,000 we'll release the book as a weekly podcast!

 

Thanks! 

Rick and John

story:
Official Bio: Mandy Goodhandy is a transgender entertainer, singer, comedian, nightlife personality and entrepreneur. She co-owns and operates Club120 a Toronto nightclub and 120 Diner a Toronto restaurant with live entertainment. She was Grand Marshal for Toronto’s Pride 2010 parade.  She is an active supporter of AIDS Committee of Toronto and many other local charities and fundraisers, having hosted and produced a semi-annual fundraiser "Where's the Love?", which has raised more than $15,000 to date.  She has been living as a trans woman for over twenty five years.  

In her own words: "I have completed recording a 10 song album in a professional music studio.  The album producer is one of the best in Canada, and in a moment of serendipity, turned out to be someone I went to high school with!  All that is left with the album is the addition of incredible session musicians. I have spent much of the last year writing and editing my memoirs, and have completed 200 pages.  I have now turned the memoirs over to an amazingly talented editor, who I am confident will help me fully realize my vision.    

It was important for me to self-publish my memoirs and release my own music album, in order to have complete control of the launch and distribution and publicity.  My goal  with these 2 projects is to draw more attention to the fact that transgender people exist and are contributors to the arts. 

Funding will enable me to pay the editor and musicians, as well as the printing of at least 500 books and 500 CDs.  

In addition, it will make it possible for successful social media marketing leading to a book launch and music album concert.  Of course, to show my appreciation to those who are kind enough to contribute to my project, I am offering perks.

story:
My Story

My name is Clifford Myers, a local comedian from Hamilton, Ontario. (Most) Comedians have a rare gift to see the world differently. They can scrutinize and satire anything. I believe using laughter to "open peoples eyes" is a good thing if you have the gift. 


I don't have that gift. I have the gift of making people laugh but that's where the buck stops. There's no message. No secret agenda. I do it for the sake of getting in a room full of people and giving us all the chance to laugh together. To get away from whatever problems we dealt with that day. 


For a link to my comedy please visit: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xtRiuMlzKVY


But just because I don't make a difference on stage (this is arguable) doesn't mean I don't want to make a difference. 


I came home after another show and thought to myself, "What else can I apply my writing to? How can use what gifts I got to do something better?"


The next morning I woke reminded of the timelessness of Robert Munsch and Dr. Seuss. 


And I sat at my computer and wrote 'The Cheese Baron'. 


My Other Story

The more important story, the story to why you're here is about a little boy known simply as The Cheese Baron. The Cheese Baron. (need I say it?), loves his cheese. He puts Steve Urkel to shame. 


But he doesn't fit in at school. 


School has classes full of numbers and other classes full of words. But the Cheese Baron doesn't see the point to words and numbers, all he knows is that he loves cheese. "Too bad we can't take a class on cheese..." 


I want you to join the Cheese Baron as he wanders away from a world of numbers and words and into a magical cheese fort full of kids just like him.


But maybe even paradise has its flaws. 


The Impact

You personally have already experienced the impact. Children emerge themselves in stories. Stories with lessons and principles that help them develop through the early years of childhood. The best part is children remember these stories.


This is why I want them to remember 'The Cheese Baron'. 


Because it's about not fitting in. Something about you makes you different. You have a different culture, a different religion, everyone likes sports and you like art, every likes art and you like sports (in what world?), you look different, you think different, you were raised different, and all a kid wants at the end of the day is to fit in.


But fitting in isn't compromising who you are it's fitting in who you are to where you are.


What I Need & What You Get

I have chosen to self-publish with Author House (www.authorhouse.com). The reason why I chose to self-publish is the same reason why independent filmmakers make independent films or why musicians produce their own albums, creative control yes, but because we have a burning desire to complete our project. 


I've been in contact with Dianne Hiatt and she has convenietly broken down why Author House is your best bet for self-publishing. 


1) Experience - AuthorHouse has published 120,000 titles in the past 14 years, which is far more than any other self-publishing company in the world. The experience and stability of your publisher could be the difference between your book being a hit or a flop. Many of our titles have gone on to become best-sellers and hit movies such as "Legally Blonde" (starring Reese Witherspoon) and "Proof of Life" (starring Meg Ryan and Russell Crowe).

 

2) Distribution - AuthorHouse makes your book available for sale to over 25,000 book stores and online sites. No other publisher in the world has a larger network of retailers. As an author, you want to make sure that if a book store or buyer wishes to purchase your book, they are able to do that from the most places possible.

 

3) Marketing - AuthorHouse has more marketing and promotional services available to you than any other firm in order to reach your readers. As you know, the more people that hear about your book, the better the chance they'll purchase copies.

 

4) Royalties - AuthorHouse pays the highest royalties in the publishing industry. We allow you to set your own retail price if you choose a flex pricing plan, so you can make as much or as little as you want. You control your own royalty paycheck.

 

5) Control - AuthorHouse allows you to control every part of the process. From the cover design to the design and layout of the interior pages, all the work is done to your vision and specifications.

 

6) Quality & Design - Every AuthorHouse title is custom-designed from the ground up to your specifications. There are no templates used like many other publishers, so your book is not a "cookie cutter" book. As an author, it's important that your book look different than others you're competing with to set your book apart.

 

7) Time until available - AuthorHouse doesn't take 6+ months to bring your book to market like many other publishers. We are well-staffed, so the process only takes 3-4 months with the option of having your first paperback in your hands in as little as 30 days without any sacrifice in quality with our Rapid Release service. 


And yes, this all costs money. Here's the breakdown: 

Cost Breakdown 

Editing â€“ $295 
Illustration â€“ $1495
Printing (Test 25) â€“ $175
Second test 25 ) â€“ $175
3000 Main print run â€“ $3,874 

For a total of $6014. If I don't hit the goal completely I will be taking the cost away from the Main Print Runs and use the proceeds of the book itself to pay for print runs in the future. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Hashtag #TheCheeseBaron on Twitter and help get the word out. I'm @Cliffalus. I use the Twitter world to joke about everything and anything but have made some great relationships on there as well. Social media of course can help.


This Monday I will be going to a local early youth center and reading my story to the toddlers. I will of course record it and upload it to Vimeo so you can hear the story in its entirety. 


Other ways, I'm not the only person in the world trying to get a book published. There is a sea of unheard voices out there who bring a lot of talent to the table. 


Some of the best way to support authors trying to self-publish is through websites like Colin-Harper's Athonomy (http://www.authonomy.com/) or Absolute Write (http://absolutewrite.com/forums/index.php?referrerid=88)
story_txt:
My Story
My name is Clifford Myers, a local comedian from Hamilton, Ontario. (Most) Comedians have a rare gift to see the world differently. They can scrutinize and satire anything. I believe using laughter to "open peoples eyes" is a good thing if you have the gift. 

I don't have that gift. I have the gift of making people laugh but that's where the buck stops. There's no message. No secret agenda. I do it for the sake of getting in a room full of people and giving us all the chance to laugh together. To get away from whatever problems we dealt with that day. 

For a link to my comedy please visit: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xtRiuMlzKVY

But just because I don't make a difference on stage (this is arguable) doesn't mean I don't want to make a difference. 

I came home after another show and thought to myself, "What else can I apply my writing to? How can use what gifts I got to do something better?"

story:
A los dos meses de nacida GABRIELA sufre un paro Cardio Respiratorio por mas de 30 mins. Como resultado de esto sufre un daño Cerebral Severo diagnosticado despues de realizar un encefalograma. 

4 meses despues de haber salido de la clinica le diagnostican Sindrome de West: Retraso psicomotor y pérdida de habilidades adquiridas y anormalidades neurológicas.

Actualmente tiene un atraso en el desarrollo psicomotor en cual no le ha permitido valerse por si misma en el gateo y su caminar. 

GABRIELA HA  APLICADO PARA UN TRATAMIENTO CON CELULAS MADRE DE CORDON UMBILICAL CON UNA IMPORTANTE COMPAÑÍA EN CHINA Y SER TRATADA EN EL BETHUNE INTERNATIONAL PEACE HOSPITAL EN LA CIUDAD DE SHIJIAZHUANG, CHINA EL CUAL LE PODRA DAR LA OPORTUNIDAD A GABRIELA DE PODER GATEAR Y CAMINAR Y TENER UN MEJORAMIENTO EN SU DESARROLLO.

El tratamiento se realizara en china porque actualmente es el pais mas avanzado del mundo en investigacion de celulas madre de cordon umbilical y garantizan que el tratamiento se realiza con este tipo de celulas madre

 

COSTO TOTAL TRATAMIENTO

TRATAMIENTO 8 INYECCIONES: US$ 33.800

TIQUETES AEREOS: US$ 7.700

ALIMENTACION Y ESTADIA: US$ 2.300

TOTAL TRATAMIENTO: US$ 43.800

 

Tambien puedes  ayudar a que Gabi pueda tener su tratamiento ayudandonos a compartir la informacion con todos tus contactos:

Unete al grupo en facebook: 

https://www.facebook.com/groups/364613926906978/

Sigue a Gabi en Twitter:

@Gabaristizabal

story:
Hi!

 

First and foremost, thanks to anyone who took the time to view my project.  I was motivated by a few close friends who enlightened me on crowd funding to create this campaign.  The day I finished the rough draft for this novel was one of the best days of my life.  Since then, I’ve spent more time editing and rewriting my story than it took for me to write the initial copy.  I love this book.  The novel is everything I’ve ever wanted in a story, and now I’m looking for a way to share it with others. 

 

When I started writing, I had no motive.  Within a short four months I finished the first copy and asked myself what to do next.  For four months, I was excited to go home and write.  I was excited to go back into the world I had created, and it’s set in the one we live in today. 

 

The two most frequent things I’ve heard from my friends who’ve read Noble are…

 

“I feel like this could be real.”

 

“**** that ending blew my mind and I did not see that coming!”

 

                I laughed pretty hard the first time I heard that.

               I am a pilot in the early days of my career, and I don’t make very much money…  I received a quote from a copy editor to work on my novel and it was 1400 dollars.  Not really pocket change for a man who wrestles with student loans.  But beside that, the 450 for the book design and page layout, and the money I’ve already spent on printing copies and shipping, I want to use any extra funding I receive to print as many copies as I can for a first printing.  I’ve written proposals and query letters for publishing houses and book agents, but I simply need the funding to accomplish it all.  I’m taking this chance in my life to do something extraordinary and I’m not the type to quit.  I want to succeed like any other writer who puts himself and his work out into the world.  So below I’ve laid out the proposed back cover for my book, some information I wrote about myself that I used in one of my proposals, and the prologue. Enjoy! And thanks for looking!

Enter the world of the Noble, a secret society representing human potential while shadowing the world throughout history—only to emerge when the world is on the verge of collapse.

            In the near future after the Great World Depression, Will is a young teenager who expected that his biggest challenge would simply be surviving adolescense. A family and a past, both unknown to him, thrust him into the world of the Noble, an ancient race that represents the potential in all of us. Although afraid of his own emerging gifts, Will is delivered into their world when the Noble are on the brink of war with an enemy that has pursued them since before the Dark Ages.

            But when the head of the worlds leading technology corporation shows up at his doorstep, his life is changed forever.  With no time to waste and compelled to live in both worlds, the one he was raised for and his new life he is destined for, Will must find the strength to be able to protect his family and those dear to him. Delve into a journey of intrigue and a story a thousand years in the making as Will battles the powers that be, and searches for the lost knowledge of the Templars and his Noble heritage.

About the Author: 

            Matthew Steele Navarro is a writer with an aerospace degree in Commercial Aviation from the University of North Dakota, Grand Forks.  When he is not practicing his great love of writing, he works as a commercial pilot and Instructor.  Born in St.Paul, Minnesota, Matthew puts high regards on his family.  Growing up with separated parents, his sister, who has been missing for five years, was a very important piece of his life.  A strong connection between the protagonist and his adopted family gives insights and connections to the writer’s life.  Notably also a thespian, a multi instrument musician and awarded several various varsity letters in sports and was once a top five swimmer in Minnesota.  Noble is an accomplishment of a lifetime for the writer who loved the story so much, through diligence taught himself to be a novelist.  Months of long nights and hard work created a passion for Noble and is expressed in an enthusiasm that will never cease until he can share it with the world.

 

Funding:

            Noble is a completed 350 page (currently 9x11 standard) novel that is the first in a five book series.  The Author has completed the outline for the entire series and has created this crowd funding campaign to raise the money for professional copy editting, cover design, and publishing of the first installment: Noble.  

            A novel with a strong moral compass, real world issues, and rich with  historical connections.  Featuring a cast of compelling and relatable characters, the coming of age story of Will the protagonist leaves a profound effect on the reader.

 

Prologue: 

            At the corner of a narrow cobblestone alleyway, a young girl tended a rare patch of flowers that had taken root between a pair of run-down residential buildings. The cotton hem of her plain dress brushed the stones of the street as she swayed back and forth with a pail of water, gently pouring among the frail petals of blues and yellows. Her dress hung loosely off one shoulder, her tan skin flushed from the heat. The world depression had affected Western Europe early on, and ever since, flowers were scarce in Paris. It had been weeks since the last rain.

            The girl hummed, her blond hair dangled over her shoulders as the occasional car passed by dangerously close. The girl lived for flowers and often dreamt that one day she would have a garden full of them. Her ears twitched as she heard the soft treading of boots; the footsteps were unsteady and out of rhythm. As she leaned over the flowers, she ignored the man who appeared from a narrow pathway. He stopped before he reached her, calling out to her roughly. His French accent was thick, and his breath reeked of cheap wine.

“Bonjour, what is such a young beauty doing alone?”

            The man spoke slowly. His body swayed as his eyes searched the alleyway.

“Are your parents not around?”

             The girl glanced at the man without interest, her hair falling forward as she turned back to the flowers. The man’s face went rigid.

“You know, it is rude, little girl, when you do not answer a man.”

             His arm reached out to grab the girl by the shoulder, a hand seizing his wrist hard just before he touched her.

“Excusez-moi. What makes you think this girl is alone?”

             The man winced as nails dug sharply into his wrist.

“May I ask what business you have with her, monsieur?”

             The Frenchman recoiled, drawing his wrist back in pain. He was surprised to find another young girl standing next to him. She looked not a day over fifteen. The man balked, confused by the strength with which she had grabbed his arm. She stood defiantly between him and the little girl still humming softly near the flowers. The older girl’s hair was dark and wild, her green eyes narrowed as she looked at the man with disgust. He hesitated under her stare, but recovered a moment later. His face smoothed over, trying to hide his embarrassment that a teenage girl had startled him. His brow furrowed in anger, and he spread his feet as he steadied himself.

“Who do you think you are, fille? I should put you and the brat behind you over my knee and we’ll see. …”

“Ce qui semble être le problême?”

              The air stirred. The strength of the voice hit the Frenchman like a wave, taking him by surprise. He stumbled as he whipped around and fell hard on his backside. Turning over on the cobblestones, he saw a young man stepping out of a humming car, another teenager stepping out behind him. The Frenchman licked his cracked lips, eyes wide as he took stock of the two and the strange, vibrating car that appeared silently. They stood tall in front of him, their appearances strong. The first young man was dressed in a plain black suit without a tie, a gleaming chain bearing a strange cross hanging around his neck. His face was expressionless. The teenage boy came up quickly behind him, his eyes threatening, his voice filled with the same depth and power.

“We’ve had a long journey and we have little patience. Leave now. It will be one of your better decisions.”

              The teenage boy’s piercing dark blue eyes silenced the man as he looked down on him. The Frenchman fumbled backward on his elbows, struggling to come to his feet before running down the alleyway in the direction he had come. When the little girl finally looked up, her face glowed with excitement.

“Adalric! Niles! You’ve been gone so long, tu m’as manquee!”

              She ran forward, almost tripping over her feet as she came to embrace the young man around his legs, the chain around his neck hanging in the air as he leaned forward. Adalric remained expressionless, his tone disapproving.

“Julia, what have we told you about leaving the house? It is dangerous to be alone in the city the way it is now.”

              Her feet brushed the stone, her face crestfallen.

“Je suis dêsole. But the flowers, the flowers were thirsty! They told me so, and they are so pretty. I couldn’t let them die!”

              Adalric gave her a small smile, then turned to the girl with the wild hair. He nodded thoughtfully toward her.

“Mabelle, it is wonderful to see you again. May I introduce my younger brother. This is Niles.”

              Niles smiled genially as he extended his hand.

“It is a pleasure to meet you, mademoiselle.”

              Mabelle pursed her lips, folding her arms and showing no inclination to take his hand. Niles pulled away, his cheeks growing red under her stare. She looked at them both disapprovingly.

“Do you know what could have happened if I hadn’t been here? Who knows what that man could have done to her! Where would you have been?”

              Adalric bowed his head.

“You are right. I will have a talk with Ethel, the matron, when we return home. Thank you for being here.”

              He turned to the little girl, Julia, taking one of her hands.

“This is Mabelle, Julia. She will be staying with us for a while.”

              The girl looked down shyly, her hands holding on to Adalric’s jacket pocket. Mabelle’s stern expression relaxed and she walked forward to kneel in front of her.

“Bonjour, Julia, my name is Mabelle. I would like it very much if we might become friends. I can even help you water the flowers whenever you want.”

              Mabelle extended her hands. Julia’s face spread in a wide smile as she offered her own, nodding enthusiastically. Niles fidgeted beside them, scratching the back of his head and smiling apologetically.

“Thank you, Mabelle. It is a pleasure to meet you.”

              Mabelle stood up straight, flashing Niles another disapproving look, then turned.

“So how long will you be staying this time, Adalric Vanlare?”

              Adalric looked up pensively into the dense clouds of pollution that hung thick over the city.

“Niles will be staying to look after things here for a while. Regretfully, I will only be staying for the night. The world has done too much damage to itself. There’s much to be done. We need to help while there is still a chance for us to do so.”

              Adalric helped Julia into the car. Mabelle followed in silence. Gently closing the door, he turned toward Niles.

“We Noble will no longer be able to remain isolated. It is time again we enter the world.”

Her dress hung loosely off one shoulder, her tan skin flushed from the heat. The world depression had affected Western Europe early on, and ever since, flowers were scarce in Paris. It had been weeks since the last rain.
            The girl hummed, her blond hair dangled over her shoulders as the occasional car passed by dangerously close. The girl lived for flowers and often dreamt that one day she would have a garden full of them. Her ears twitched as she heard the soft treading of boots; the footsteps were unsteady and out of rhythm. As she leaned over the flowers, she ignored the man who appeared from a narrow pathway. He stopped before he reached her, calling out to her roughly. His French accent was thick, and his breath reeked of cheap wine.
“Bonjour, what is such a young beauty doing alone?”
            The man spoke slowly. His body swayed as his eyes searched the alleyway.
“Are your parents not around?”
             The girl glanced at the man without interest, her hair falling forward as she turned back to the flowers. The man’s face went rigid.
“You know, it is rude, little girl, when you do not answer a man.”
             His arm reached out to grab the girl by the shoulder, a hand seizing his wrist hard just before he touched her.
“Excusez-moi. What makes you think this girl is alone?”
             The man winced as nails dug sharply into his wrist.
“May I ask what business you have with her, monsieur?”
             The Frenchman recoiled, drawing his wrist back in pain. He was surprised to find another young girl standing next to him. She looked not a day over fifteen. The man balked, confused by the strength with which she had grabbed his arm. She stood defiantly between him and the little girl still humming softly near the flowers. The older girl’s hair was dark and wild, her green eyes narrowed as she looked at the man with disgust. He hesitated under her stare, but recovered a moment later. His face smoothed over, trying to hide his embarrassment that a teenage girl had startled him. His brow furrowed in anger, and he spread his feet as he steadied himself.
“Who do you think you are, fille? I should put you and the brat behind you over my knee and we’ll see. …”
“Ce qui semble être le problême?”
              The air stirred. The strength of the voice hit the Frenchman like a wave, taking him by surprise. He stumbled as he whipped around and fell hard on his backside. Turning over on the cobblestones, he saw a young man stepping out of a humming car, another teenager stepping out behind him. The Frenchman licked his cracked lips, eyes wide as he took stock of the two and the strange, vibrating car that appeared silently. They stood tall in front of him, their appearances strong. The first young man was dressed in a plain black suit without a tie, a gleaming chain bearing a strange cross hanging around his neck. His face was expressionless. The teenage boy came up quickly behind him, his eyes threatening, his voice filled with the same depth and power.
“We’ve had a long journey and we have little patience. Leave now. It will be one of your better decisions.”
              The teenage boy’s piercing dark blue eyes silenced the man as he looked down on him. The Frenchman fumbled backward on his elbows, struggling to come to his feet before running down the alleyway in the direction he had come. When the little girl finally looked up, her face glowed with excitement.
“Adalric! Niles! You’ve been gone so long, tu m’as manquee!”
              She ran forward, almost tripping over her feet as she came to embrace the young man around his legs, the chain around his neck hanging in the air as he leaned forward. Adalric remained expressionless, his tone disapproving.
“Julia, what have we told you about leaving the house? It is dangerous to be alone in the city the way it is now.”
              Her feet brushed the stone, her face crestfallen.
“Je suis dêsole. But the flowers, the flowers were thirsty! They told me so, and they are so pretty. I couldn’t let them die!”
              Adalric gave her a small smile, then turned to the girl with the wild hair. He nodded thoughtfully toward her.
“Mabelle, it is wonderful to see you again. May I introduce my younger brother. This is Niles.”
              Niles smiled genially as he extended his hand.
“It is a pleasure to meet you, mademoiselle.”
              Mabelle pursed her lips, folding her arms and showing no inclination to take his hand. Niles pulled away, his cheeks growing red under her stare. She looked at them both disapprovingly.
“Do you know what could have happened if I hadn’t been here? Who knows what that man could have done to her! Where would you have been?”
              Adalric bowed his head.
“You are right. I will have a talk with Ethel, the matron, when we return home. Thank you for being here.”
              He turned to the little girl, Julia, taking one of her hands.
“This is Mabelle, Julia. She will be staying with us for a while.”
              The girl looked down shyly, her hands holding on to Adalric’s jacket pocket. Mabelle’s stern expression relaxed and she walked forward to kneel in front of her.
“Bonjour, Julia, my name is Mabelle. I would like it very much if we might become friends. I can even help you water the flowers whenever you want.”
              Mabelle extended her hands. Julia’s face spread in a wide smile as she offered her own, nodding enthusiastically. Niles fidgeted beside them, scratching the back of his head and smiling apologetically.
“Thank you, Mabelle. It is a pleasure to meet you.”
              Mabelle stood up straight, flashing Niles another disapproving look, then turned.
“So how long will you be staying this time, Adalric Vanlare?”
              Adalric looked up pensively into the dense clouds of pollution that hung thick over the city.
“Niles will be staying to look after things here for a while. Regretfully, I will only be staying for the night. The world has done too much damage to itself. There’s much to be done. We need to help while there is still a chance for us to do so.”
              Adalric helped Julia into the car. Mabelle followed in silence. Gently closing the door, he turned toward Niles.
“We Noble will no longer be able to remain isolated. It is time again we enter the world.”

story:
The Daily Dose of Emuna

BS’D

Everything is from Hashem!  This statement is nothing new to the readers who have been with the Daily Dose of Emuna for quite some time.  Yet as many of you write to me on a regular basis it is a difficult challenge to push the emuna button when hardships arise. The question that is repeatedly asked, “How do I get the emuna in my mind to affect my heart and impact my feelings so I will pulsate with emuna vibes through and through?”  I want to feel it, but I don’t!

It is the struggle of our current generation and a crucial necessary tool we need to learn every moment possible in order to lead happy, more fulfilling and emotionally balanced lives.  Chazal teach us that just as a body needs food, the soul needs emuna.  Without emuna the soul suffers and the result; negative emotions begin to flood our entire being.

I began writing the emuna articles in order to teach myself that Hashem
loves me more than ever and is walking side by side with me everywhere I
go.  I never thought anyone else needed to learn the same message like I did. Two and a half years have passed since then and thousands of you have inspired me to keep writing and teaching the crucial message of why we need Hashem in our lives.

B’chasdei Shamayim, I know the impact is widespread and it has changed coutless
lives.  Rabbeim have written to me, though I will not mention names to not lower their standing, that they themselves have tremendously benefitted from the emuna lessons
since they are real and practical and are taught with such passion.  What a humbling experience.

This is why the forthcoming book “180 Degrees in 180 Days’ is so essential to the Klal.  Everyone needs this and I need your help to make this book. This is going to cost me to produce, design and edit, so whatever you can contribute please do.  As little as $5 – as much as a thousand dollars and you’ll get great rewards both material
and spiritual because every dollar you give, it’s a mitzvah going toward Torah learning.

In fact in order to make this book a reality it only takes 120 people to contribute $102 (the gematria of the word EMUNA).  It can be spread out over 6 months; just under $18 a month. 

 

Readers like YOU!

 

I know Hashem will see this project through, but I also know that He wants me to spread the wealth and reward with the people who benefit from the emuna lessons and know how it has affected their lives first hand.

Please take the time to contribute.  Every dollar is a note of appreciation that you are sending The Daily Dose of Emuna that you care and want it to continue.  I can’t do this alone. Please join me.

All contributions can be made either via paypal email oritriter@gmail.com, check or
wire bank transfer. For contributions of $180 or more we can send you a tax
deductible receipt, which is of greater value before the 31st of December 2013.

All donations can be used from Ma’aser as they are 100% being used for Torah learning.  Thank you for your generous support. Please pass the word on!

 

The New Book

Mosaica Publishing is working with us to publish our first book to be called “180 degrees in 180 days,” which will compile of 180 of the most popular Daily Dose of Emuna articles together with new Torah insights, emuna stories, divrei chizuk, list of yahrtzeit dates, jokes and much more.

 

Rabbinical Haskamot (approvals)

The manscript for this work has already been read and acclaimed by Rabbi Abraham J. Twerski, MD shlit'a, Rabbi Pinchas Winston shlit'a and Rabbi Dovid Weinberger as a valuable and vital work. Here's just a sample of what they have said:

"They are an enhancement of our daily declaration of Shema Yisrael, and should be read daily."  Rabbi Abraham J. Twerski, MD

"After reading about Mrs. Riter’s personal journey, and seeing some of her work, it is clear that she is one of those special people of Jewish history."  Rabbi Pinchas Winston

"Through this publication, there is no doubt that you will reach a much broader readership and hundreds, if not thousands will be inspired by your meaningful and practical lessons for daily life." Rabbi Dovid Weinberger 

 

To read these haskamot in depth, please visit visit  www.dailydoseofemuna.com.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help financially, I would really appreciate if you could help me spread the word. Please share this campaign with your friends, family, neighbors, etc. We have 60 days to reach our goal, and with the awesome speed of technology and the ability to share, I am sure we can reach out, find those wh can reach in, and together COMPLETE this PROJECT in no time at all! 

I sincerely want to thank you in advance for your generous support that means so much to all of us. Be part of the zechut in thousands of people's Torah!

story:
This project initially began life on Zouch magazine as a series of reviews of the American singer-songwriter Elliott Murphy's recorded work. Written mainly by Charles Pitter, Elliott Murphy has kindly contributed to the project.

Charles Pitter reworked the articles and added previously unpublished writing, interviews and material specifically for the book to ensure Murphy's full and varied career to date was captured.  As such, the book is comprised of the following:

Full reviews and background for every Murphy album from 1973-2013, with commentary from band members and songwriters; 

Exclusive, previously unpublished interviews with Murphy, band members, music industry insiders, fans and associates;

Discography including rarities and bootlegs;

Previously unpublished listing of all Murphy’s bands through the years;

Rare photographs.

Funds are being raised in order to have the book professionally designed and printed as a quality LIMITED EDITION publication (numbered and signed by Elliott Murphy and Charles Pitter) that fans, and general readers, will enjoy.

Hi, I am Ed Hubbard, and my project will allow us to create a Common Book of Wicca and Witchcraft. I want this book to be shareable and available to all as an eBook, as well as a print copy. This Common Book will be considered open source, public domain, and can be widely shared. I feel that this is an important time in our history and we are at a crossroads.

In the legal world of Copyrights, Trademarks, and Digital Rights, we are facing a more restrictive future of written, audio and video based materials, and how they may be used. This bears directly on our freedom of religion, freedom of speech, and freedom of use. In order to avoid these restrictions, I see the Common Book of Wicca and Witchcraft as able to bypass most of the problems with copyright issues. This will give my fellow Wiccans, Witches, and Seekers the freedom to teach, with quality materials, the basics of our faith. My hope is that you will want this for yourself and your family as well.

Why Wicca? For me, once I accepted Wicca, it changed and saved my life. From my soul, my inner self, I felt healing and understanding that nothing else was ever able to answer, and I discovered how beautiful the natural world is. Being Wiccan as well as a Witch was life affirming and comforting in so many places in my life. It gave me the freedom to believe as I wanted, and since then, I have dedicated myself to teaching. The Common Book of Wicca and Witchcraft is the next step in what I believe can help bring comfort and understanding to so many others.


The Problem:

The current teaching manuals of any coven, circle or temple, unless they are using their own personal Book of Shadows, have to be purchased from a publisher, who originally printed them for the authors. This is a great system that has served us well for the past 70 years, and it was the best available way for us while we were unable to connect with each other. But, it has also left many of our faith practices and rituals to fall under copyright, and they can be shared only under certain narrow conditions.  I suspect the constant drum of corporations to protect intellectual property could make it much more difficult to use any copyrighted material beyond the scope of reading and practice.
For instance, in 2012, one of our most beloved chants was used freely and incorporated many derivative works. This open sharing angered the original author of the chant, and she actively sought to narrow the usage, and eliminate the various other forms of the chant. She was able to do so because the chant was copyrighted in the seventies, and most people were just not aware of that. This is just one example of the unexpected consequences of copyrights and their impact on the community
This is why we want to have a book of common knowledge that allows covens, circles, witan shrines, temples, and groves to teach at least the basics to people who want to learn.  This has always been our goal; to provide an education to anyone, anytime, anywhere.

All materials will be derived from common knowledge, research, and properly annotated and referenced sources. We will have a review panel to ensure the material does not violate copyrights of any authors or publishers.  If we are required to have permission to print, we will either acquire permission or we will remove the passages that violate copyright. This is very important in creating shareable material.

What will be the Content of Book?
  The quality of the book will be determined by the authors, seeking to express common knowledge in a way that does not violate any copyrights currently held by any author or publisher currently. We have a great team to start, and we will be accepting the best of our community to help with this project  We anticipate that this will be well-structured and very inclusive. The first table of contents, is History, Holidays, Traditions & Beliefs, Rituals, Spells, Prayers & Chants and Skills.  We will also include a glossary/dictionary and a bibliography.

The materials in the book will be of quality, vetted by sharp-eyed and knowledgeable elders, and will be based on the submissions we receive. We have a basic structure today with enough material to start, and we will only add to the depth and beauty of the Craft. .

First Edition Hardcover Edition:
We are going to have the Hardcover books made by a small press here in Chicago, Il. We will make as only as many as we have perks and prepaid orders, plus a small amount for authors and gifts.  This will give you a beautiful book, that will be a certified first edition, with all the errors, mistakes, and before inevitable changes will occur. This is the nature of printing, and we will produce to our market and limit the final number created to actual demand.  Everyone who receives the first edition will also receive the eBook as well.

Paperback Edition:
This will be the largest possible run we can make, in the format which can get us the most number of quality copies. The current plan is to create a trade paperback edition at 1000 copies, with the $20,000 goal.  If we do not meet that goal, we will use small press printers to make as many copies as we need to meet the demand. Everyone who receives a paperpack edition will also receive the eBook as well.

eBook Edition:
As we move into the Digital age, this edition will not be constrained to the same size as print, and will be able to have a larger amount of material. It will have a identical copy of the printed book, and a extended part with additional material created. This is a more fluid format in setting up, and when created will be the easiest shared.  Every perk, excluding handmade bookmark, will include the eBook.

eBook Update, Creating Links in eBooks:
November 4th, update

In discussing the eBook, we are able to create links, and this will allow us to connect to thousands of other pages. We are building this to be read on any platform including tablets, Kindles, and any way one wants to read their digital materials. In this, we will be able to give authors and writers ways to build in hyperlinks in their writings,  as well as automatically for certain wordsets, and create a referral service that can connect to other online libraries such as Sacred Text,  Library of Congress, and virtually the whole of humanities public libraries to tap into. We can incorporate video and audio into the eBook.

In this sense the eBook will be a gateway into the world of Witchcraft and Wicca, on a spiritual and virtual levels, driving everyone to seek out physical experiences, building community.  The quality of the links will depend on finding sites that will help them become part of the community.  

The Process:

We are seeking to create both a digital eBook and also a bound book that covers the basic teachings of Wicca and Witchcraft. We are planning to take one year to write and acquire the needed materials.

We do have The Super Omnibus of Spells and Incantations for Every Occasion to draw from, created and provided by Don Lewis and Maryann Kay. We will incorporate The Five Mystic Secrets with commentary as well. This will be the start of source material created for the purpose of sharing.

We will hire editors, authors, and researchers as we can to create lessons for the book. We will be creating a physical version that can be shared in whole or in part. We will also have an eBook edition which will be a digital version of the same book, with additional materials that might not be available for the first bound edition.

Everything will be peer reviewed, and searched for plagiarism and other copyright violations. When all materials have been formatted and collated, the completed book will be sent out for printing. The bound version and the eBook will be released simultaneously.  


Common Book of Wicca and Witchcraft Timeline:

October 1th, 2013: Call for Articles Begins
November 4th, 2013: First List of Content
November 11th, 2013: Campaign Closes: Radio Show on Pagans Tonight
May 15th, 2014: Deadline for all submissions for print version
June 15th, 2014: Deadline for all copy for print version.
July 15th, 2014: Deadline for all copy  enhanced eBook
August 1st, 2014: Sent to Printers
September 1st, 2014: Final version of enhanced ebook
October 1st, 2014: All Copies Delivered. eBooks released.

Levels of Funding:

If we do not make $3,000 we will refund all money, and end the project.

If we make at least $3,000, we will produce the eBook with materials we have at that time. We will hire an editor to help with a volunteer writing group. The paperback will be a comb bound, hand printed book. A hardcover edition will be hand produced.

When we make $5,000 we will print our paperback professionally.

When we raise more than $5,000, we will use most of the money to hire editors, writers, authors, and researchers to produce the best quality material for this project.

With $20,000 we can complete the bound first edition within one year, with basic teachings in a Common Book of Wicca and Witchcraft.

If we reach beyond $20,000 we can add a broader coalition of writers to allow them to do more in-depth lessons. We can hopefully hire university level and professional writers. We can also include more novice writers as well. At every level we will build it, and it will take a community to do so.

Our Team:

Staff Updated as of 10/14/2013
Chair, Ed Hubbard, Project Manager
CEO, Michael Ferrell
Curators: Phaedra Bonewits, Abby Willowroot
Executive Editors: Brendan Tripp (Publish Layout), Maryann Kay, Traci Logan Wood
Cover editor: Ed Ireland,
Researchers: Alan Salmi (Chief)
Principal Writers: Rev. Don Lewis (Head Writer)
Social Media Team:  CoriLynne Nichols

Contributing authors: Oberon Zell, Phil Farber, Raven Digitalis, Rick Johnson, William Halstead, Faemore Lorei, Rev. Hectuba Hestia,

We will be updating our staff listing as we bring people on, with assurances of truly doing the work.  This is essential for us to create our timeline.

Projects Completed:

Our team has completed a number of earlier projects that are for public distribution:

Five Mystic Secrets in eight languages: http://www.witchschool.com/page/the-five-mystic-secrets
What is Wicca? in eighteen languages: http://www.witchschool.com/page/what-is-wicca-language
Join Me for a Wiccan Ritual in three languages, this is a comic book: http://www.witchschool.com/page/join-me-for-a-wiccan-ritual
Harry Potter vs. Real Witches: http://www.witchschool.ws/library/pdf/Harry_P_VS_Real_Witches.pdf

Team History:
Our Team History: We have been public Pagan educators since 1990, beginning with the New Castle Society and the Mirror Coven of Chicago. We have been instrumental in creating wonderful opportunities for people to learn and understand Paganism, with a number of us practicing among other traditions. We have sponsored magazines including The Terminal Journal and Round Table Magazine. We evolved into radio including Psychic Chicago Radio, Telepathic Radio, and currently Pagans Tonight, a seven day a week radio network that just celebrated its four year anniversary with over 1500 shows.

We hosted three Pagan Leadership Conferences of Chicago in 1994. These projects, along with Pagan Expo, launched an active community that lasted through most of the decade, with some of Chicago’s best leaders stepping up to help with expansion and growth. Today Chicago is a community that is learning to live with a new generation that seeks knowledge via the internet.

This project began with The Daily Spell in 1998 and it subsequently became the online website Witch School on September 4th, 2011. This has been a powerful global education resource that offers a free lessons and dozens of courses. Every day, Witch School is doing it’s very best to provide a lifetime of education to anyone, anytime, anywhere. We have thousands of potential teachers globally, ready to teach, if we could supply them with the necessary materials. In the past, Witchcraft, Wicca and Pagan educational programs have often been bootstrap projects. So once again, we ask our fellow Wiccans to help us compile and distribute new and insightful information, so that we can share our experiences, as we learn our history and seek our own path.  Witch School reaches 246,000 members in 207 countries, and offers courses such as Living the Wiccan Life and over 100 more.

We created Magick TV which has video lessons, interviews with Pagan community leaders, and more, including Don Lewis Daily Vlog. We have produced over 2,000 videos since the station opened on November 11th, 2005. We started Pagans Tonight radio on September 15th, 2009. We published The Correllian Times magazine beginning in 2006, with Issue 74 just released.

We have done some large scale projects, and this will be one of our greatest challenges. If we can accomplish this, one year from now we will have reached our goal to continue our focus of a lifelong, open education. We will be able to offer a set of core materials for all teachers to share with everyone; to use with no fear of reprimand or copyright infringement threats.

We will have a review panel to ensure the material does not violate copyrights of any authors or publishers.  If we are required to have permission to print, we will either acquire permission or we will remove the passages that violate copyright. This is very important in creating shareable material.
What will be the Content of Book?  The quality of the book will be determined by the authors, seeking to express common knowledge in a way that does not violate any copyrights currently held by any author or publisher currently. We have a great team to start, and we will be accepting the best of our community to help with this project  We anticipate that this will be well-structured and very inclusive. The first table of contents, is History, Holidays, Traditions & Beliefs, Rituals, Spells, Prayers & Chants and Skills.  We will also include a glossary/dictionary and a bibliography. The materials in the book will be of quality, vetted by sharp-eyed and knowledgeable elders, and will be based on the submissions we receive. We have a basic structure today with enough material to start, and we will only add to the depth and beauty of the Craft. . First Edition Hardcover Edition: We are going to have the Hardcover books made by a small press here in Chicago, Il. We will make as only as many as we have perks and prepaid orders, plus a small amount for authors and gifts.  This will give you a beautiful book, that will be a certified first edition, with all the errors, mistakes, and before inevitable changes will occur. This is the nature of printing, and we will produce to our market and limit the final number created to actual demand.  Everyone who receives the first edition will also receive the eBook as well. Paperback Edition:This will be the largest possible run we can make, in the format which can get us the most number of quality copies. The current plan is to create a trade paperback edition at 1000 copies, with the $20,000 goal.  If we do not meet that goal, we will use small press printers to make as many copies as we need to meet the demand. Everyone who receives a paperpack edition will also receive the eBook as well. eBook Edition: As we move into the Digital age, this edition will not be constrained to the same size as print, and will be able to have a larger amount of material. It will have a identical copy of the printed book, and a extended part with additional material created. This is a more fluid format in setting up, and when created will be the easiest shared.  Every perk, excluding handmade bookmark, will include the eBook. eBook Update, Creating Links in eBooks:November 4th, updateIn discussing the eBook, we are able to create links, and this will allow us to connect to thousands of other pages. We are building this to be read on any platform including tablets, Kindles, and any way one wants to read their digital materials. In this, we will be able to give authors and writers ways to build in hyperlinks in their writings,  as well as automatically for certain wordsets, and create a referral service that can connect to other online libraries such as Sacred Text,  Library of Congress, and virtually the whole of humanities public libraries to tap into. We can incorporate video and audio into the eBook. In this sense the eBook will be a gateway into the world of Witchcraft and Wicca, on a spiritual and virtual levels, driving everyone to seek out physical experiences, building community.  The quality of the links will depend on finding sites that will help them become part of the community.  
The Process: 
We are seeking to create both a digital eBook and also a bound book that covers the basic teachings of Wicca and Witchcraft. We are planning to take one year to write and acquire the needed materials. 
We do have The Super Omnibus of Spells and Incantations for Every Occasion to draw from, created and provided by Don Lewis and Maryann Kay. We will incorporate The Five Mystic Secrets with commentary as well. This will be the start of source material created for the purpose of sharing. 
We will hire editors, authors, and researchers as we can to create lessons for the book. We will be creating a physical version that can be shared in whole or in part. We will also have an eBook edition which will be a digital version of the same book, with additional materials that might not be available for the first bound edition. 
Everything will be peer reviewed, and searched for plagiarism and other copyright violations. When all materials have been formatted and collated, the completed book will be sent out for printing. The bound version and the eBook will be released simultaneously.  
Common Book of Wicca and Witchcraft Timeline:October 1th, 2013: Call for Articles BeginsNovember 4th, 2013: First List of ContentNovember 11th, 2013: Campaign Closes: Radio Show on Pagans TonightMay 15th, 2014: Deadline for all submissions for print versionJune 15th, 2014: Deadline for all copy for print version. July 15th, 2014: Deadline for all copy  enhanced eBook August 1st, 2014: Sent to PrintersSeptember 1st, 2014: Final version of enhanced ebook October 1st, 2014: All Copies Delivered. eBooks released.
Levels of Funding: 
If we do not make $3,000 we will refund all money, and end the project.
If we make at least $3,000, we will produce the eBook with materials we have at that time. We will hire an editor to help with a volunteer writing group. The paperback will be a comb bound, hand printed book. A hardcover edition will be hand produced. 
When we make $5,000 we will print our paperback professionally. 
When we raise more than $5,000, we will use most of the money to hire editors, writers, authors, and researchers to produce the best quality material for this project. 
With $20,000 we can complete the bound first edition within one year, with basic teachings in a Common Book of Wicca and Witchcraft. 
If we reach beyond $20,000 we can add a broader coalition of writers to allow them to do more in-depth lessons. We can hopefully hire university level and professional writers. We can also include more novice writers as well. At every level we will build it, and it will take a community to do so.Our Team:Staff Updated as of 10/14/2013Chair, Ed Hubbard, Project ManagerCEO, Michael FerrellCurators: Phaedra Bonewits, Abby WillowrootExecutive Editors: Brendan Tripp (Publish Layout), Maryann Kay, Traci Logan WoodCover editor: Ed Ireland, Researchers: Alan Salmi (Chief)Principal Writers: Rev. Don Lewis (Head Writer)Social Media Team:  CoriLynne NicholsContributing authors: Oberon Zell, Phil Farber, Raven Digitalis, Rick Johnson, William Halstead, Faemore Lorei, Rev. Hectuba Hestia, We will be updating our staff listing as we bring people on, with assurances of truly doing the work.  This is essential for us to create our timeline. Projects Completed: Our team has completed a number of earlier projects that are for public distribution: Five Mystic Secrets in eight languages: http://www.witchschool.com/page/the-five-mystic-secrets What is Wicca? in eighteen languages: http://www.witchschool.com/page/what-is-wicca-languageJoin Me for a Wiccan Ritual in three languages, this is a comic book: http://www.witchschool.com/page/join-me-for-a-wiccan-ritual Harry Potter vs. Real Witches: http://www.witchschool.ws/library/pdf/Harry_P_VS_Real_Witches.pdf 
Team History: Our Team History: We have been public Pagan educators since 1990, beginning with the New Castle Society and the Mirror Coven of Chicago. We have been instrumental in creating wonderful opportunities for people to learn and understand Paganism, with a number of us practicing among other traditions. We have sponsored magazines including The Terminal Journal and Round Table Magazine. We evolved into radio including Psychic Chicago Radio, Telepathic Radio, and currently Pagans Tonight, a seven day a week radio network that just celebrated its four year anniversary with over 1500 shows. 
We hosted three Pagan Leadership Conferences of Chicago in 1994. These projects, along with Pagan Expo, launched an active community that lasted through most of the decade, with some of Chicago’s best leaders stepping up to help with expansion and growth. Today Chicago is a community that is learning to live with a new generation that seeks knowledge via the internet.
This project began with The Daily Spell in 1998 and it subsequently became the online website Witch School on September 4th, 2011. This has been a powerful global education resource that offers a free lessons and dozens of courses. Every day, Witch School is doing it’s very best to provide a lifetime of education to anyone, anytime, anywhere. We have thousands of potential teachers globally, ready to teach, if we could supply them with the necessary materials. In the past, Witchcraft, Wicca and Pagan educational programs have often been bootstrap projects. So once again, we ask our fellow Wiccans to help us compile and distribute new and insightful information, so that we can share our experiences, as we learn our history and seek our own path.  Witch School reaches 246,000 members in 207 countries, and offers courses such as Living the Wiccan Life and over 100 more. 
We created Magick TV which has video lessons, interviews with Pagan community leaders, and more, including Don Lewis Daily Vlog. We have produced over 2,000 videos since the station opened on November 11th, 2005. We started Pagans Tonight radio on September 15th, 2009. We published The Correllian Times magazine beginning in 2006, with Issue 74 just released.
We have done some large scale projects, and this will be one of our greatest challenges. If we can accomplish this, one year from now we will have reached our goal to continue our focus of a lifelong, open education. We will be able to offer a set of core materials for all teachers to share with everyone; to use with no fear of reprimand or copyright infringement threats.

story:
The Story:

Welcome to Kiyor'lin, a land where magic is everywhere. It is a realm of many cultures where Elves are the current ruling race. They are allied with the Dwarves and the Humans. The ogres to the north and the Trolls to the south are bound by a treaty that is tenuous, at best. However, the real threat comes in the form of an evil witch that serves the dark dragon god. Using hired assassins and an army of demons, Nymette is determined to bring chaos and destruction to the land.

The young Elfin king is chosen by the dragon god of the light to put a stop to the witch and her army. After handpicking his command party, Draganos sets out with a regiment of his finest warriors. Along the way, they must avoid the assassins that are hired to put an end to him. They will face demons of all kinds, including the ones hidden within themselves. They will learn new things about one another. In the strangest moment, Draganos realizes his queen. But, in order to survive long enough to wed his love, he must first learn the ancient truth.

By donating today, you're supporting Hatchburrow, Book 2 of the Kiyor'lin Series, by Neil Orr -

About Me:

After the US Navy, I cranked a few wrenches and then got into Law Enforcement, then turned Photographer.  I've always loved writing. However,  I've always written for myself, never believing that I was good enough to be published.  a friend of mine read a couple chapters of Shad'rah, he asked "What the hell are you doing taking pictures when you have this kind of talent? You should be writing books.", I decided that I was going to finally follow my dream and believe in myself. 

You can invest in this dream.

Your donations will pay for the following:

Editing

Proofreading

Formatting

Artwork (by Joel Ferris)

Marketing
