story:
Free Sample Chapters!

SAMPLE CHAPTERS ARE DOWN WHILE WE WORK ON THE MANUSCRIPT. THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT. WE WILL HAVE A PUBLIC UPDATE IN THE UPCOMING MONTHS.

Get your free ten chapters right here! Available in PDF, EPUB, or MOBI. The sample is approximately 90,000 words, and is roughly 1/3 of the first book in the series. The goal is to eventually write six books, so hunker down! Adventure awaits!


Our Story

All is not right in the Otherworld of elves and faeries. Our story begins with a dire warning from Aurali, a broken hearted faery, wise in experience and devoted to her kind. The Light of the Otherworld is quickly fading, for reasons that remain shrouded in mystery. A Great Befalling has scarred the hearts of elves and faeries, and afflicted their minds. They have lost their connection to each other, and the deeper mysteries of their existence – as a result, their lives seem devoid of meaning. The villains of this tragedy have hidden their agenda well. Great lies must be exposed before the Otherworld can be saved. Time is running out to discover the truth; in fact, only one year remains. If both sides do not reconcile their differences, the Light will die, and all will be lost.

Is there anyone who can prevent this from happening?

Enter Baudwin our hero - a water faery from the hamlet of Deuona. Baudwin is a spirited, adventurous soul with a brave heart, and an important destiny he must grow into. He lives with his father and grandfather helping to operate a dam that provides water to neighboring farms. In his spare time, he enjoys collecting Elven Steamway inventions, and performing with his acrobatic troupe. Although he is content with his life on the river, a great mystery pains his heart. His mother has been missing ever since he was born. All he knows is that her disappearance is somehow linked to the Great Befalling. To find her, he must uncover clues left by the woeful calamity that has struck down the elves and faeries. This search will sorely test his resolve, and lead him down an ever more difficult path to re-awaken the realm.

In Secrets of the Rainbow Bridge, Baudwin will join up with loyal friends from every Faery element, and face multiple enemies, with hidden agendas. He will also be forced to choose between the old ways of the Faeries, and the new ways of the Elves. This will not come easily for him. To make the right choice, he will have to contemplate many challenging situations. His quest will force him to change the way he perceives the world around him: allies will seem like enemies, and enemies like allies. He will receive help from unexpected sources, but for the most part he will have to meet the challenge alone.

Time is short and there is much ground to cover. Baudwin has but one year to accomplish his goal, for his journey begins at the start of the Liminal year – a special time between the ages when unusual occurrences are common, and everything becomes possible. Extraordinary events will open opportunities for great change, but they will also come with even greater dangers. Are the events around him part of a greater tapestry that he cannot yet comprehend? Will he succeed in his quest? And are you ready to go with him on his amazing journey?

Our Message

In our family, we have had our share of pain and struggle, including periods of unemployment, family illness, failed businesses, and financial instability. When we began working on Secrets of the Rainbow Bridge, all of us felt that our lives had reached an all time low. J.R.R. Tolkien states in The Return of the King that "Oft hope is born, when all is forlorn." 

For us, when all was forlorn, the Elves and Faeries became our muses. "Write our story!" they said. And so we began. The more we collaborated, the better we felt. Having worked together tightly as a creative team for the past four years, our spirits have lifted, our pain is fading, and healing is coming into our lives. 

As artists, we want very much to share all of this with you. Through Secrets of the Rainbow Bridge, we would like to show you what the Elves and Faeries are saying, which is that no matter how dark and difficult things may seem, each of us has the power to rise above our greatest challenges, by going deep within. When we find out who we are inside, we can always draw upon the positive, in order to let go of the negative, and find the Light. 

With this message in our hearts, we get up everyday, utterly committed to our all important goal, which is to complete our first book. After that, we have five more to go. The Elves and Faeries have a lot to say! With your support, we will be able to continue on this path, which is to provide a deep and uplifting message for our readers. In the process, we will make sure that they are thoroughly entertained!

Our Characters

Please see the gallery for a preview of all the characters. A larger preview of the map can be found here. Remember, the map in the yellow reward tier is 5x the resolution of the sample!

Intended Audience

The series is intended for anyone between the ages of 12 and 84 including precocious ten year olds, and adventurous centenarians! Anyone who likes the wonder and magic of The Wizard of Oz, the magic and adventure of Harry Potter, and the mythic depth of Lord of the Rings will enjoy the series.

Although the story is easy to understand, the world is fairly complex, and getting fully immersed takes time. We strove to give fantasy readers something compelling and interesting, by illustrating the dichotomy between the Elven steampunk (which we call Steamway) civilization, and the traditional Faery civilization. We expect the story to be understood on many levels, and will be loved by families who want a magic adventure with drama and depth. 

Reward Tiers

*Final dimensions of prints may vary by a few inches.


Tier Grid


Stretch Goals
As we approach our goal, we'll update this section. We dream of getting an audio book made, but that alone costs tens of thousands of dollars.
Where the Money Goes

Your donation will help cover costs that include cover art, interior art, promotional art, copy editing, printing, typesetting, ISBN costs, and all other costs associated with the books. With enough money, we hope to have an illustration for every chapter. Your pledge level determines what you receive, and all reward tiers will be professionally written, designed, printed, and delivered. 

It's important to remember that with publishing the margins are pretty thin, so in many ways this campaign is really to achieve this:

  1. Cover the costs mentioned above.
  2. Create a limited print run that we can send to reviewers or libraries.
  3. Possibly and audio book! But we have to go far above our goal for this.
It will not be for:
  1. Taking a vacation to Aruba.
  2. Handing out bonuses to the authors.
  3. Paying our rent (we all have day jobs).

If we meet our goal, we should break even, and that isn't bad! If we don't meet our goal, then we will deliver our perks to those who backed us, roll up our sleeves, and keep pushing. With publishing, even a partial success can help - we aren't designing an incredibly expensive prototype. Furthermore, success or fail, this book will be completed!

    Risks & Challenges

    The first third of the first book is already completed. Once our campaign is finished, we will continue to write the first book, and then revise and edit the completed manuscript. The primary challenge is delivering our product in a timely fashion that will not alienate our backers. We expect it will be done no less than a year after the campaign is completed. 

    However, this is the first time we are going through this process, so we ask for your patience. We will give timely updates along the way, which we hope will keep our backers satisfied.

    Accounting for distribution costs is another challenge, but we have a business grad on our team, so we won’t fall into amateur traps of cost estimation. Truly, the greatest variable cost is international shipping, but even if every single package was shipped this way, we would meet our obligations. We have a shipping company already researched, and we are estimating costs based on their rates.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We need all the help we can get spreading the word! Please link this on your Facebook, Twitter, or other social media accounts. Post about it on forums, or email your friends. Click on the Indiegogo share tools :-)

    Team

    Manuscript

    Olivia Rosestone - Co-author

    Douglas Rosestone - Co-author

    Jonah Rosestone - Co-author

    David Solomon - Editor

    Kate Chadbourne PhD - Language Help

    Artwork
    Arthur Bozonnet - Artist

    Crystal Smith - Graphic Design

    Video

    James Campbell - Video Production

    Jocelyn Babalis - Little Red Riding Hood

    Marketing

    Debbie Hemley - Web Marketing
    Sebastian Warnke - Web Optimization
    Scarlett Rugers - Web Design and Book Cover Design

    FAQ

    What's with the international shipping rates?

    Sadly, we can't do better than what we listed. We would like to include free shipping everywhere, but it's not feasible. If the cost seems too high, then please check out our digital rewards. You could also choose domestic and go with your own remailing service. 

    Do you support DRM?

    We don’t use DRM in our ebooks. TOR Books already got rid of DRM and they reported no discernible difference in sales afterwards. DRM can easily be circumvented, and we feel that underneath it all, people are good and will pay for the hard work of artists – especially when it’s being channeled in a positive way. If someone wants to pirate our books they will, so why make it more difficult for the people paying us? There’s really no need for DRM. You bought it, so use it on whatever device(s) you own.

    When will I get my rewards?

    Our goal is Fall of 2015. It's possible it will delay, but we don't expect too much of one. We will keep you updated.

    How long will the final book be?

    It will be about 300,000 words in length which is about 700 or so pages in hardback (give or take).

    I can't pronounce anything on the map! Help!

    There will be a pronunciation table in the book, and we have a sample one on our website.

    Can I choose my t-shirt size?

    Of course! We will survey you when the time comes.

    I spotted a weird text error in your sample. What gives?

    Believe it our not, our sample is almost error free, but the converting software makes mistakes that aren't in the manuscript! In the final version, we will iron out all the bugs.

    Your sample has tons of spacing shifts etc on my reader? What gives?

    Not all readers and formats are created equal. We haven't had any problems with Kindle, or PDF, but some readers on the iPad don't like our document. If you're using an iPad we recommend NeoSoarBook.

    Hey this map preview looks pretty good. Why would I bother paying you for it?

    That map preview is merely 20% of the true size. That means the real version is 12,000 by 7,800 pixels. It has much more detail than the sample we are showing, and the same is true for all of our character artwork etc.

    How long have you been writing this series?

    For over four years now. The first book should be done around the five year mark.

    Wow a sixty day campaign? Kinda long don't you think?

    Not really. If people don't have time to read all ten chapters then they may not feel comfortable backing us. The long window is to give them a little more time, and hopefully tell a friend or two :-)

Marketing
Debbie Hemley - Web MarketingSebastian Warnke - Web OptimizationScarlett Rugers - Web Design and Book Cover Design





FAQ
What's with the international shipping rates?Sadly, we can't do better than what we listed. We would like to include free shipping everywhere, but it's not feasible. If the cost seems too high, then please check out our digital rewards. You could also choose domestic and go with your own remailing service. Do you support DRM?We don’t use DRM in our ebooks. TOR Books already got rid of DRM and they reported no discernible difference in sales afterwards. DRM can easily be circumvented, and we feel that underneath it all, people are good and will pay for the hard work of artists – especially when it’s being channeled in a positive way. If someone wants to pirate our books they will, so why make it more difficult for the people paying us? There’s really no need for DRM. You bought it, so use it on whatever device(s) you own.When will I get my rewards?Our goal is Fall of 2015. It's possible it will delay, but we don't expect too much of one. We will keep you updated.How long will the final book be?It will be about 300,000 words in length which is about 700 or so pages in hardback (give or take).I can't pronounce anything on the map! Help!There will be a pronunciation table in the book, and we have a sample one on our website.Can I choose my t-shirt size?Of course! We will survey you when the time comes.I spotted a weird text error in your sample. What gives?Believe it our not, our sample is almost error free, but the converting software makes mistakes that aren't in the manuscript! In the final version, we will iron out all the bugs.Your sample has tons of spacing shifts etc on my reader? What gives?Not all readers and formats are created equal. We haven't had any problems with Kindle, or PDF, but some readers on the iPad don't like our document. If you're using an iPad we recommend NeoSoarBook.Hey this map preview looks pretty good. Why would I bother paying you for it?That map preview is merely 20% of the true size. That means the real version is 12,000 by 7,800 pixels. It has much more detail than the sample we are showing, and the same is true for all of our character artwork etc.How long have you been writing this series?For over four years now. The first book should be done around the five year mark.Wow a sixty day campaign? Kinda long don't you think?Not really. If people don't have time to read all ten chapters then they may not feel comfortable backing us. The long window is to give them a little more time, and hopefully tell a friend or two :-)

story:
The White Ships are back! 

The Grand Manner of Matson, the new book by Duncan O'Brien, is now available for pre-ordering. 

The 176-page, limited-edition soft cover art book is printing in September, 2014. It is the long-awaited follow-up to the 2009 award-winning book,The White Ships, now out-of-print. 

A limited number of signed copies of The Grand Manner of Matson will be offered via this Indiegogo campaign, at a reduced pre-order rate. The book can be ordered on its own, or in combination with other packages of white ships-related memorabilia also being offered through this pre-sale. Please see the different "PERKS" packages listed on the right side of this page, with photos and more details below. 

Funds raised by this campaign will help offset the initial production and printing costs of the book, and will go towards the on-going production of "The White Ships" documentary, a complete history of the Matson Line passenger era featuring vintage film and modern interviews with former passengers and crew. 

After this Indiegogo campaign ends on October 15, remaining copies of the book will be available via whiteships.com  ($65 plus shipping). The book will also be offered for sale in selected retail locations, primarily in the ports visited by Matson ships. 

Questions? email author Duncan O'Brien: 

duncan@pier10media.com

Below are more details and photos of some of the other packages available for purchase, including photos (items will all be shipped together with the book when it is available). Please note, shipping is not included in these prices. Please email duncan@pier10media.com if any questions about individual items depicted. 

Matson Line Ship's Library:  $500

Your chance to own the complete Matson 'trilogy' by Duncan O'Brien, including The Grand Manner of Matson  plus a scarce and out-of-print collector's first edition of The White Ships. The book is sometimes found on Amazon, eBay etc. for $1,000-3,000. Children's story Matson the Mouse included. 3 packages available. 



Matson Music! LP + CD Package:  $350

The Grand Manner of Matson  signed book plus... a collection of 5 rare Matson Line era LP records connected to the white ships. Songs include big band classics and hapa haole favorites played on board ship (Hukilau, Beyond the Reef, etc) Package also includes the brand-new CD from San Francisco's Kawika Alfiche, featuring his new single, "White Ships". 

LP's include: 

  • Ports of Paradise (Alfred Newman & Ken Darby)
  • The Magic Islands (Alfred Newman & his orchestra)
  • Cruising with Anson (Anson Weeks & Orchestra)
  • Bob Davis on the SS Lurline (Bob Pauhaleokapioanaokeanuenueokalani Davis)
  • SS Matsonia (recording of a live radio broadcast from the 1957 maiden voyage as the ship departed New York for San Francisco)

Malolo Package:  $750

A deluxe package for the serious Matson collector featuring items related to the S.S. Malolo. Included (see below): 

  • signed copy of The Grand Manner of Matson
  • 1926 original photo of ship's construction at Cramp shipyard 
  • 1927 maiden voyage passenger list, NY-San Francisco
  • glass transparency of Malolo in Rio de Janeiro, 1935
  • gorgeous hand-written journal by a passenger aboard the Malolo's 1929 Around the Pacific cruise, which visited Japan, China, Indonesia, Thailand, Australia, the South Pacific and more. 250 pages of stories and shipboard documents.
  • 2 passenger lists, 1931 & 1933 
  • 2 menus, 1931 & 1933
  • 2 postcards - San Pedro, Music room

Mariposa Package:  $275

Memorabilia connected to the two different versions of the S.S. Mariposa. Included (see below): 

  • signed copy of The Grand Manner of Matson 
  • press photo of 1956 Mariposa
  • 1932 Room plan for Mariposa and Monterey
  • Matson brochure promoting new Mariposa cruises
  • Matson Lines S.S. Mariposa lighter in box (1960s)
  • Australian Woolworth's card
  • 2 postcards

Monterey Package:  $225

Memorabilia connected to the two different versions of the S.S. Monterey. Included (see below): 

  • signed copy of The Grand Manner of Matson 
  • 1938 passenger list, Honolulu to LA and SF
  • souvenir tiki handed out on 1957 Monterey maiden voyage
  • souvenir Matson flag given to passengers in dining room
  • 1930s colorized postcard

Matsonia Package:  $175

Memorabilia connected to the two different versions of the S.S. Matsonia. Included (see below): 

  • signed copy of The Grand Manner of Matson 
  • 1947 Matsonia passenger list 
  • 1957 new Matsonia maiden voyage passenger list, LA to Honolulu
  • 1946 Room plan for Matsonia (post WW2 interim service)
  • postcard of Matsonia stateroom
  • 1957 press photo of Matsonia on maiden voyage
  • brochure Matsonia Thanksgiving-Christmas Hawaii cruises, 1958

Lurline Package:  $250

Memorabilia connected to the different versions of the S.S. Lurline. Included (see below): 

  • signed copy of The Grand Manner of Matson
  • "Pacific Panorama": 70-page book featuring text of lectures and b&w photos from Lurline's 71-day South Seas-Orient cruise in 1958. Signed by author W.H. Hutchinson. 
  • 1930s b&w photo postcard of Lurline in Honolulu
  • 1960s postcard of Lurline in Honolulu 
  • complete deck of Matson Lines playing cards featuring Frank Mcintosh ukulele artwork
  • 1948 passenger list, Honolulu-San Francisco, one of the first voyages of the new post-War Lurline
  • 1948 foldout pamphlet for Lurline's return to service
  • advertising card for Lurline service to Hawaii, 1950s

    PFEL Package:  $200

    Memorabilia from the white ships' Pacific Far East Lines (PFEL) era, 1971-1978. Included (see below): 

    • signed copy of The Grand Manner of Matson 
    • PFEL stationery - 3 styles
    • 2 PFEL letter openers with ship names engraved
    • 1974-75 PFEL South Seas Cruise brochure
    • 10 Menus from world cruises of Monterey and Mariposa
    • 2 sets of PFEL Matches
    • 1974 Joyce Carroll Concert Program enroute Christmas Island to Raiatea
    • swizzle sticks
    • PFEL pencil
    • Los Angeles luggage tag
    • Postcard of Monterey / Mariposa in PFEL colors

    Lurline replica model:  $1750

    All-wood, museum-quality custom-built model of the Lurline (late 60s version) mounted on stand with electric lights. One of five built for a ship model collector in 2010. 36" long, built to scale.  Model is shipped in large wooden crate. Shipping cost is additional, amount TBC based on location.  

    • includes signed copy of The Grand Manner of Matson

    • Note - one lifeboat is missing.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Victoria (Vikki) Marie, I am retired from paid work and serve as volunteer pastor of Our Lady of Guadalupe Tonantzin Community. Recently Scholar's Press asked to publish my doctoral thesis. Although written 10 year ago, the work is of current relevance because it examines sociological factors in addiction and explores the questions of how powerlessness and surrender translate into sobriety as well as the motivation to help others in the recovery process.

If I can purchase 20 copies of the book, I can lower the publishers selling price from $101.85 CAD to $61.35CAD per copy. Addiction touches the lives of so many people. The lower price will make it more accessible.

What We Need & What You Get

The book, Transforming Addiction: The role of spirituality in recovery from addiction will be available next month.

  • I need $1,050 to purchase 20 books from the distributor of Scholar's Press books, morebooks.de.

  • If I don't reach my entire goal or if I receive more than my goal, I will purchase as many books as I can to lower it's retail price.

The Impact

  • Addiction is a problem of concern in many communities around the globe. Assorted strategies have been studied or implemented to address the problem with varied amounts of success. This study investigates spirituality, a largely unexplored factor in recovery from addictions, and its role in the learning processes that transformed the participants from addicts to abstainers.

  • This book will provide new insights into addiction issues for health care professionals, spiritual leaders, students of the social sciences and anyone concerned about addiction and recovery issues. Your contribution will help me make the book accessible to more people.

Risks & Challenges

The only risk is not reaching my goal. If I don't I will purchase as many book as I can to lower the retail price.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

    • Please share this page with your networks.

    • Please use the Indiegogo share tools above!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Chaudiere Books was created to produce books that engage the Ottawa-area literary community with the outside world, providing an important venue for first books as well as an important opportunity to showcase a wide array of literary talent. Since 2006, we have produced over a dozen titles of poetry and fiction with titles by Monty Reid, Pearl Pirie, Marcus McCann, John Newlove, Michael Bryson, Joe Blades, Meghan Jackson, Anne Le Dressay, Clare Latremouille, rob mclennan, and Nicholas Lea. In the fall of 2014, we’re excited to be publishing first poetry books by Amanda Earl and Roland Prevost, as well as a new collection by Lampman Award winner Monty Reid. Our 2015 array of titles includes exciting works by authors we’re itching to tell you about (hopefully soon) but includes Kemptville poet (by way of Vancouver) Chris Turnbull.

Chaudiere Books was relaunched by rob mclennan and new co-publisher Christine McNair in 2013. We’re asking for support in this, our challenging re-building year, to help us continue to produce important works by Canadian writers. As one of only a few small presses in Canada that focus (primarily) on poetry titles, we’re in a unique position to contribute to the literary community in Canada. Help us keep the presses rolling!

story:
Dirty is the autobiography of MC Flux aka Carl Rodney Thomas, a very close friend of mine. Now Carl-Flux is well known in certain circles and some may know bits and pieces of his story already, for those that don't this is a story from humble beginnings to the pinnacle of a music career on an underground dance music scene that spanned the globe.  MC Flux was a part of that international scene and toured most cities in the UK and internationally including Los Angeles, Moscow and Tokyo.

Working alongside Award winning DJs like Grooverider, Andy C, Fabio, DJ Bailey, Jumping Jack Frost, DJ Rap, Goldie and Kemistry and Storm. That is only half the story, Living the high life, complicated relationships and mental instability, led to an addiction to heroin and incarceration for football related violence. 

To produce the story onto manuscript took 4 years and to get the story to the masses is not going to be an easy task. Never one to shirk a bit of hard work and also Carl has been like a brother to me,  I personally took up the challenge in between a busy work and family schedule with my wife and 2 children, to write and prepare it for publishing.

Carl has also worked hard, to correct many of the wrongs detailed in the book, he has always had a compassionate side to him that is rarely appreciated. Leaving London to escape the distractions that he easily falls into, he has been working towards an NVQ qualification to become a Youth  worker  and is currently now assisting on voluntary youth worker projects in Liverpool where he now resides, helping homeless young people, many of whom have been or are affected by drug or alcohol related problems .  His story, maybe it can be an inspiration to young people to understand and avoid the pitfalls of indulgence and how to overcome addiction. 

All we are hoping for is to give this book the best chance of success, although we are not expecting a best seller like your Fifty Shades of Grey by any stretch of the imagination but you never know.

This is where you come in.  IndieGoGo is a wonderful platform for this self-publishing author to collect and guarantee the funding necessary for the production of a professional book that can hold it’s own against any book produced by the big publishing houses. 

If you believe in our journey from idea to publication I am asking for funding to help with these things:

•  Developmental Editing

•  Proofreading

•  Allow Printing In Bulk To Bring Down The Per-Book Costs

•  Obtaining Isbn Number

•  Paying Registration Fees

•  Additional Costs Associated With Getting Listed In Various Online  Bookstores

•  Promotion, including a Book launch party 

•  Envelopes, Packing Materials, Postage

•  Extra Review Copies

I will be laying out (typesetting) the book myself.  

We will also by promoting it ourselves with the help of http://mastermindpromotion.com/  whose professional services also come at a cost.  

The book will be available as a hard-copy and e-book. 

Self Publishing cost = £3,700

Breakdown

Developmental edit £900

Copy editing £700

Cover Design £200

Book formatting and layout £300

Printing – free (Print on demand only)

ISBN – £100

Author photo – £100

Total marketing spend – £1200

Website – £200 (For custom WordPress theme) 

Even if you can not contribute please make some noise for us and share using IndieGoGo's share tools to spread the word

Thank you very very much for your support

story:
What  is INFINITY MAGAZINE?

Hi, I’m Darcelle, the Editor-in-chief for a magazine about wellness, recreation, culture and travel, called Infinity Magazine.

I am a business coach who works intuitively with my clients, and love tourism and travel. I'm also co-author of a Canadian bestselling book and have helped hundreds of businesses become successful.

Why is INFINITY MAGAZINE IMPORTANT?

We are a creative and spiritually-minded magazine who believes in inspiring, promoting and supporting others. Our dream has been to create an online and print magazine. Acting as a resource that will allow regular people to tap into what it means to live a balanced life and to enjoy an experience when travelling, and not just a site seeing tour.  But most of all, it’s about making a difference in people’s lives.

What DIFFERENCE can INFINITY MAGAZINE MAKE?

It’s about a recognition that there is infinite possibilities for a better world, and that we can all make a difference. Highlighting the places and people that are making a difference is what Infinity Magazine is about.  

What will you see in INFINITY MAGAZINE?

Infinity Magazine tells you stories about  culture, sports, destinations or just every day fun. Making you wish you were there, learning alongside the writers and enjoying the enriched experience. It shows you how to get there and what to do while there.  We will help bring awareness about how to keep your mind, body and soul in balance. Something we all are striving to achieve in our lives!

You will learn about the writers behind the stories and the owners behind the businesses. The magazine tells you about communities  and the journey and experience that can be enjoyed when you travel to a destination. It`s about hidden gems that you may not have known are out there for you to explore.

What is INFINITY MAGAZINE'S GOAL?

Infinity Magazine launched an "Introductory Issue" in early December 2012, and is now looking to create its first print magazine issue and host a Spring Launch event for the magazine. The goal is to raise $5,000 in just 30 days! The Spring issue will be released in mid March.

We created what you see on the site and in the digital magazine out of pocket and we are looking to create more great stories and memories for people who come to Canada or travel internationally to enjoy!

What DOES INFINITY MAGAZINE NEED FROM YOU?

Infinity Magazine is not a charity, but is in need of financial support to reach its goal.   We need your support. We need you to make a pledge for our campaign and be part of the community who helps Infinity Magazine bring its dream to reality.  As a contributor you  become one of our peeps and can enjoy a variety of perks (depending on the financial amount you provide).  That's right, free stuff! It`s a win/win/win! You get a perk for supporting the campaign, the writer’s get exposire, and Infinity Magazine gets to share its stories for the world to enjoy!

If you donate you're guaranteed to get what you paid for, regardless of whether we reach $5000. IndieGoGo monitors all of their projects carefully - you can check the information on the site.

Become a contributor today and place a pledge - big or small, every contribution is greatly appreciated by Infinity Magazine and its team.  

It’s NOT ALL ABOUT THE MONEY.

Of course we need dollars to have a print magazine, but if you can’t help with a pledge, then perhaps you can pass along to someone you know who may interested in placing a pledge.

SHARE on Facebook our handle is Infinity Magazine Canada

SHARE on Twitter our handle is @InfinityMagCan

SIGN up for our mailing list to get updates on the campaign as it progresses.

BLOG, TWEET, SHARE

 

P.S.  Please note that ALLsupporters will have their names mentioned on our site and in Infinity Magazine  as gratitude  for your generosity. If this is something you would rather not have happen, please let me know.

Thanks, Darcelle
story_txt:
What  is INFINITY MAGAZINE?
Hi, I’m Darcelle, the Editor-in-chief for a magazine about wellness, recreation, culture and travel, called Infinity Magazine. 
I am a business coach who works intuitively with my clients, and love tourism and travel. I'm also co-author of a Canadian bestselling book and have helped hundreds of businesses become successful.
Why is INFINITY MAGAZINE IMPORTANT?
We are a creative and spiritually-minded magazine who believes in inspiring, promoting and supporting others. Our dream has been to create an online and print magazine. Acting as a resource that will allow regular people to tap into what it means to live a balanced life and to enjoy an experience when travelling, and not just a site seeing tour.  But most of all, it’s about making a difference in people’s lives.
What DIFFERENCE can INFINITY MAGAZINE MAKE?
It’s about a recognition that there is infinite possibilities for a better world, and that we can all make a difference. Highlighting the places and people that are making a difference is what Infinity Magazine is about.  
What will you see in INFINITY MAGAZINE?
Infinity Magazine tells you stories about  culture, sports, destinations or just every day fun. Making you wish you were there, learning alongside the writers and enjoying the enriched experience. It shows you how to get there and what to do while there.  We will help bring awareness about how to keep your mind, body and soul in balance. Something we all are striving to achieve in our lives!
You will learn about the writers behind the stories and the owners behind the businesses. The magazine tells you about communities  and the journey and experience that can be enjoyed when you travel to a destination. It`s about hidden gems that you may not have known are out there for you to explore.

story:
Apogee Journal is an independent literary journal, the first issue of which can be found here: http://apogeejournal.me/issue-one/.  We primarily feature fiction, creative nonfiction and poetry by writers of color, as well as non-hegemonic perspectives on racial, social and political issues by writers of all races. Our dual purpose is to celebrate writers on the periphery who express their creativity, interests and struggles, and to provide a platform for all writers to thoughtfully engage with issues of race and cultural diversity.  We are eager to publish work that sits at some distance from the mainstream, and most excited by that which seeks to acknowledge, interrogate or disrupt this distance.

Apogee Journal is created by students of color and international students in Columbia University’s MFA writing program. The desire for Apogee grew from discussions among members of Our Word, a student group devoted to artists of color in the program. However, Apogee is an independent publication, independent of Columbia University and Our Word.

We are writers of fiction, nonfiction and poetry; we have studied literature, languages, political science and development. We are united by a desire to read and publish fiction, poetry, and creative nonfiction that pushes social boundaries and explores issues of race and cultural diversity.

With your help, we can raise the money to end up with the first printed issue of Apogee!

story:
The esteemed Barry Grass is working on a nonfiction book about Saison-Farmhouse Ales, a specific type of beer whose roots are in Belgium.

Barry has been conducting many interviews for the book, including brewers both here in the United States as well as abroad.

For being a self-proclaimed 'beer nerd', Barry has actually never been to Belgium: a place certainly worthy of being called a 'Barry Grass Mecca'. 

A group of us have decided that sending Barry to Belgium would be an absolutely amazing experience & would help him greatly in finishing his book.

Think of all of the times Barry has suggested a beer for you. Maybe he has steered you towards some beautiful nonfiction that you wouldn't have otherwise seen if it weren't for his excellent taste & keen eye. 

We all want to help, but we can't do it alone. Please consider donating enough to pay for his airfare over to the Low Countries.

THIS IS A SECRET: BARRY DOES NOT KNOW ABOUT THIS.

We hope that you will consider donating--furthermore if you want to help us with incentives to help others donate, please let us know. 

Thanks!

story:
About the Book

This campaign has been launched to fund the production of the clearing, a beautifully illustrated and crafted pamphlet of poetry which will be published by Atlantic Press in 2016.

the clearing is a sequence of minimalist poetry on birds set in a clearing in the woods. Using folklore as well as observation, the poetry presses questions of faith and despair, as well as of place, nature and voyeurism, through the voices and behaviours of birds observed as they pass into, out of or through the clearing. 

Mairead’s artwork perfectly captures the atmosphere of the poetry, responding to and enhancing senses of lighting and observation with her innovative use of lenses, light and darkness in the image-making process. 

The poet, Luke Thompson, is a writer and editor from Cornwall. In 2016, as well as the clearing, Luke will be publishing a biography of the poet Jack Clemo with Ally Press, a collection of illustrated flash fiction with John Kilburn, and a work of creative non-fiction for Little Toller Books. Last year, Luke edited the Selected Poems of Jack Clemo published by Enitharmon, He completed his PhD at the University of Exeter and teaches at Falmouth University. Luke is also editor of the magazine for writing about landscape, nature and place, confusingly also entitled The Clearing.

Mairead Dunne is an artist from Co. Offaly who has exhibited her work internationally, from Beijing to Paris, as well as widely throughout the UK and Ireland. She received an MFA from the University of Ulster, Belfast, where she became co-director of the artist-run collective Platform Arts. Mairead has held a number of international residencies, including in Ireland, France, Cyprus and Beijing, and she is currently enrolled on the MA Illustration: Authorial Practice programme in Falmouth. 

Atlantic Press have a growing reputation for the uncompromising quality of the books they produce. Working closely with printers, paper mills, illustrators and designers, Atlantic Press consider every aspect of the book’s development and production. For the clearing, as well as using papers from bespoke manufacturer and distributor GF Smith, Mairead has designed rubber stamps which will be hand printed onto each volume by the artist, making every single book unique. the clearing will be litho printed, sewn and bound at small Cornish firm R Booth’s, Penryn. Visit the Atlantic Press website to see some of the beautiful books they have been producing.



      

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise £1500 to cover the costs of production and distribution, including materials and printing. All money will go directly to Atlantic Press and contributors could receive one of a variety of perks, including:

  • Invitations to the Falmouth launch of the clearing.
  • Double-signed hand-stamped copies of the clearing and other books by Atlantic Press.
  • Limited Edition signed prints of Mairead's artwork from the clearing. (Each print will be one of just twelve.)
  • One-to-one personalised workshops with either Luke or Mairead in Cornwall.

All funds will go towards the production of this book. If we do not reach our target, we will reduce the print run and look at other sources of funding. All pledges made here will still be used and our production values will remain the same.

story:
¿Qué?

La leyenda del tiempo habla de la parte buena de los hombres malos; de sus motivaciones para el mal y de sus complicaciones para el bien.

Don Diego es el orgulloso conductor de una máquina descatalogada. Un camión centenario con miles de reparaciones a sus espaldas, capaz de transportarse de país a país en segundos. De él han vivido tres generaciones de su familia, transportando mercancías por toda la Tierra. Don Diego ama a esa máquina por lo que significa para la familia y por lo que significará para la persona a la que se la dará en herencia que está por nacer. Cuando el padre se entere de que el doctor ha decidido traer a su niña al mundo esa misma noche, despachará al comerciante con el que se estaba peleando en Japón e intentará viajar a España tan rápido como la máquina se lo permita. 

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de publicar obras poco convencionales pero de indudable calidad, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para promocionar cada título cuando esta todavía se encuentra en proceso de edición.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy se nos presenta Diego Blanes.

Nací en Elche en 1997 y actualmente estudio Comunicación Audiovisual en la universidad de esa ciudad. Siendo más joven me titulé en guitarra clásica y pinté todas las superficies lisas que encontré. Buscaba dar sentido a los mundos que vivían en mi mente y así exploré las diferentes formas de la expresión artística. Jugué de muy pequeño con la literatura incluso gané un par de premios con relatos cortos en la lengua de mi tierra. Pero no fue hasta hace un par de años que recobré el deseo de escribir. Gracias a la fotografía que es a lo que me dedico, he encontrado una pasión por la luz que se entrevé reflejada en las páginas de mi primera novela La leyenda del tiempo.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«Si le preguntase usted a Don Diego Méndez cómo es la vida de un transportista, escupiría un par de blasfemias entre dientes (para que el Señor no las oiga) y después, le diría que la vida de un pobre perro sarnoso y cojo que nunca aprendió de los palos del viejo más cascarrabias del pueblo a no mearle dentro de su huerto, era un sueño para cualquier malnacido que se atreviese a trabajar de eso. Después maldeciría varias familias y le contaría que no hay nadie en el mundo tan desgraciado como para querer transportar las basuras que los bastardos de los comerciantes cargaban en su máquina. A lo que usted, turbado, le preguntaría por qué lo hace, con la cantidad de trabajos buenos que hay para un hombre como él. Don Diego levantaría los ojos de su plato, intercambiaría miradas incrédulas con sus comensales y farfullaría algo como esto:

"Los Méndez han transportado con esa máquina desde hace más de cien años, y antes que esa, con otra. El problema son esos bastardos de los comerciantes. A los que solo les importa el dinero. ¿Cuánto dinero necesitan, eh? ¿Cuántos putos seguros voy a tener que firmar para que el señorito esté contento?¿Cuántos exámenes le tendré que sacar a la máquina para que me dejen trabajar en paz? Para que estén seguros de que nadie allí arriba perderá su precioso dinero por mi culpa. O acaso va a venir alguien a decirme; es cierto Don Diego, tiene usted razón. La máquina que compró su abuelo sigue siendo la maravilla que fue. Es más, por llevar tantos años de servicio, es mejor. Ya le digo yo que no. Mi máquina sabe más de seguridad que esos malditos niños de papá, con sus carreras y sus másters. No hay nada más seguro que esta máquina. ¿Eso está claro, no? —aquí giraría la cabeza para volver a reclamar la aprobación de sus compañeros—. Doscientos años transportando y mírela —Sacaría una estampita con la fotografía del camión y se la pondría en la cara, toda desgastada por los cantos por haberla llevado en el bolsillo de la camisa toda la vida y haberle dado mucho uso—. Mírela bien y dígame que no es una maravilla lo que ve"».

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción BACK IT es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Diego Blanes vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Política de Privacidad

story:
¿Qué?

El caso Teselas es una novela de género que desborda ironía y contiene un importante tema acerca de la naturaleza de nuestra sociedad.

Corre el año 1975 y el dictador Francisco Franco agoniza. El pueblo español espera el inevitable desenlace entre esperanzado y confuso por el futuro que le aguarda a su país. Los más avezados van tomando posiciones para no quedarse rezagados en una carrera cuya meta final parece ser la tan ansiada democracia. Por su parte, un extraño personaje que responde al nombre de Eduardo Teselas se ve envuelto en una insólita historia de conspiración en torno a la misteriosa desaparición del Gobernador del Banco de España.
          Acompañado de Laudelino Lajarín, un comisario de policía cuyos métodos deductivos son poco ortodoxos, se verá envuelto en una aventura en la que empresarios, financieros y políticos clandestinos parecen empeñados en influir en la medida de sus posibilidades en el nuevo orden social que se avecina. Sin ser consciente del relevante papel que su actuación va a deparar en el devenir de los acontecimientos, Eduardo afronta, entre resignado y confuso, una investigación que le deparará más de una sorpresa.
          Una historia detectivesca cuyo telón de fondo no es otro que las relaciones de poder y las consecuencias que se derivan de ellas, especialmente sobre los sufridos españoles de a pie que ignoran, en gran medida, los tejemanejes de las clases dirigentes. Escrita en clave irónica y surrealista y cuyo desenlace sorprenderá a más de un lector, El Caso Teselas abarca en el tiempo los estertores del franquismo con los primeros años de la democracia española y pretende entretener al lector con una surrealista trama de índole detectivesca, al mismo tiempo que ofrecerle una versión alternativa respecto a un momento histórico clave para entender en que ha terminado convirtiéndose nuestra nación.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Alfonso Cuenca.

Nacido nace en Totana (Murcia) el 31 de diciembre de 1975, es licenciado en Derecho por la Universidad de Murcia, ciudad en la que trabaja como funcionario de su Ayuntamiento. Su debut literario tuvo lugar con la novela El hombre que perdió la fe (Ápeiron Ediciones) con la que resultó finalista del premio Gregorio Samsa. Posteriormente participó en el prestigioso Certamen Internacional de Novela La encina de plata donde quedó finalista con la obra El rostro tras el embozo. Así mismo, muchos relatos suyos han aparecido en numerosas compilaciones, entre los que destaca su obra «Cripta para la infancia». Dentro de poco tiempo también verá la luz su novela Retrato de fantasma con tormenta al fondo que aborda bajo una pátina de misterio y melancolía los reencuentros familiares.

El Caso Teselas, por su parte, es una novela detectivesca con trasfondo político y social, escrita en clave surrealista e irónica, enmarcada en los últimos años de la dictadura de Francisco Franco y los primeros de la democracia española.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«Las claves de cualquier investigación policial son básicamente tres: autor, móvil y objeto del crimen. Sin embargo, la historia que ocupa mis cavilaciones desde hace ya varios años, e invade mis sueños cada noche hasta convertirlos, a veces, en pesadillas, podría decirse que vulnera estos tres principios fundamentales de la actuación criminalística. Es tal la fascinación que me provoca la singular disposición de los hilos que caprichosamente cruzados y enlazados entretejen los secretos de esta trama, que cualquier posibilidad de ilación razonable y ordenada, se vuelve imposible ante la complejidad y oscuridad de muchas de las claves y los protagonistas que rodearon esta confabulación, si es que fue tal, pues ni siquiera ese aspecto me queda todavía claro»

«El testimonio del señor Teselas no pudo considerarse de manera rotunda como una prueba pericial que arrojara algo de luz sobre los acontecimientos, pero si al menos sirvió para conocer algunos curiosos episodios sobre su vida y sobre las circunstancias que rodearon ésta. Sobre el aporte informativo que pudo colegirse de su concisa declaración, apenas pudieron hallarse unas sucesivas capas de pigmentos que trataban de contar la historia de una vida mucho más apasionante y compleja de lo que en principio pudiera esperarse de un individuo de aspecto anodino y vulgar. Sin embargo, investigaciones posteriores pudieron constatar que el sujeto en cuestión tenía un mayor grado de participación y conocimiento en los hechos objeto de análisis. Respecto a los exámenes efectuados acerca de la psicología del individuo solo pudo colegirse de ésta que era turbulenta, confusa y la mayoría de las veces su psique parecía tener querencia a separarse del cauce de la realidad objetiva»

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 960€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de El caso Teselas que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Alfonso Cuenca vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.
story_txt:
¿Qué?
El caso Teselas es una novela de género que desborda ironía y contiene un importante tema acerca de la naturaleza de nuestra sociedad.
Corre el año 1975 y el dictador Francisco Franco agoniza. El pueblo español espera el inevitable desenlace entre esperanzado y confuso por el futuro que le aguarda a su país. Los más avezados van tomando posiciones para no quedarse rezagados en una carrera cuya meta final parece ser la tan ansiada democracia. Por su parte, un extraño personaje que responde al nombre de Eduardo Teselas se ve envuelto en una insólita historia de conspiración en torno a la misteriosa desaparición del Gobernador del Banco de España.          Acompañado de Laudelino Lajarín, un comisario de policía cuyos métodos deductivos son poco ortodoxos, se verá envuelto en una aventura en la que empresarios, financieros y políticos clandestinos parecen empeñados en influir en la medida de sus posibilidades en el nuevo orden social que se avecina. Sin ser consciente del relevante papel que su actuación va a deparar en el devenir de los acontecimientos, Eduardo afronta, entre resignado y confuso, una investigación que le deparará más de una sorpresa.          Una historia detectivesca cuyo telón de fondo no es otro que las relaciones de poder y las consecuencias que se derivan de ellas, especialmente sobre los sufridos españoles de a pie que ignoran, en gran medida, los tejemanejes de las clases dirigentes. story:
Who are we? 

We are three mental health advocates: Hattie Gladwell, James Conlon and Anneli Roberts, starting an online mental health publication for people with mental illness - and those interested in mental illness - BY people with mental illness. We will share mental health pieces from experienced and new writers, offering opinion pieces, personal essays, mental health news, studies, listicles and more. 

We want to showcase people's talent, and remind mental health writers that their work is worthy of being paid for.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise £5,000 so that we can create a big enough budget to promote our website, PAY our writers (something that a lot of people don't do when it comes to mental health writing) and make sure we can bring you the best content. To be transparent, we are taking a lot of time to launch and edit and make sure the website is the best it can be for you all, and so we need to make some money from it ourselves. We are also looking at marketing costs, sponsorships - but really we just want to be able to share the stories of as many mental health writers as possible, and make sure they are compensated for their time, effort and talent. 

If you donate, you will get exclusive access to a mental health newsletter written by Anneli, James and Hattie, and you will also get an early look at the launch of the website, plus weekly updates on writers we've got onboard and pieces to look forward to.

You will also get to read three exclusive pieces over the next month, before they are launched online. 

If we don't meet the funding goal, we will use what we have raised to pay as many writers as possible, and to get the website out there with promotion. 

The Impact

We think this is an important project for many. There are little publications out there - with the exception of a few - focusing mainly on mental health and everything that incorporates it - including physical health, dating, sex, friendships, worklife and more. And our niche? We are only commissioning those with experience of mental illness - whether that be suffering themselves, or experience of someone else suffering.

There are so many mental health writers out there who don't get the opportunity to share their work - or don't get paid for it - and we want to change that. We want to show writers that their work is amazing, and most of all, appreciated, and worthy of fair pay. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate, don't worry! We thank you for your time reading this. If you would like to help us out though, please do share our campaign and encourage other people to donate. We will love you for it!

story:
Many people know about the Cuban Missile Crisis of 1962 when it was by pure chance that a nuclear war between the USA and the USSR did not start. Only two hours before the war was to begin, the White House finally received a telegram from Moscow. Immediately following that, President Kennedy canceled the invasion of Cuba, where 40 thousand Soviet troops and missiles with nuclear warheads were deployed. The confrontation was caused by the Soviet Union secretly deploying ballistic missiles in Cuba and aiming them at 60 major US cities.

Why did I decide to write this novel? Miraculously, a nuclear war never happened at that time. Yet I wonder, “Well, it did work out that one time. And then on two more instances. What if the fourth time is not the charm and a miracle will not happen?”

Life on Earth might have begun by pure chance, yet this means that it must end by chance, too.

In this novel, you will find politics, intelligence games, love, and even the devil, who pushes people to the edge of the abyss.

A lot has been written about the 1962 Cuban Crisis. However, what actually caused a sensation was the permission given to the Russian participants of those events to finally tell the truth in 2002. As it turned out, Soviet missile men in Cuba could all by themselves have launched 64 missiles with nuclear warheads at major US cities. American generals and politicians did not know about that, and they insisted that President Kennedy order an airstrike on those missiles. Only the patience of the President of the United States saved the whole world from a nuclear war. Otherwise, about seven thousand missiles with nuclear warheads would have taken off. The USSR and Europe would have been completely destroyed, and the United States would have been partially affected. That is, about 50 million people could have died.

As far as the United States is concerned, I found enough material here to write this novel. Yet in the USSR, everything was classified and I had to collect the information bit by bit. The peculiarity of this novel is that I create a complete picture of those troubling days, both in the White House and in the Kremlin. The world was hanging by a thread those days, and what is most terrible and vexing is that the reason for this conflict was the adventurism of one person - the head of the USSR N. Khrushchev.

What prompted me to write this novel?

I am already old, and I want my children and grandchildren to have clear blue skies over their heads. The life of the entire planet should not depend on the possibility of someone accidentally pushing the nuclear button.

People began to forget about the horrors of Hiroshima, and they mistakenly believe that
the likelihood of a nuclear war is next to zero. This is not true. After reading this novel, I
want people to fight for nuclear disarmament, especially in the United States, Russia and
China. Our life must not end by accident.

About author

I am 60 years old. Unfortunately, the story of my creative work is sad. I lived in the USSR and then in the dictatorial Republic of Uzbekistan, where the president shot about a thousand people who attended a rally. At the time, I was a journalist. I worked for an American publication. The authorities persecuted my family and me; although I wrote eight novels, I could not publish my books. Only four years ago, after the death of the dictator, my books began to get published.

What will the collected money be spent on?

Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Translator will translate my manuscript from Russian to English.
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript.
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting of my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book.

story:
The Inprint Dotted Journal is a hybrid of the world's best journals!

The Inprint dotted journal is the perfect way to imagine, create and plan your future. Simply use the dotted journal to track your daily life and reach your goals. Be inspired to improve your life with the bullet journaling method.

I've used and filled over 40 journals in my life and learned a lot about what works best for a bullet journal, using that knowledge I've created something that combines the functional and aesthetic aspects of the top-selling journals in the world. I truly believe this is the world's best bullet journal.

A WAY TO INSPIRE

A bullet journal is a way towards creativity growing in life. Using a bullet journal will increase productivity and improve how you live through tracking habits and goals you want to achieve.

I want everyone to feel inspired by using the Inprint dotted journal, as the simple premium feel ignites creativity and a feeling of delight with every page filled.

MY INSPIRATION

The reason I wanted to create my own bullet journal is that I've never found one I truly love and enjoy using. Some of the bullet journals were unreliable in quality, too expensive or just had something missing (like a pen loop or 2 bookmarks). So, I set out to make the best journal I possibly could for a fair price.

Comes shrink-wrapped and protected in a premium box.

160gsm bleed/ghost proof paper.

2 bookmarks.

Perfect sized back pocket.

100% lay-flat design.

Pen loop.

PAPER TEST.

The Inprint dotted journal takes the best attributes of all the journals I have ever used and combines them to make a new journal for everyone to enjoy!

Some other Dotted journals are:

  • Unreliable in quality
  • Expensive
  • Prone to ghosting and bleeding
  • Made with rough or thin paper

Inprint Dotted Journal is:

  • Built & checked to a high standard
  • Affordable
  • Ghost and bleed proof
  • Using thick smooth paper (160gsm)

 Inprint Dotted Journal info:

  • Dimensions: 5.8″ x 8.3″ 148mm x 210mm (A5)
  • Pages: 160 Dotted
  • Paper Weight: 160GSM
  • Paper Color: White
  • Dot Spacing: 5mm
  • Faux Leather Cover
  • Includes Protective Box/packaging
  • Watercolor / Brush Pen Friendly
  • High Ink Compatibility
  • Back Pocket
  • Lays Completely Flat
  • Two Bookmarks
  • Elastic Band Closure
  • Pen Holder
  • Handmade
  • 100% Vegan
  • Shipped From Japan
  • All Material Eco-Friendly
  • FSC Certified
  • Superior Quality

Inprint - のドット方眼ノートはバレットジャーナル用に作成した、今世界に存在するノートの良いとこ取りノート！

INSPIRATION
 人生で40冊以上のノートや手帳を使ってきた経験を生かして、バレットジャーナルに何よりも適したノートを作りました。
 現在市場に出ているものはどれも何かが欠けている（ページの厚さ、裏移り、値段、しおりの数など…）と感じたので自分で作っちゃおう！と思い立ち半年。
 できるだけお手頃で、ハイクオリティなものを作ろうと試行錯誤しついに完成！

 バレットジャーナルは日々を効率よく実りの多いものにするのに効果的なメソッド。
 日常管理、目標管理、To Doリスト管理にクリエイティビティを追加して楽しく目標達成を！

FEATURES

 ケースと真空包装で保護して郵送
 （ケースは開封後も保管時用に使用できます）
 ハイクオリティで長持ち
 ５ｍｍのドット方眼
 160gsm　(ｇ/㎡) の厚さで裏移りも裏抜けもなし
 水彩絵の具や筆ペンにも最適な良質の紙
 シンプルな黒にゴールドのアクセント
 合皮ハードカバー
 しおり２つ付き
 使いやすいサイズの巻末マチ付きポケット
 100％平開きで書き心地抜群
 便利なペンホルダー付き
 A5サイズ

Built & checked to a high standard
Affordable

Inprint - のドット方眼ノートはバレットジャーナル用に作成した、今世界に存在するノートの良いとこ取りノート！INSPIRATION 人生で40冊以上のノートや手帳を使ってきた経験を生かして、バレットジャーナルに何よりも適したノートを作りました。 現在市場に出ているものはどれも何かが欠けている（ページの厚さ、裏移り、値段、しおりの数など…）と感じたので自分で作っちゃおう！と思い立ち半年。 できるだけお手頃で、ハイクオリティなものを作ろうと試行錯誤しついに完成！ バレットジャーナルは日々を効率よく実りの多いものにするのに効果的なメソッド。 日常管理、目標管理、To Doリスト管理にクリエイティビティを追加して楽しく目標達成を！FEATURES ケースと真空包装で保護して郵送 （ケースは開封後も保管時用に使用できます） ハイクオリティで長持ち ５ｍｍのドット方眼 160gsm　(ｇ/㎡) の厚さで裏移りも裏抜けもなし 水彩絵の具や筆ペンにも最適な良質の紙 シンプルな黒にゴールドのアクセント 合皮ハードカバー しおり２つ付き 使いやすいサイズの巻末マチ付きポケット 100％平開きで書き心地抜群 便利なペンホルダー付き A5サイズ

story:
"Why do my teeth fall out? ... Where do they go? ... How do they feel?" - Brendan, 10.

This is what my (smart and empathetic as heck) brother Brendan said when his tooth fell out.

Then he came to me with the idea for characters in a children's book: Toothie and Roothie. 

How could I NOT write it? So, here were are, some time later, with a close-to-final product. 

I need to make this book a reality for him, and for my other siblings, Ryan and Sarah. They are my world, and I'd like to think this book might help, in some small way, directly benefit their future education. 

We are currently raising funds in order to fully hire our illustrator, Mert Genccinar, who lives in Turkey. We also will need to stash some dough away for publishing fees. 

We would love it if you could help us make our dream come true! Every dollar counts. 

And in appreciation, we will send anyone who contributes $50 or more a signed, advance copy of the manuscript... (which may actually be worth something someday). 

Love,

Meg and Brendan

story:
Welcome friends! I  finally made a decision to investigate my spiritual connection to Mesoamerican people, culture, and their symbols, specifically the Quetzalcoatl, or the "feathered serpent," which I first encountered in the ancient Mexican city of Teohihuacan. While there, atop the Pyramid Of The Moon, I tapped into the site's mysterious energy field and was able to  briefly move an object with my mind. Yes, I know that sounds crazy but I can assure you it happened for real. It was a life-changing moment and the surrounding Quetzacoatl imagery was irrefutably related to it. Following that experience, I began reading books by Carl Jung and Joseph Campbell and now firmly believe in the 'collective unconscious,' archetypes, and the 'Hero's Journey.' It is within us all and I'm going in deep. I am also using this opportunity to finish a personal essay entitled, 'Chasing Quetzalcoatl,' which will be told in two parts. Part I is already finished. It is roughly 6,000 words at the moment. It examines my connection to Mesoamerican people throughout my life, including one powerful romantic relationship, and how I eventually discovered the Quetzalcoatl symbol. Part 2 will focus on this upcoming trip and put all I see and learn on the road into context. I hope it will inspire others to start their own personal investigative journeys. I humbly ask for your financial support to make this a rewarding life experience, one that I can share with you each step of the way. Your donations will help pay for the following specific things:

*Plane travel

*Bus travel between cities

*Lodging (hostels)

*Technology related to documenting trip (quality external mics, cameras, etc)

*Food

*Border fees/site fees 

*Mini-travel guitar

The following "perks" will be offered at various tiers of donation:

*E-mail updates from trip

*Digital, PDF copy of 'Chasing Quetzalcoatl,' a personal essay investigating my connection to Mesoamerican people, culture, and symbols told in two parts, Part I (pre-trip) and Part II (post-trip).

*Personal postcard sent to your physical address from trip

*Personal gift sent to your physical address from trip

*Acoustic song recorded at an ancient Mayan site and sent to you digitally

*2 hr solo musical performance by me (within 100 miles)

*2 hr full band (my band) musical performance  (within 100 miles)

It is unlike me to ask for money but it will allow me the flexibility to do the appropriate research without stressing out about how I'm getting to the next city.  Basically I'm going "all in," to use a poker term. Come with me on this thing. I'll share any and all valuable information I may gain from it. I humbly ask you for your donation and hope to communicate to you from the jungle. Thank you! -Matt

story:
Twilight's List: Third Print Run

Kittyhawk, aka Kits, here again. Thanks to the desire and fervor of a person who wishes to remain anonymous, I'm once again doing a print run on Twilight's List.

It's been nearly three years since I ran the first print run of List that garnered around 45 orders. In the years since, I've gotten a few sporadic requests for copies of the book. While I had extras, I ran out of stock about a year ago. Last week, a person who dearly wanted a copy of the book was confronted with a choice: print a one-off (at around $180) or attempt to get another print run done. He (she?) got enough interest going that I decided to attempt to get a third printing off the ground.

This is a campaign to raise the money needed to order a print run. I'm expecting around 20 orders, and attempting to balance the price-per-copy around that. If I get them, this will raise the total orders for List to around 70. Frankly, that is astonishing.I'm totally humbled by the fact that people love this story enough to want to pay for a print copy. The fact that there is still demand four years after it was published just blows my mind. This is for you guys as much as it is for me.

With that in mind, this is, again, a one-off print run. I'll be collecting the capital to buy the books, pay shipping, and then send them on out to the purchasers. I may purchase a few copies to hold against future demand, but I won't be opening a storefront or anything.

What We Need & What You Get

If you're unfamiliar with Twilight's List, then you should know you that you can read it at the link above for the mere cost of viewing the hosting site's ads. You don't need an account or anything. (Also, HI. I've no clue how you stumbled upon this page.) I need around $750 to pay for a ~20 book run of List, shipping, packaging, and IGG's cut. 
For $45 + shipping, you'll get the following
  • A copy of the book, signed (if desired) by me, its author
  • A dust jacket with art by Underpable
  • 12 full page, black and white chapter heading images, mostly by me, but with a Madmax epilogue and one by Somepony the Vectorer.
Right now, Shipping is based on a weight of 1 lbs and my experience sending out the first two print runs. I've done $5 for US?Canada and $10 for Europe. I can add more countries, but it's a lot of work to figure out shipping costs to every country ever. If you don't see your country on the list, contact me and I can add it.

Timeline

According to the documentation on this site, it might take up to 15 days to actually get the money from Indiegogo. So after the campaign ends, I'll post updates on what they tell me about the funds. When I have them, I'll fire off the order to Book1one. Last time, it took them about 3 weeks to get me my books. I've no clue what their queue is like these days. I'll keep this site updated with news as I hear about it. I'll start creating packing slips the day I order the books, so they should be ready to go once I receive them. I'll send them out in groups: one international, one domestic. I'll email everyone the tracking number (which may or may not do you a lot of good if you're not in the US) so you can see where your package is. All told, it might be up to 9 weeks from the start of this campaign until you get the book. Sorry for the long lead time.


Why So Expensive?

If you've never delved into the world of quality printing, it's not a cheap process. Especially for small book runs like this. I use Book1one to do small print runs, and am very happy with the result, but it's not cheap. Each additional book ordered will reduce the price per book by a little, but it's not a plate-process. I'd need to get several hundred orders (300+) to make that a viable plan. 

Since I can not comprehend a successful campaign for the above case, I'm sticking to a very high quality, non-plate process. They output is indistinguishable from any of the hardbacks I've bought from Amazon or brick and mortar book stores. The ink is very dark, the paper is actually on the higher quality side of what I own, and there is no "transparency" issues with seeing text through the page. I also have not had any ink smudge due to sweaty fingers.

The book is standard hardback size (9.25"x6.25", as I recall), and has 157 numbered pages in 12 chapters. Page numbers follow standard book conventions and all that jazz. I make use of running chapter titles, fancy section separators, and a custom page footer.  I've linked it a few times already, but I have a gallery of images of what the book looks like. The only differences between this copy and the depicted one, will be the cloth cover color; I'll use a different option than from the first edition.

The interior and cover art can be viewed online. A trimmed version of the PDF used for printing is also available. It lacks the blank end-leaves, the attribution notice, and the padding needed for binding, but it generated from the same project files as the copy I send to the publisher. I will be updating the afterwards for this edition as well.
As for shipping, I've used USPS to generate prices for a 1 Lbs rigid 10x8 envelope and that these are the nearest-dollar prices it spat out. Shipping got expensive at some point. Sorry.

Other Ways You Can Help

So yeah, I've looked at this PDF about 300 times since it was first generated, and another 20 or so for the second print run. Even now, years later, I still find myself glazing over re-reading it. Anyone who wants to send in grammar, typos, or other derps is not only welcomed to, but encouraged. I'll give it a few more passes since I charging people money for it again, but many eyes shallow errors make, right?

story:
Short Summary

I'm Laurie Levinger. I've been collecting testimonies from Maya survivors of the Guatemalan civil war for the past 10 years. In 2009 I published a book of these testimonies in Spanish, "Cual guerra? Testimonios de sobrevivientes Mayas" and in 2010 the book was published in the US ("What War? Testimonies of Maya Survivors"). 

I am raising money now to publish a new book of testimonies in Spanish titled "Guerra inconclusa: La voz de sobrevientes" ("Unfinished War:The Voice of Survivors"). I decided to write this book because recently the Guatemalan government issued a proclamation declaring that genocide had never taken place in Guatemala. This new book will make public more survivors' stories of displacement, terror and murder to counter this official denial.

It is critically important that the reality of survivors' experiences be added to the public record. This history will also serve to educate young Guatemalans who did not live during this period. These testimonies will help break the culture of silence which still exists in Guatemala today.

My previous book,  "Cual guerra? Testimonies de sobreviventes Mayas" has been very meaningful to individuals whose stories have been published as it serves to validate the reality of their experiences. I am confident that "Guerra inconclusa" will have the same effect.

What We Need & What You Get

The project has a budget of $6,000. Funds will pay for the cost of translating, transcribing and editing interviews. The cost of publishing 500 copies of the book in Guatemala is approximately $2,000, with additional expenses for duplicating the dvd which will be included.

Perks range from a heartfelt thank you note to hand beaded "animalito" keychains to a handwoven woolen blanket from Momostenango. The ultimate perk is a reading at the location of your choice (in New England). I'll be happy to travel further afield if my transportation costs are covered.

 
See more perks in the Gallery

The Impact

My personal experience talking with individuals who have given testimonies which were published in "Cual guerra?" convinces me of the importance of this work. The following quotes are from August 2014 when I met with some of the young adults who had given testimonies 9 years before. I asked if they'd had any negative consequences from telling their story:

Flor said, "We haven´t had any negative effects, but one positive aspect that I am really happy about is when I took the book home for the first time, I showed it to my Dad, and it was like he was reading part of his own life...  And then there´s my sister who didn´t know anything about what happened, she was very small... so, the fact that my sister got interested in her family history and from that time she became a little closer to my dad,"

Hector said, "Before giving my testimony I asked my Dad and he is the one who  used to tell me and my brothers and sisters that we should be quiet. I told him that some people are giving their testimonies and he told me, 'now times are different, now you can tell the story of what happened to us'”.

Risks & Challenges

Most of the testimonies have been translated and transcribed. Maya Na'oj, a Maya publisher, has signed a contract to publish the book. Once funds are available I will be able to pay for publication and distribution of the book in Guatemala. I am confident that with your help I can bring this book forward.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways you can be helpful to this project. Financial support, while appreciated, is just one of them. Sharing information about the project with friends and colleagues who might be interested is important. Letting people know about the survivors who have the courage to tell their stories and trust that we will share them with the rest of the world is important as well. Time and time again people have asked me "Do people in the US know what happened to us here in Guatemala?" The more of us who know about this genocide the less likely it is that it will happen again.

story:
There is a long tradition of art, of poetry, of music, of the making of beautiful things, that runs through multiple generations of the De Paz family. And at the center of this tradition is the late Oscar dePaz, father, grandfather, great grandfather, and poet patriarch, unwavering patriot, ‘poet laureate’ of Jayuya, Puerto Rico, bohemian, baseball lover and, as remembered by his grandchildren, master maker of bistec and habichuellas. Romantic, a dreamer of beauty.

To honor his memory and in gratitude for Oscar’s inspiration to two generations of artists, musicians and poets, his son Gilberto de Paz has put to music a choice selection of his best poems in a beautifully arranged CD, a just and proper tribute to the patriarch of our family artistic tradition.

The CD will be presented in April 2015 in an event at the historic Thomas Center in Gainesville, Florida. For that occasion, we want to publish a small poem book that will bring together a select sample of his poems, including the ones selected for the CD, for participants in this presentation, which we expect to be a beautiful evening of music, poetry and art - a modest endeavor to honor a man that infused a modest life with an epic zest and modeled the poet and artist to his grateful children and grandchildren. Books that are not distributed the night of the event, will be available in local independent bookstores.

Risks and challenges

The CD is recorded and published. The book is laid out. We just need your help to take it to the printer. We are only waiting for your support!


Para honrar el recuerdo y el legado de inspiración del poeta jayuyano Oscar de Paz, su hijo Gilberto de Paz ha musicalizado una selección de su poesía en un CD con arreglos de Amaury Lopez Jackson.

El CD se presentará en Abril 2015 en un evento histórico en el Thomas Center de Gainesville, Florida. Para acompañar la presentación del CD y ayudar a dar a conocer su poesía, queremos juntar en un modesto poemario una muestra selecta de lo mejor de su poesía, incluyendo los poemas seleccionados para el CD, para completar lo que esperamos será una bella noche de música, poesía y arte.  Los poemarios que no se distribuyan la noche de la presentación se distribuirán localmente en librerías independientes. Una modesta propuesta en honor de quien vivió y modeló para sus agradecidos hijos y nietos el alma del poeta y el artista.

Un donativo a cualquier nivel será enormemente agradecido, pero también ofrecemos premios a varios niveles para aquellos de ustedes que quieran acompañarnos más generosamente en esta jornada.
