story:
Story of My Book

Reins Pulling Bronco is about a child of the new world order who yearns for independence in a society ruled by a golden generation, blatantly consuming the working class for the benefit of their daily operations. With the birth of her unrelated brother and recent disappearance of lead ranchers, Bronco must decide whether to put her life on hold for the sake of Bronco Ranch or live out her dreams traveling beyond the terrains and control of Ultreu.

My name is Kyle Bardell and I am the author of Reins Pulling Bronco. I wrote this book to achieve a childhood dream of writing my own novel as well as exploring the lessons of the world through my own eyes. My hope is to provide a shining light to the lost Black Youth of today, in hopes for a better future tomorrow. 

In reading this book, one will relate the choices of the characters to a decision they made in their own life. I want this book to open one’s eyes to the beauty and darkness we can find within ourselves. Listen to each character as they all follow their own individual paths as if they each have a lesson to teach. Containing a wide range of characters, one should be able to relate-- no matter the reader’s perspective.


A select few perceived to be the source of prosperity spent their lives to build a home for the future generations to flourish. With efforts to sustain their exponential growth, this “golden generation“ gave each basic resource— wood, ore, agriculture, and livestock— a separate territory in order to complete the construction of the new capital Ultreu. Learning from their mistakes at the unfinished Tower of Prestinia, Ultreu devised a system of diplomacy eliminating differences in education and social standing for the benefit of the society and to repair the changes in the climate caused by the tower’s construction. While resource allocation solely depends on a unit’s dependency to the capital, the capital’s only job is to distribute resources.

The changing of seasons bring out the Ice-Walkers— or as Bronco describes them, Blockheads. Their skin is pale-blue like the ice blocks encapsulating whatever lies atop their shoulders. Traveling in packs, these human-like creatures migrate with the moving winter storm— a never ending blizzard that travels around the island of Alprova. Jericho, a lead rancher of Bronco’s unit, informed Bronco to pay the monsters no mind and let them wander through the snow. Their origin is unknown and their existence is little acknowledged by most, until the lights of Prestinia’s Tower begin to glow.


You will love this book if you enjoy adventure, philosophy, and allegorical storytelling.

Reins Pulling Bronco speaks to the Black Youth, particularly those who are considered losted in today's world.

Ultimately, I hope that Reins Pulling Bronco inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging topics like:
  • The impact on our surrounding environment
  • The need for order in our lives.
  • The value of our generational traumas

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing generational knowledge, narcissism, and self-discovery will change us all for the better.

 

Book's Artistic Approach, Mission, and Vision

The world has grown in technology, knowledge, and acceptance. The specific teachings of past generations do not pertain to today's world; however, the basic core of the knowledge is still valuable. Sifting through wisdom of my own as well as those interviewed, I wanted to find multiple answers to a single question: "what is something I know now about the world I wish I had known then, that is different--in perspective--from my parents?"

A collective worry I see in my community is the loss of the Black youth-- specifically, the lost in drive and life's purpose. To become lost, one must first be lead astray. When someone becomes lost, the person does not immediately realize it. The individual first experiences an invalidation in their life and begins to look for guidance. Seeking answers, the recently lost is told a reality from another person who possesses unaware traumas and invalidations, breeding a spiral in the new lost soul. Once the new lost soul becomes validated by whatever mindset they have endorsed, one is then troubled with the challenge of changing the accepted perspective. Those lost can only help themselves, because we control our own reality. Attempting to disrupt the spiraling of newly lost souls will result in a cycle of codependency-- where one becomes susceptible to the same fate. 

Instead of forcing blinders onto the youth, as did past generations trying to block the evils out of our worlds, I want to educate and provide a guiding light by using allegorical lives of fictional Black characters. My vision is to have the novel in school systems with high Black/ African-American drop-out rates. The book was written with a young Black girl protagonist, because of the underrepresentation of Black women in fictional novels. I also paid close mind to the portrayal of Black men and how I believe masculinity to be projected today. 

In reading this novel, one will see how it looks to be lost from an outside perspective and how the reactions of those recently lost can impact their immediate surroundings.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August of 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder.)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, eBook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Summer.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!
 

 

About the Author

Receiving an undergraduate bachelor’s degree in Accounting from the American University, Kyle gained experience working with others in influencing and managerial roles. With an acting career stemming from a young age, Kyle now puts his interpersonal skills to use.

His understanding of multiple perspectives and his eye for detail give Kyle the ability to connect in multiple settings among people with different backgrounds. A creative storyteller, Kyle uses his vision to improve whatever he becomes involved with while advocating for authenticity within a person.

For more information, you can connect with Kyle at bardellkyle@gmail.com or his social medias @kylejsbardell.
 

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send a private message.
 

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network.

Follow Kyle on his social medias or subscribe to his blog at www.kylebardell.com to stay connected.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you all so much for your support!

Best,

Kyle J.S. Bardell

story:
Story of My Book

Exceptionally Average: Through Their Eyes is exploring how today's most exceptional young professionals discover how to serve others and unlock their potential.

My name is Tian Shi and I am the author of Exceptionally Average: Through Their Eyes. I wrote this book because I wanted to explore how founders used social entrepreneurship to build fulfilling careers to guide my own soul-searching process. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will be inspired. I want to show you that anyone can cause a ripple of change within their own community. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for entrepreneurship. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you discover your own potential by creating your own path and remaining steadfast to your core values and beliefs.

In this book, you'll learn about what it means to be a servant leader and how to leverage your assets and passions to positively benefit your community. You'll hear stories from...

  • Eric Woods, who left Wall Street to pursue a career in entrepreneurship to benefit his local home community with services that were not present previously.
  • Adele McClure, who was told at a young age she couldn’t attend her dream college because she did not have the academic prowess, set out to change her state’s legislature to empower minority communities from which she came from.
  • Yossuf Albanawi, who used his personal struggles to found a company to prevent the opioid epidemic across the United States.
You will love this book if you want to learn how others achieved their vocational goals, want to explore what the entrepreneurship industry has to offer, or are just searching for a career that truly fulfills your passion.

Exceptionally Average: Through Their Eyes is a nonfiction book that speaks to college students and young professionals who want to look at how to manifest their ideas into a reality and want to embark on their career in a non-traditional way.
 

The Book - Exceptionally Average: Through Their Eyes


The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-3. We’ll learn why serving others is so powerful and ever so important in this day and age where we are all so individually focused. Why is it that if you find a $20 bill, you’ll find more fulfillment spending it on someone else than yourself? And yet, with the rise of social media and individualism, we as a society are becoming more divided and less united. How far will a single act of kindness take you?

Part 2 contains chapters 4-10. We will learn the seven pillars of servant leadership through stories from seventeen entrepreneurs and their lived experiences. Explore how you can create generational wealth through Jervonte’s Edmonds story and how to tackle ingrained social inequalities from Joy Buolamwini’s experience.

Part 3 contains chapters 11-14. We’ll learn how to become a servant leader from nine entrepreneurs. These four chapters investigate how to cultivate leadership in high school, college, as a recent graduate, and how to leverage the support from your immediate network to aid your own journey as an entrepreneur. Hear about Shaun Johnson’s two-decade-long journey to discover his entrepreneurial traits and how others, like Khuram Zuman, discovered his innovative nature at a young age. 
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this spring.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!
 

About the Author

Tian Shi is a student at Georgetown University, studying Biology, Cognitive Science, and Entrepreneurship. She is a mentor, teacher, and intern for a biotechnological startup.

She wrote this book because she wanted to explore how to embark on the non-traditional career path of becoming an entrepreneur to better others. She is curious to explore careers outside of the corporate, 9-5 lifestyle after she graduates college. She took it upon herself to understand the world of innovation in order to make a name for herself and inspire others to do the same.

In her spare time, she likes to explore the city that she’s living in by going for long runs. She likes to cook—pesto pizza with mozzarella is her favorite—paint, draw, and listen to podcasts that she comes across on Spotify, like Daily Ted Talks and Michelle Obama’s podcast.

For more information, you can connect with Tian at ttshi123@gmail.com and at @nait.shi on Instagram.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #throughtheireyes and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Tian Shi

Story of My Book
Exceptionally Average: Through Their Eyes is exploring how today's most exceptional young professionals discover how to serve others and unlock their potential.My name is Tian Shi and I am the author of Exceptionally Average: Through Their Eyes. I wrote this book because I wanted to explore how founders used social entrepreneurship to build fulfilling careers to guide my own soul-searching process. My hope is that, in reading this book, you will be inspired. I want to show you that anyone can cause a ripple of change within their own community. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for entrepreneurship. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you discover your own potential by creating your own path and remaining steadfast to your core values and beliefs.In this book, you'll learn about what it means to be a servant leader and how to leverage your assets and passions to positively benefit your community. You'll hear stories from...

Eric Woods, who left Wall Street to pursue a career in entrepreneurship to benefit his local home community with services that were not present previously.
Adele McClure, who was told at a young age she couldn’t attend her dream college because she did not have the academic prowess, set out to change her state’s legislature to empower minority communities from which she came from.
Yossuf Albanawi, who used his personal struggles to found a company to prevent the opioid epidemic across the United States.
You will love this book if you want to learn how others achieved their vocational goals, want to explore what the entrepreneurship industry has to offer, or are just searching for a career that truly fulfills your passion.Exceptionally Average: Through Their Eyes is a nonfiction book that speaks to college students and young professionals who want to look at how to manifest their ideas into a reality and want to embark on their career in a non-traditional way. The Book - Exceptionally Average: Through Their Eyes
